HP:0000633	眼部异常	Decreased lacrimation	Abnormally decreased lacrimation, that is, reduced ability to produce tears.	流泪减少	流泪异常减少，即产生泪液能力降低。
HP:0000634	眼部异常	Impaired ocular abduction	An impaired ability of the eye to move in the outward direction (towards the side of the head).	眼外展障碍	眼睛向外移动的能力受损（朝向头部的一侧）。
HP:0000635	眼部异常	Blue irides	A markedly blue coloration of the iris.	蓝色虹膜	虹膜的显著蓝色着色。
HP:0000636	头部和颈部的异常	Upper eyelid coloboma	A short discontinuity of the margin of the `upper eyelid` (FMA:54439).	上眼睑缺损	上眼睑的部分缺失导致眼睑变短畸形
HP:0000637	头部和颈部的异常	Long palpebral fissure	Distance between medial and lateral canthi is more than two standard deviations above the mean for age (objective); or, apparently increased length of the palpebral fissures.	长睑裂	内侧和外侧眼角之间的距离比同年龄平均值大两个以上的标准偏差（客观）;或者，睑裂长度显得增加。
HP:0000639	眼部异常	Nystagmus	Rhythmic, involuntary oscillations of one or both eyes related to abnormality in fixation, conjugate gaze, or vestibular mechanisms.	眼球震颤	一种规律性，非自主的单眼或双眼震颤，震颤的双眼不能固视、共轭凝视，或前庭病变。
HP:0000640	眼部异常	Gaze-evoked nystagmus	Nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left.	凝视诱发眼震	眼球震颤在向右或向左凝视的时候变得明显。
HP:0000641	眼部异常	Dysmetric saccades	The controller signal for saccadic eye movements has two components: the pulse that moves the eye rapidly from one point to the next, and the step that holds the eye in the new position. When both the pulse and the step are not the correct size, a dysmetric refixation eye movement results.	Dysmetric 扫视	眼球扫视时的控制器信号有两个组成部分:脉冲控制眼球从一点到另一点快速移动，之后保持眼睛在该位置不动。当脉冲和凝视不匹配时，dysmetric再注视即发生了。
HP:0000642	眼部异常	Red-green dyschromatopsia	Difficulty with discriminating red and green hues.	红绿色觉障碍	识别红色和绿色色调困难。
HP:0000643	神经系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Blepharospasm	A focal dystonia that affects the muscles of the eyelids and brow, associated with involuntary recurrent spasm of both eyelids.	眼睑痉挛	影响眼睑和额头的肌肉局部肌张力障碍，伴有双眼睑不自主复发性痉挛。
HP:0000646	眼部异常	Amblyopia	Reduced visual acuity that is uncorrectable by lenses in the absence of detectable anatomic defects in the eye or visual pathways.	弱视	无法利用镜片矫正的视力敏度下降，眼球和视觉通路无可见的解剖学缺陷。
HP:0000647	眼部异常	Sclerocornea	A congenital anomaly in which a part or the whole of the cornea acquires the characteristics of sclera, resulting in clouding of the cornea.	角膜巩膜化	先天性异常，其中部分或全部的角膜获得巩膜的特性，从而导致角膜混浊。
HP:0000648	眼部异常	Optic atrophy	`Atrophy` (MPATH:127) of the `optic nerve` (FMA:50863). Optic atrophy results from the death of the retinal ganglion cell axons that comprise the optic nerve and manifesting as a pale optic nerve on fundoscopy.	视神经萎缩	视神经萎缩是由于视网膜神经节细胞轴突死亡所致，表现为眼底检查中视神经乳头颜色灰暗。
HP:0000649	眼部异常	Abnormality of vision evoked potentials	An anomaly of visually evoked potentials (VEP), which are electrical potentials, initiated by brief visual stimuli, which are recorded from the scalp overlying the visual cortex.	视觉诱发电位异常	视觉诱发的电位异常（VEP），是短暂的视觉刺激启动的电势，在视觉皮层外方的头皮上记录。
HP:0000650	眼部异常	Reduced amplitude of pattern visual evoked potentials	Reduced amplitude of pattern visual evoked potentials	多导视觉诱发电位振幅降低	多导视觉诱发的电位振幅降低
HP:0000651	眼部异常	Diplopia	Diplopia is a condition in which a single object is perceived as two images, it is also known as double vision.	复视	复视是指一个对象被感知为两个图像。
HP:0000652	头部和颈部的异常	Lower eyelid coloboma	A short discontinuity of the margin of the `lower eyelid` (FMA:54442).	下眼睑缺损	下眼睑的下沿存在断裂。
HP:0000653	头部和颈部的异常,体壁的异常	Sparse eyelashes	Decreased density/number of eyelashes.	睫毛稀疏	睫毛密度降低或数量减少。
HP:0000654	眼部异常	Decreased electroretinogram (ERG) amplitude	Descreased amplitude of eletrical response upon electroretinography.	视网膜电图振幅降低	视网膜电图上的电反应幅度降低。
HP:0000655	眼部异常	Vitreoretinal degeneration	Gradual deterioration of the vitreous humor and retina.	玻璃体视网膜变性	玻璃体和视网膜的渐进性变性。
HP:0000656	头部和颈部的异常	Ectropion	An outward turning (eversion) or rotation of the eyelid margin.	眼睑外翻	眼睑边缘向外翻转（外翻）或旋转。
HP:0000657	神经系统异常,眼部异常	Oculomotor apraxia	Inability to follow objects visually with compensatory head movements, decreased smooth pursuit, and cancellation of the vestibulo-ocular reflex.	动眼运动异常	即使有代偿性头运动，也无法直观地跟随物体，平滑移动减弱，前庭眼反射消失。
HP:0000658	神经系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Eyelid apraxia	Eyelid apraxia is manifested as involuntary levator muscle suppression and orbicularis oculi muscle inhibition. It is one of the typical signs of Parkinson's disease in the elderly.	眼睑失用症	不自主的提睑肌抑制及眼轮匝肌抑制。是老年人帕金森病的典型体征之一。
HP:0000659	眼部异常	Peters anomaly	A form of anterior segment dysgenesis in which abnormal cleavage of the anterior chamber occurs. Peters anomaly is characterized by central, paracentral, or complete corneal opacity.	Peters 综合征	眼前段异常的一种综合征，前房异常缺失，通常表现为中央，中央旁，或完全的角膜混浊。
HP:0000660	心血管系统异常,眼部异常	Lipemia retinalis	A creamy appearance of the retinal blood vessels that occurs when the concentration of lipids in the blood are extremely increased, with pale pink to milky white retinal vessels and altered pale reflexes from choroidal vasculature.	视网膜脂血症	视网膜血管有乳脂状的外观，当血液中的脂质浓度极度增大，视网膜血管呈现浅粉色到乳白色，脉络膜血管浅反射改变。
HP:0000661	头部和颈部的异常	Palpebral fissure narrowing on adduction	#####	睑裂内收狭窄	#####
HP:0000662	眼部异常	Night blindness	Inability to see well at night or in poor light.	夜盲症	在夜间或光线不佳时视物不清。
HP:0000664	头部和颈部的异常,体壁的异常	Synophrys	Meeting of the medial `eyebrows` (FMA:54237) in the midline.	连眉	两侧眉毛在中线处（FMA:54237）会合。
HP:0000666	眼部异常	Horizontal nystagmus	Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements.	水平眼震	眼球震颤由横向来回的眼球运动组成。
HP:0000667	眼部异常	Phthisis bulbi	Atrophy of the eyeball with blindness and decreased intraocular pressure due to end-stage intraocular disease.	眼球痨	失明的眼球萎缩，并因终末期眼内疾病导致眼内压降低。
HP:0000668	头部和颈部的异常	Hypodontia	A developmental anomaly characterized by a `reduced number of` (PATO:0001999) teeth, whereby up to 6 teeth are missing.	缺牙症	牙齿数量减少的发育异常，可多达6颗牙齿缺失。
HP:0000670	头部和颈部的异常	Carious teeth	Caries is a multifactorial bacterial infection affecting the structure of the tooth. This term has been used to describe the presence of more than expected dental caries.	龋齿	龋齿是影响牙齿结构的多因素细菌感染。该术语被用于描述的比预期更多的龋齿存在。
HP:0000674	头部和颈部的异常	Anodontia	The congenital `absence` (PATO:0002000) of all teeth.	无牙畸形	先天性缺失所有牙齿。
HP:0000675	头部和颈部的异常	Macrodontia of permanent maxillary central incisor	`Increased size` (PATO:0000586) of the `maxillary central secondary incisor tooth` (FMA:55722).	恒上颌中门巨牙	恒上颌中切牙尺寸增加。
HP:0000676	头部和颈部的异常	Abnormality of the incisor	An abnormality of the `Incisor tooth` (FMA:12823).	切牙异常	切牙的异常。
HP:0000677	头部和颈部的异常	Oligodontia	A developmental anomaly characterized by a `reduced number of` (PATO:0001999) teeth, whereby more than 6 teeth are missing.	少牙畸形	以牙齿数目减少为特征的发育异常`（PATO:0001999），超过6颗牙齿缺失。
HP:0000678	头部和颈部的异常	Dental crowding	Overlapping teeth within an alveolar ridge.	牙齿排列过挤	牙槽嵴内牙齿的重叠。
HP:0000679	头部和颈部的异常	Taurodontia	`Increased volume` (PATO:0000595) of `dental pulp` (FMA:55631) of `permanent molar` (FMA:84207).	牙髓腔增大	恒大臼齿的牙髓腔增大。
HP:0000680	头部和颈部的异常	Delayed eruption of primary teeth	`Delayed` (PATO:0000502) `tooth eruption` (MeSH:D014078) affecting the `primary dentition` (FMA:75151).	乳牙萌出延迟	影响乳牙列的牙齿萌出的延迟。
HP:0000682	结缔组织异常,骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Abnormality of dental enamel	An abnormality of the `dental enamel` (FMA:55629).	牙釉质异常	牙釉质的异常
HP:0000683	结缔组织异常,骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Grayish enamel	A `grey` (PATO:0000950) `discoloration` (PATO:0000331) of the `dental enamel` (FMA:55629).	灰色牙釉质	牙釉质出现灰色变色
HP:0000684	头部和颈部的异常	Delayed eruption of teeth	`Delayed` (PATO:0000502) `tooth eruption` (MeSH:D014078), which can be defined as tooth eruption more than 2 SD beyond the mean eruption age.	牙齿萌出延迟	牙齿萌出的延迟，定义为牙齿萌出年龄比平均值大2个标准偏差。
HP:0000685	头部和颈部的异常	Hypoplasia of teeth	Developmental hypoplasia of `teeth` (FMA:12516).	牙齿发育不全	牙齿发育不全。
HP:0000687	头部和颈部的异常	Widely spaced teeth	Increased spaces (diastemata) between most of the teeth in the same dental arch.	牙间隙增宽	在相同的牙列中大部分牙齿之间的距离（齿隙）增大。
HP:0000689	头部和颈部的异常	Dental malocclusion	Dental malocclusion refers to an abnormality of the occlusion, or alignment, of the teeth and the way the upper and lower teeth fit together, resulting in overcrowding of teeth or in abnormal bite patterns.	牙齿错位咬合	牙齿错位咬合指牙齿咬合或对齐的异常，以及上下牙齿契合方式的异常，从而导致牙齿排列过挤或咬合模式异常。
HP:0000690	头部和颈部的异常	Agenesis of maxillary lateral incisor	`Agenesis` (MPATH:57) of one or more maxillary lateral incisor, comprising the `maxillary lateral primary incisor` (FMA84217) and `maxillary lateral secondary incisor` (FMA:55724).	上颌侧切牙发育不全	一个或多个上颌侧切牙发育不全，包括乳上颌侧切牙和恒颌上侧切牙。
HP:0000691	头部和颈部的异常	Microdontia	`Decreased size` (PATO:0000587) of the `teeth` (FMA:12516), which can be defined as a mesiodistal tooth diameter (width) more than 2 SD below mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased maximum width of tooth.	小牙畸形	牙齿的尺寸减小，定义为近中侧到远侧的牙齿直径（宽度）低于平均值超过2个标准偏差。或者，牙齿的最大宽度显得减小。
HP:0000692	头部和颈部的异常	Misalignment of teeth	Abnormal alignment, positioning, or spacing of the teeth, i.e., `misaligned` (PATO:0001654) `teeth` (FMA:12516).	牙列不齐	牙齿的排列，定位或者间距异常，即牙齿排列不齐。
HP:0000694	结缔组织异常,骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Shell teeth	A type of dental dysplasia occurring in dentinogenesis imperfecta in which the pulp chambers are enlarged and there is a reduced amount of coronal dentin.	壳状牙	一种累及牙本质的牙齿发育不全，表现为牙髓腔增大，牙本质减少。
HP:0000695	头部和颈部的异常	Natal tooth	Erupted tooth or teeth at birth.	胎生牙齿	出生时已萌出的牙齿。
HP:0000696	头部和颈部的异常	Delayed eruption of permanent teeth	`Delayed` (PATO:0000502) `tooth eruption` (MeSH:D014078) affecting the `secondary dentition` (FMA:55654).	恒牙萌出延迟	影响恒牙的萌出延迟。
HP:0000698	头部和颈部的异常	Conical tooth	An abnormal `conical` (PATO:0002021) form of the `teeth` (FMA:12516), that is, a tooth whose sides converge or taper together incisally.	圆锥形齿	不正常的圆锥形形态的牙齿，也就是牙齿周边斜聚在一起成锥形。
HP:0000699	头部和颈部的异常	Diastema	Increased space between two adjacent teeth in the same dental arch.	牙间隙增大	相同牙弓上两个相邻牙齿间的空隙增大。
HP:0000700	头部和颈部的异常	Periapical radiolucency	Radiolucency (reflecting a reduction in the bony substance) around the apex (the tip of the dental root).	牙根尖周射线可透	牙顶点（牙根的尖端）周围的射线可透（反映出骨质降低）。
HP:0000703	结缔组织异常,骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Dentinogenesis imperfecta	`Developmental dysplasia` of `dentin` (FMA:55628).	牙本质发育不全	牙本质的发育不全
HP:0000704	头部和颈部的异常,免疫系统异常	Periodontitis	`Inflammation` (MPATH:212) of the `periodontium` (FMA:56665).	牙周炎	牙周发炎。
HP:0000705	结缔组织异常,骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Amelogenesis imperfecta	A `developmental dysplasia` (MPATH:64) of the `dental enamel` (FMA:55629).	牙釉质生长不全	牙釉质发育异常
HP:0000706	头部和颈部的异常	Unerupted tooth	The presence of one or more embedded tooth germs which have failed to erupt.	埋伏牙	一颗或多颗牙齿未能萌出。
HP:0000707	神经系统异常	Abnormality of the nervous system	An abnormality of the `nervous system` (FMA:7157).	神经系统异常	在`神经系统`的异常（FMA:7157）。
HP:0000708	神经系统异常	Behavioral abnormality	An abnormality of mental functioning including various affective, behavioural, cognitive and perceptual abnormalities.	行为异常	一种精神功能异常，包括各种情感，行为，认知功能和感知觉的异常。
HP:0000709	神经系统异常	Psychosis	A condition characterized by changes of personality and thought patterns often accompanied by hallucinations and delusional beliefs.	精神病	一种表现为人格和思维模式改变的疾病，常伴有幻觉和妄想。
HP:0000710	神经系统异常	Hyperorality	A tendency or compulsion to examine objects by mouth.	口欲亢进	用口腔检查物体的一种倾向或冲动。
HP:0000711	神经系统异常	Restlessness	Restlessness is manifested as an inability to be still, quiet, at peace or comfortable.	躁动	躁动表现为难以保持静止、安静、平和、舒适的状态。
HP:0000712	神经系统异常	Emotional lability	The relative stability of emotion is poor. The symptom is seen most frequently in brain organic psychosis while the mechanisms remain elusive. And it is lack of special method of therapy.	情绪不稳	情绪不稳指患者的情绪在主、客观影响下易于诱发，易于转化和易于消退。情绪的相对稳定性差。产生机制目前不明，情绪不稳多见于脑器质性精神障碍。无特殊治疗。
HP:0000713	神经系统异常	Agitation	Agitation is a violent and transitory affective disorder, including irritability, impatience or anger.	躁动	一种剧烈但持续较短的情感障碍，包括烦恼、急躁或愤怒。可见于疲劳、慢性疼痛，或作为情感异常的临床特征，发生于老年性、脑外伤、癫痫和情感性精神障碍。
HP:0000716	神经系统异常	Depression	A condition characterized by pervasive dysphoric mood, loss of interests, and inability to experience pleasure.	抑郁	以普遍烦躁不安的情绪，失去兴趣，高兴不起来为特征的状态。
HP:0000717	神经系统异常	Autism	Autism is a neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by impaired social interaction and communication, and by restricted and repetitive behavior. Autism begins in childhood. It is marked by the presence of markedly abnormal or impaired development in social interaction and communication and a markedly restricted repertoire of activity and interest. Manifestations of the disorder vary greatly depending on the developmental level and chronological age of the individual (DSM-IV).	孤独症	孤独症是一种神经发育障碍，主要表现为社交能力受损、兴趣狭窄和行为刻板。婴幼儿期起病，它的特点是社会互动和沟通能力明显异常或发育障碍，活动和兴趣显著受限。该病的临床表现差异很大，取决于个体的发育水平和实际年龄。
HP:0000718	神经系统异常	Aggressive behavior	Aggressive behavior can denote verbal aggression, physical aggression against objects, physical aggression against people, and may also include aggression towards oneself.	攻击性行为	攻击性行为可以表现为言语攻击、对目标的物理攻击、对人的身体攻击、并且还可能包括自我攻击。
HP:0000719	神经系统异常	Inappropriate behavior	Inappropriate behavior	不适宜行为	不合时宜的行为。
HP:0000720	神经系统异常	Mood swings	An exaggeration of emotional affects such as laughing crying, or yawning beyond what the person feels.	情绪波动	扩大的情绪反应，如超出个人体验的大笑大哭，或打哈欠。
HP:0000721	神经系统异常	Lack of spontaneous play	自发性游戏的缺乏。自发性游戏具有自由、随意的特点，往往最能体现孩子们自己的游戏意愿，并表现出孩子们奇特的想象力和创造力。	自发性游戏缺乏	自发性游戏的缺乏。自发性游戏具有自由、随意的特点，往往最能体现孩子们自己的游戏意愿，并表现出孩子们奇特的想象力和创造力。
HP:0000722	神经系统异常	Obsessive-compulsive behavior	Recurrent obsessions or compulsions that are severe enough to be time consuming (i.e., they take more than 1 hour a day) or cause marked distress or significant impairment (DSM-IV).	强迫行为	复发性强迫观念或强迫行为导致严重的耗时现象（患者每天需要浪费1小时以上），或者引起明显的痛苦或损伤（DSM-IV）。
HP:0000723	神经系统异常	Restrictive behavior	Behavior characterized by an abnormal limitation to few interests and activities.	限制性行为	行为特点是不正常的限制，仅有少量的兴趣和活动。
HP:0000725	神经系统异常	Psychotic episodes	The episodes of psychotic	精神病发作	精神病的发作。精神病指严重的心理障碍，患者的认识、情感、意志、动作行为等心理活动均可出现持久的明显的异常；不能正常的学习、工作、生活等；动作行为难以被一般人理解；在病态心理的支配下，有自杀或攻击、伤害他人的动作行为。
HP:0000726	神经系统异常	Dementia	A loss of global cognitive ability of sufficient amount to interfere with normal social or occupational function. Dementia represents a loss of previously present cognitive abilities, generally in adults, and can affect memory, thinking, language, judgment, and behavior.	认知障碍	整体认知能力下降不能满足正常的社会或职业功能。痴呆标志着先前存在的认知能力丧失，通常在成人，可以影响记忆，思维，语言，判断和行为。
HP:0000727	神经系统异常	Frontal lobe dementia	Frontal lobe dementia (FLD) is characterised clinically by personality changes and a progressive speech disorder finally leading to mutism. In the course of the disease also other neurological syndromes may occur such as parkinsonism, a partial Kluver-Bucy-syndrome or a degeneration of motoneurons (FLD + MND). The clinical diagnosis of FLD is supported by functional (SPECT) and morphological (CT, MRI) investigations.	额叶痴呆	额叶痴呆（FLD）以人格改变和进行性言语障碍为主要特征，最终可导致缄默。在疾病进展过程中，还可伴发其它神经综合征，如：帕金森综合征，部分Kluver-Bucy综合征或运动神经元的退化（FLD + MND）。 FLD可通过功能（SPECT）和形态学（CT，MRI）检查进行诊断。
HP:0000728	神经系统异常	Impaired ability to form peer relationships	The ability to form a peer relationship is weak.	同伴关系建立能力障碍	形成同伴关系的能力减弱。
HP:0000729	神经系统异常	Autistic behavior	A disorder beginning in childhood. It is marked by the presence of markedly abnormal or impaired development in social interaction and communication and a markedly restricted repertoire of activity and interest. Manifestations of the disorder vary greatly depending on the developmental level and chronological age of the individual (DSM-IV).	自闭症行为	婴幼儿期出现的异常，它的特点是社会互动和沟通能力明显异常或发育障碍，活动和兴趣显著受限。该病的临床表现差异很大，取决于个体的发育水平和实际年龄（DSM-IV）。
HP:0000732	神经系统异常	Inflexible adherence to routines or rituals	Inflexible adherence to routines or rituals	恪守程序或习惯	恪守程序或习惯。
HP:0000733	神经系统异常	Stereotypic behavior	A repetitive behaviour that does not serve an observable goal. In general the movements are not aimed at the environment, but at the person itself. Stereotypical behaviour is seen especially in children with sensory, intellectual and/or cognitive handicaps.	刻板行为	重复的无目的性的行为。总的来讲活动不是针对环境，但在人本身。刻板的行为，在伴有感官、智力和/或认知障碍的儿童尤为常见。
HP:0000734	神经系统异常	Disinhibition	A lack of restraint manifested in several ways, including disregard for social conventions, impulsivity, and poor risk assessment.	脱抑制	缺乏约束表现在几个方面，包括无视社会规范，冲动，风险评估能力差。
HP:0000735	神经系统异常	Impaired social interactions	Difficulty in social interactions related to an impairment of characteristics such as eye contact, smiling, appropriate facial expressions, and body postures and characterized by difficulty in forming peer relationships and forming friendships.	社会交往障碍	社会交往困难，其特征性损害如目光接触，微笑，适当的面部表情和身体姿势，且难以形成的同伴关系和建立友谊。
HP:0000736	神经系统异常	Short attention span	Reduced attention span characterized by distractibility and impulsivity but not necessarily satisfying the diagnostic criteria for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.	注意力短暂	注意力降低特点是注意力分散和冲动性，但不一定满足注意缺陷多动障碍的诊断标准。
HP:0000737	神经系统异常	Irritability	Agitation is a violent and transitory affective disorder, including irritability, impatience or anger.	易激惹	一种剧烈但持续较短的情感障碍，包括烦恼、急躁或愤怒。可见于疲劳、慢性疼痛，或作为情感异常的临床特征，发生于老年性、脑外伤、癫痫和情感性精神障碍。
HP:0000738	神经系统异常	Hallucinations	Perceptions in a conscious and awake state in the absence of external stimuli which have qualities of real perception, in that they are vivid, substantial, and located in external objective space.	幻觉	在有意识的、清醒状态下，缺乏真实的外界刺激的一种感觉，因此他们是生动的、实质性的、并存在于外部客观空间。
HP:0000739	神经系统异常	Anxiety	Feeling or dread, apprehension, and impending disaster.	焦虑	感觉恐惧、忧虑、和即将发生灾难。
HP:0000740	神经系统异常	Anxiety (with pheochromocytoma)	Anxiety with pheochromocytoma	焦虑（伴嗜铬细胞瘤）	焦虑伴嗜铬细胞瘤。
HP:0000741	神经系统异常	Apathy	Lack of emotion or emotional expression; a disorder of motivation that persists over time.	情感淡漠	缺乏感情或情绪的表达；一种持续性动力障碍的一种疾病。
HP:0000742	神经系统异常	Self-mutilation	Self-mutilation refers to the self-Inflicted Injury of the minds and bodies.	自残	自残是指人对自身肢体和精神的伤害。
HP:0000743	神经系统异常	Frontal release signs	Primitive reflexes traditionally held to be a sign of disorders that affect the frontal lobes.	额叶释放征象	出现原始反射，是额叶受损的征象。
HP:0000744	神经系统异常	Low frustration tolerance	#####	低挫折承受力	#####
HP:0000745	神经系统异常	Diminished motivation	A reduction in goal-directed behavior, that is, motivation, the determinant of behavior and adaptation that allows individuals to get started, be energized to perform a sustained and directed action.	动机减弱	有目的的行为（即动机）减少。动机是使人们开始行为和适应的决定因素，激励完成持续有意图的行动。
HP:0000746	神经系统异常	Delusions	A belief that is pathological and is held despite evidence to the contrary.	妄想	是一种与现实不符且不可能实现但坚信的病理性信念。

HP:0000759	神经系统异常	Abnormality of the peripheral nervous system	An abnormality of the `peripheral nervous system` (FMA:9903), which is composed of the nerves that lead to or branch off from the central nervous system.	外周神经系统的异常	`外周神经系统`（FMA: 9903）的异常。外周神经系统是由从中枢神经系统发出的分支神经组成。
HP:0000762	神经系统异常	Decreased nerve conduction velocity	A reduction in the speed at which electrical signals propagate along the axon of a `neuron` (FMA:54527).	神经传导速度降低	电信号沿着神经轴突（FMA:54527）传导速度的降低。

HP:0000765	骨骼系统异常	Abnormality of the thorax	Any abnormality of the thorax (the region of the body formed by the sternum, the thoracic vertebrae and the ribs).	胸廓异常	胸廓的任何异常。胸廓是身体的一个区域，由胸骨、胸椎脊柱和肋形成。

HP:0000813	泌尿生殖系统异常	Bicornuate uterus	The presence of a `bicornuate` (PATO:0002161) `uterus` (FMA:17558).	双角子宫	副中肾管的尾端发育障碍,致使内生殖器成为单宫颈、单阴道,而子宫底部呈双角形,故称双角子宫或鞍状子宫。
HP:0000815	泌尿生殖系统异常,内分泌系统异常	Hypergonadotropic hypogonadism	Reduced function of the gonads (testes in males or ovaries in females) associated with excess pituitary gonadotropin secretion and resulting in delayed sexual development and growth delay.	高促性腺激素性性腺功能减退症	性腺（男性的睾丸，女性的卵巢）的功能降低，伴随垂体促性腺激素的过度分泌，导致性发育延迟和生长发育迟缓。

HP:0000822	心血管系统异常	Hypertension	The presence of `chronic` (PATO:0001863) `increased pressure` (PATO:0001576) in the `systemic arterial system` (FMA:45623).	高血压	在全身动脉系统中存在慢性的（肺动脉参数:0001863）血压升高（肺动脉参数:0001576）。
HP:0000823	生长异常,内分泌系统异常	Delayed puberty	Passing the age when puberty normally occurs with no physical or hormonal signs of the onset of puberty.	青春期发育延迟	在青春期通常开始的年龄，没有出现可以作为青春期开始的征兆的体征或激素变化。
HP:0000824	神经系统异常,内分泌系统异常	Growth hormone deficiency	Insufficient production of growth hormone, which is produced by the anterior pituitary gland. Growth hormone is a major participant in control of growth and metabolism.	生长激素缺乏症	垂体前叶产生的生长激素不足。生长激素是生长和代谢控制的一个主要参与者。
HP:0000825	内分泌系统异常,代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	Hyperinsulinemic hypoglycemia	An `increased concentration` (PATO:0001162) of `insulin` (PRO:000009054) combined with a `decreased concentration` (PATO:0001163) of `glucose` (CHEBI:17234) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).	高胰岛素性低血糖	血中 `胰岛素` (PRO:000009054)  的`浓度升高` (PATO:0001162)伴有`葡萄糖glucose` (CHEBI:17234) `浓度降低` 。
HP:0000826	内分泌系统异常	Precocious puberty	The onset of secondary sexual characteristics before a normal age. Although it is difficult to define normal age ranges because of the marked variation with which puberty begins in normal children, precocious puberty can be defined as the onset of puberty before the age of 8 years in girls or 9 years in boys.	性早熟	指在正常年龄之前出现第二性征。尽管正常儿童青春期开始的年龄差别很大导致“正常年龄”难以界定，通常将性早熟定义为男孩9岁或者女孩8岁之前开始青春期发育。
HP:0000828	内分泌系统异常	Abnormality of the parathyroid gland	An abnormality of the "parathyroid gland" (FMA:13890).	甲状旁腺异常	甲状旁腺的异常。
HP:0000829	内分泌系统异常	Hypoparathyroidism	A condition caused by a deficiency of parathyroid hormone characterized by hypocalcemia and hyperphosphatemia.	甲状旁腺功能减退症	甲状旁腺激素分泌不足导致的一种病理状态，特点是低血钙和高血磷。
HP:0000830	神经系统异常,内分泌系统异常	Anterior hypopituitarism	A condition of reduced function of the pituitary gland characterized by decreased secretion of one or more of the pituitary hormones growth hormone, thyroid-stimulating hormone, adrenocorticotropic hormone, prolactin, luteinizing hormone, and follicle-stimulating hormone.	垂体前叶功能减退症	垂体前叶功能减退产生的症状,表现为一种或多种垂体激素分泌减少, 如生长激素，促甲状腺激素，促肾上腺皮质激素，泌乳素，黄体生成素和卵泡刺激素。
HP:0000831	内分泌系统异常,代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	Insulin-resistant diabetes mellitus	A type of diabetes mellitus related not to lack of insulin but rather to lack of response to insulin on the part of the target tissues of insulin such as muscle, fat, and liver cells. This type of diabetes is typically associated with increases both in blood glucose concentrations as will as in fasting and postprandial serum insulin levels.	胰岛素抵抗性糖尿病	糖尿病的一种，其致病原因不是由于缺乏胰岛素，而是由于胰岛素的靶组织如肌肉，脂肪和肝细胞等丧失对胰岛素的反应。这种类型的糖尿病通常在空腹和餐后表现为血中葡萄糖浓度和血清胰岛素水平都升高。
HP:0000832	内分泌系统异常	Primary hypothyroidism	A type of "hypothyroidism" (HP:0000821) that results from a defect in the "thyroid gland" (FMA:9603).	原发性甲状腺功能减退症	一种由于甲状腺缺陷而导致的甲状腺功能低下(HP:0000821)。
HP:0000833	代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	Glucose intolerance	#####	葡萄糖不耐受	#####
HP:0000834	内分泌系统异常	Abnormality of the adrenal glands	Abnormality of the "adrenal glands" (FMA:9604), i.e., of the endocrine glands located at the top of the kindneys.	肾上腺异常	肾上腺的异常，即位于肾脏顶端的内分泌腺体的异常。
HP:0000835	内分泌系统异常	Adrenal hypoplasia	Developmental hypoplasia of the "adrenal glands" (FMA:9604).	肾上腺发育不良	肾上腺的发育不良。
HP:0000836	内分泌系统异常	Hyperthyroidism	An abnormality of thyroid physiology (HP:0002926) characterized by refers to excessive secretion of the thyroid hormones "thyroxine" (CHEBI:30660) (i.e., T4) and/or "3,3&#39;,5-triiodo-L-thyronine zwitterion" (CHEBI:533015) (i.e., triiodothyronine or T3).	甲状腺功能亢进症	甲状腺生理(HP:0002926)的一种异常，表现为甲状腺激素分泌过多，如甲状腺素（T4）和／或三碘甲腺原氨酸（T3）。
HP:0000837	神经系统异常,内分泌系统异常	Gonadotropin excess	Overproduction of gonadotropins (FSH, LH) by the anterior pituitary gland.	促性腺激素增多	垂体前叶产生过多的促性腺激素（FSH，LH）。
HP:0000839	神经系统异常,内分泌系统异常,生长异常	Pituitary dwarfism	A type of reduced stature with normal proportions related to dysfunction of the pituitary gland related to either an isolated defect in the secretion of growth hormone or to panhypopituitarism, i.e., a deficit of all the anterior pituitary hormones.	垂体性侏儒症	一种比例正常但矮小的身材，与垂体功能异常有关，这种异常或者只是生长激素的分泌不足，或者是全垂体机能减退，即所有垂体前叶激素分泌不足。
HP:0000840	内分泌系统异常	Adrenogenital syndrome	Adrenogenital syndrome is also known as congenital adrenal hyperplasia, which results from disorders of steroid hormone production in the adrenal glands leading to a deficiency of cortisol. The pituitary gland reacts by increased secretion of corticotropin, which in turn causes the adrenal glands to overproduce certain intermediary hormones which have testosterone-like effects.	肾上腺性征异常综合征	肾上腺性征异常综合征也称为先天性肾上腺增生，由于肾上腺中类固醇激素产生失调导致皮质醇不足，引起垂体促肾上腺皮质激素分泌增多，从而导致肾上腺一些具有雄激素作用的中间产物产生过量。
HP:0000841	内分泌系统异常	Hyperactive renin-angiotensin system	An abnormally increased activity of the renin-angiotensin system, causing hypertension by a combination of volume excess and vasoconstrictor mechanisms.	肾素-血管紧张素系统亢进	肾素-血管紧张素系统活性异常增加，通过增加血容量和收缩血管引起高血压。
HP:0000842	内分泌系统异常,代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	Hyperinsulinemia	An `increased concentration` (PATO:0001162) of `insulin` (PRO:000009054) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).	高胰岛素血症	`血`中 (FMA:9670)`胰岛素` (PRO:000009054)`浓度升高` (PATO:0001162)异常。
HP:0000843	内分泌系统异常	Hyperparathyroidism	Excessive production of parathyroid hormone (PTH) by the parathyroid glands.	甲状旁腺功能亢进症	甲状旁腺产生甲状旁腺激素（PTH）过量。
HP:0000845	神经系统异常,内分泌系统异常	Growth hormone excess	Acromegaly is a condition resulting from overproduction of growth hormone by the pituitary gland in persons with closed epiphyses, and consists chiefly in the enlargement of the distal parts of the body. The circumference of the skull increases, the nose becomes broad, the tongue becomes enlarged, the facial features become coarsened, the mandible grows excessively, and the teeth become separated. The fingers and toes grow chiefly in thickness.	生长激素增多	肢端肥大症是由于在骨骺已闭合的人中脑垂体产生过多生长激素引起的一种状态，主要引起肢体远端部分的增大。包括颅骨周长增加，鼻子变宽，舌头肿大，面部特征变得粗糙，下颌骨过度增长，而牙齿变得分开。手指和脚趾的厚度增加。
HP:0000846	内分泌系统异常	Adrenal insufficiency	Insufficient production of steroid hormones (primarily cortisol) by the adrenal glands as a result of a primary defect in the glands themselves.	肾上腺功能不全	由于肾上腺腺体本身的缺陷，导致其产生的类固醇激素（主要是皮质醇）不足。
HP:0000847	内分泌系统异常	Abnormality of renin-angiotensin system	An abnormality of the "renin-angiotensin system" (FMA:74787).	肾素-血管紧张素系统异常	肾素-血管紧张素系统的异常。
HP:0000848	内分泌系统异常	Increased circulating renin level	An increased level of "renin" (PRO:000013883) in the "blood" (FMA:9670).	血肾素水平升高	血液循环中肾素水平升高。
HP:0000849	内分泌系统异常	Adrenocortical abnormality	#####	肾上腺皮质异常	#####
HP:0000851	内分泌系统异常	Congenital hypothyroidism	A type of "hypothyroidism" (HP:0000821) with "congenital onset" (HP:0003577).	先天性甲状腺功能减退症	一种先天性发病(HP:0003577)的甲状腺功能减退症(HP:0000821)。
HP:0000852	内分泌系统异常	Pseudohypoparathyroidism	A condition characterized by resistance to the action of parathyroid hormone, in which there is hypocalcemia, hyperphosphatemia, and (appropriately) high levels of parathyroid hormone.	假性甲状旁腺功能减退症	此症特点是对甲状旁腺激素的作用失去敏感性，导致低血钙，高血磷和（相对）高浓度的甲状旁腺激素。
HP:0000853	内分泌系统异常	Goiter	An enlargement of the "thyroid gland" (FMA:9603).	甲状腺肿	甲状腺腺体的增大。
HP:0000854	肿瘤,内分泌系统异常	Thyroid adenoma	The presence of a `adenoma` (MPATH:270) of the `thyroid gland` (FMA:9603).	甲状腺腺瘤	甲状腺部位发生的腺瘤。
HP:0000855	代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	Insulin resistance	`Increased resistance` (PATO:0001650) towards `insulin` (PRO:000009054), that is, diminished effectiveness of insulin in reducing blood glucose levels.	胰岛素抵抗	`增加resistance`（PATO:0001650）朝向`insulin`（PRO:000009054），即，胰岛素在降低血糖水平减少的效果。
HP:0000857	内分泌系统异常,代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	Neonatal insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus	#####	新生儿胰岛素依赖性糖尿病	#####
HP:0000858	内分泌系统异常	Menstrual irregularities	#####	月经不调症	#####
HP:0000859	内分泌系统异常	Hyperaldosteronism	Overproduction of the mineralocorticoid aldosterone by the adrenal cortex.	醛固酮增多症	肾上腺皮质产生的盐皮质激素醛固酮过多。
HP:0000860	内分泌系统异常	Parathyroid hypoplasia	Developmental hypoplasia of the `parathyroid gland` (FMA:13890).	甲状旁腺发育不全	甲状旁腺发育不全。
HP:0000863	神经系统异常,内分泌系统异常	Central diabetes insipidus	A form of diabetes insipidus related to a failure of vasopressin (AVP) release from the hypothalamus.	中枢性尿崩症	由于下丘脑分泌血管加压素（AVP）缺陷引起的尿崩症。
HP:0000864	内分泌系统异常	Abnormality of the hypothalamus-pituitary axis	Abnormality of the pituitary gland (also known as hypophysis), which is an endocrine gland that protrudes from the bottom of the hypothalamus at the base of the brain. The pituitary gland secretes the hormones ACTH, TSH, PRL, GH, endorphins, FSH, LH, oxytocin, and antidiuretic hormone. The secretion of hormones from the anterior pituitary is under the strict control of hypothalamic hormones, and the posterior pituitary is essentially an extension of the hypothalamus, so that  hypothalamus and pituitary gland may be regarded as a functional unit.	下丘脑-垂体轴异常	垂体（也称为脑下垂体）的异常，垂体是在脑底部从下丘脑的底端突出的一个内分泌腺。垂体分泌的激素有促肾上腺皮质激素ACTH、促甲状腺激素TSH、催乳素PRL、生长激素GH、内啡肽、卵泡刺激素FSH、黄体生成素LH、催产素、抗利尿激素。垂体前叶的激素分泌受到下丘脑激素的严格控制，而垂体后叶基本上是下丘脑的延伸，所以下丘脑和垂体可被认为是一个功能单元。
HP:0000866	内分泌系统异常	Euthyroid multinodular goiter	#####	甲状腺功能正常结节性甲状腺肿	#####
HP:0000867	内分泌系统异常	Secondary hyperparathyroidism	Secondary hyperparathyroidism refers to the production of higher than normal levels of parathyroid hormone in the presence of hypocalcemia.	继发性甲状旁腺功能亢进症	继发性甲状旁腺亢进症指在甲状旁腺激素过量产生的同时伴有低血钙症。
HP:0000868	泌尿生殖系统异常	Decreased fertility in females	#####	女性生育能力降低	#####
HP:0000869	泌尿生殖系统异常,内分泌系统异常	Secondary amenorrhea	#####	继发性闭经	#####
HP:0000870	神经系统异常,内分泌系统异常	Prolactin excess	The presence of abnormally increased levels of prolactin in the blood. Prolactin is a peptide hormone produced by the anterior pituitary gland that plays a role in breast development and lactation during pregnancy.	泌乳激素过多	指泌乳素血中水平异常升高。泌乳素是一种由垂体前叶分泌的蛋白质激素，影响乳腺发育及怀孕期的泌乳。
HP:0000871	神经系统异常,内分泌系统异常	Panhypopituitarism	A pituitary functional deficit affecting all the anterior pituitary hormones (growth hormone, thyroid-stimulating hormone, follicle-stimulating hormone, luteinizing hormone, adrenocorticotropic hormone, and prolactin).	全垂体功能减退	垂体功能缺损影响所有垂体前叶激素（生长激素，促甲状腺激素，卵泡刺激素，黄体生成素，促肾上腺皮质激素，和泌乳素）。
HP:0000872	内分泌系统异常,免疫系统异常	Hashimoto thyroiditis	A chronic, autoimmune type of "thyroiditis" (HP:0100646) associated with "hypothyroidism" (HP:0000821).	桥本甲状腺炎	一种慢性的与甲状腺功能减退(HP:0000821)相关的自身免疫性甲状腺炎HP:0100646。
HP:0000873	内分泌系统异常	Diabetes insipidus	A state of excessive water intake and hypotonic (dilute) polyuria. Diabetes insipidus may be due to failure of vasopressin (AVP) release (central or neurogenic diabetes insipidus) or to a failure of the kidney to respond to AVP (nephrogenic diabetes insipidus).	尿崩症	一种过量饮水伴多尿，低渗尿（稀释性）的状态。尿崩症可能是由于血管加压素（AVP）分泌缺陷（中枢或神经性尿崩症）或肾脏对AVP的反应缺陷（肾性尿崩症）造成。
HP:0000875	心血管系统异常	Episodic hypertension	Not persistently high arterial blood pressure	阵发性高血压	非持续性的高血压，只是偶尔发作，自发终止
HP:0000876	泌尿生殖系统异常,内分泌系统异常	Oligomenorrhea	Infrequent periods (less than 6 per year).	月经稀发	月经期频率减少（每年少于6次）。
HP:0000877	内分泌系统异常,代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	Insulin-resistant diabetes mellitus at puberty	#####	青春期胰岛素抵抗性糖尿病	#####

HP:0000888	骨骼系统异常	Horizontal ribs	A horizontal (flat) conformation of the ribs, the long curved bones that form the rib cage and normally  progressively oblique (slanted) from ribs 1 through 9, then less slanted through rib 12.	横位肋骨	一个水平（平）构象的肋骨（即形成胸腔的长而弯曲的骨头），正常情况下从1-9肋逐渐倾斜，然后到12肋倾斜更少。

HP:0000892	骨骼系统异常	Bifid ribs	A bifid rib refers to cleavage of the sternal end of a rib, usually unilateral. Bifid ribs are usually asymptomatic, and are often discovered incidentally by chest x-ray.	#####	分叉肋骨指肋骨的胸骨端（通常为单侧）的切割。分支肋骨通常无症状，往往是由胸部X光偶然发现。
HP:0000893	骨骼系统异常	Bulging of the costochondral junction	Abnormal outward curving (protuberance) of the junction of ribs and costal cartilage.	肋软骨交界处隆起	肋骨和肋软骨交界处的异常向外弯曲（凸起）。

HP:0000918	肿瘤,骨骼系统异常	Scapular exostoses	The presence of multiple exostoses on the scapula. An exostosis is a benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface. It is cappped by cartilage.	肩胛外生骨疣	上肩胛骨存在多发性外生骨疣。外生骨疣是从骨表面上向外突出的良性生长。它是由软骨包被。
HP:0000919	骨骼系统异常	Abnormality of the costochondral junction	Any anomaly of the `costochondral junction` (FMA:7956). The costochondral junctions are located between the distal part of the ribs and the costal cartilages, which are bars of hyaline cartilage that connect the ribs to the sternum.	肋软骨交界处异常	肋软骨交界处的任何异常。肋软骨交界处位于肋骨的远端和肋软骨之间，连接肋骨和胸骨的杆状透明软骨。
HP:0000920	骨骼系统异常	Enlargement of the costochondral junction	Abnormally increased size of the costochondral junctions, which are located between the distal part of the ribs and the costal cartilages, which are bars of hyaline cartilage that connect the ribs to the sternum.	肋软骨交界处膨大	#####
HP:0000921	骨骼系统异常	Missing ribs	A developmental anomaly with absence of one or more ribs.	肋骨缺失	发展畸形致缺乏一个或多个肋。

HP:0000925	骨骼系统异常	Abnormality of the vertebral column	Any abnormality of the `vertebral column` (FMA:13478).	脊柱异常	脊柱的任何异常。
HP:0000926	骨骼系统异常	Platyspondyly	A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance between the vertebral endplates.	扁平椎	扁平椎体形态伴椎体终板间距离缩短。
HP:0000927	骨骼系统异常	Abnormality of skeletal maturation	The bones of the skeleton undergo a series of characteristic changes in size, shape, and calcification from fetal life until puberty. An abnormality of this process can include delayed or accelerated skeletal maturation, or deviation of some, but not all bones from the expected patterns of maturation.	骨骼成熟异常	自胎儿至青春期，骨架的骨头的大小、形状和钙化发生一系列特征性改变。这个过程中的异常包括骨骼成熟的延迟或加速，或一部分而非所有骨头偏离预期的成熟模式。
HP:0000929	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Abnormality of the skull	An abnormality of the `skull` (FMA:46565), the bony framework of the head which is comprised of eight cranial and fourteen facial bones.	颅骨异常	颅骨的异常。颅骨是由八块颅部和14块面部骨骼构成的头部骨架。
HP:0000930	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Elevated imprint of the transverse sinuses	The transverse sinuses,also called left and right lateral sinuses of the dura mater,which imprint is elevated.	横窦压迹抬高	横窦也称硬脑膜左、右侧窦，其压迹抬高。
HP:0000931	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Thinning and bulging of the posterior fossa bones	The presence of an abnormally thin and bulge of posterior part of the head from a underside view	后颅窝変薄膨出	从颅底观可见颅脑后部异常突出且窄长。
HP:0000932	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Abnormality of the posterior cranial fossa	An abnormality of the fossa cranii posterior (the posterior fossa), which is made up primarily of the occipital bone and which surrounds to the foramen magnum.	后颅窝异常	后颅窝的异常，后颅窝主要是由枕骨构成，围绕枕骨大孔。
HP:0000933	神经系统异常,骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Posterior fossa cyst at the fourth ventricle	#####	后颅窝第四脑室囊肿	出现在后颅窝第四脑室的囊肿
HP:0000934	结缔组织异常,骨骼系统异常	Chondrocalcinosis	Radiographic evidence of articular calcification that represent calcium pyrophosphate depositions in soft tissue surrounding joints and at the insertions of tendons near joints (Entheses/Sharpey fibers) .	软骨钙质沉着症	关节钙化的影像学证据表明，关节周围软组织及近关节处肌腱附着点有焦磷酸钙沉积。
HP:0000935	骨骼系统异常	Thickened cortex of long bones	Abnormal thickening of the cortex of long bones.	长骨骨皮质增厚	长骨的骨皮质异常增厚。
HP:0000938	骨骼系统异常	Osteopenia	Osteopenia refers to a reduction in bone mineral density (BMD) below normal peak BMD but not low enough to be classified as osteoporosis. According to the WHO, osteopenia is characterized by a value of BMD more than 1 standard deviation below the young adult mean, but less than 2 standard deviations below this value.	骨质减少	骨质减少是指在骨矿物质密度的（BMD）低于正常峰骨密度但不低到足以被归类为骨质疏松症。根据世界卫生组织，骨质减少的特征在于骨密度值比年轻成年人平均值低1个标准差以上，但差距小于2个标准偏差。
HP:0000939	骨骼系统异常	Osteoporosis	Osteoporosis is a systemic skeletal disease characterized by low bone density and microarchitectural deterioration of bone tissue with a consequent increase in bone fragility. According to the WHO, osteoporosis is characterized by a value of BMD 2.5 standard deviations or more below the young adult mean.	骨质疏松	骨质疏松症是一种全身骨骼疾病，其特征为低骨密度和骨组织的微结构退化与骨脆性随之增加。根据世界卫生组织，骨质疏松症的特征在于骨密度值比年轻成年人平均值低2.5个标准差以上。
HP:0000940	骨骼系统异常	Abnormal diaphysis morphology	An abnormalstructure of the diaphysis（the main shaft of a long bone）.	骨干形态异常	骨干（长骨主要中轴部分）的结构异常。
HP:0000941	骨骼系统异常	Short diaphyses	Shortening length of diaphyses	短骨干	骨干长度缩短
HP:0000943	骨骼系统异常	Dysostosis multiplex	Abnormalities in development of skeletal cartilage and bones	多发性成骨不全	多发骨和软骨发育异常
HP:0000944	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Abnormality of the metaphyses	An abnormality of one or more metaphysis, i.e., of the somewhat wider portion of a long bone that is adjacent to the epiphyseal growth plate and grows during childhood.	干骺端异常	一个或多个干骺端异常，干骺端是长骨末端略宽的部分，它连接骨骺生长板，在儿童期增长。
HP:0000945		Flared irregular metaphyses	#####	喇叭状不规则干骺端	#####
HP:0000946	骨骼系统异常	Hypoplastic ilia	Underdevelopment of the `ilium` (FMA:16589).	髂骨发育不全	#####
HP:0000947	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Dumbbell-shaped long bone	An abnormal appearance of the long bones with resemblance to a dumbbell, a short bar with a weight at each end. That is, the long bone is shortened and displays flaring (widening) of the metaphyses.	哑铃状长骨	长骨的不正常外观，形似哑铃，即质量集中在两端的短棒。长骨缩短并显示喇叭状（扩大）的干骺端。
HP:0000951	体壁的异常	Abnormality of the skin	An abnormality of the `skin` (FMA:7163).	皮肤异常	皮肤的异常。
HP:0000952	消化系统异常,体壁的异常	Jaundice	Yellow pigmentation of the skin or sclera due to bilirubin, which in turn is the result of increased bilirubin concentration in the bloodstream.	黄疸	胆红素导致的皮肤或巩膜黄染，此为血液中胆红素浓度增加的结果。
HP:0000953	体壁的异常	Hyperpigmentation of the skin	A darkening of the skin related to an increase in melanin production and deposition.	皮肤色素沉着	黑素生成和沉积增加导致皮肤颜色加深。
HP:0000954	肢体异常,体壁的异常	Single transverse palmar crease	The distal and proximal transverse palmar creases are merged into a single transverse palmar crease.	单独掌横纹	远端和近端掌横纹融合成一条掌横纹折痕。
HP:0000956	体壁的异常	Acanthosis nigricans	A dermatosis characterized by thickened, hyperpigmented plaques, typically on the intertriginous surfaces and neck.	黑棘皮病	该病的皮损特点是局部皮肤增厚和过度色素沉着斑，主要发生在颈部和皮肤易褶皱处。
HP:0000957	体壁的异常	Cafe-au-lait spot	Cafe-au-lait spots are hyperpigmented lesions that can vary in color from light brown to dark brown with smooth borders and having a size of 1.5 cm or more in adults and 0.5 cm or more in children.	牛奶咖啡斑	牛奶咖啡斑指的是边缘光滑，颜色介于浅棕色至深棕色之间的色素过度沉着性病变，大小因年龄而异，成年人的皮损直径在1.5厘米以上，儿童则在0.5厘米以上。
HP:0000958	体壁的异常	Dry skin	Skin characterized by the lack of natural or normal moisture.	干性皮肤	皮肤缺乏足够的水分。
HP:0000960	骨骼系统异常,体壁的异常	Sacral dimple	A subtype of `skin dimples` (HP:0010781) presenting as an indentation in the skin of the intergluteal cleft .	骶骨酒窝	`皮肤酒窝`（0010781 HP）的亚型，为臀沟的皮肤压痕
HP:0000961	呼吸系统异常,体壁的异常	Cyanosis	A bluish or purplish discoloration of the skin and mucous membranes due to an increase in the amount of deoxygenated hemoglobin in the blood or a structural defect in the hemoglobin molecule.	紫绀	因血液中还原型血红蛋白的含量增加或血红蛋白分子的结构缺陷而表现出皮肤或粘膜的颜色变蓝或变紫。
HP:0000962	体壁的异常	Hyperkeratosis	Hyperkeratosis is thickening of the outer layer of the skin, the stratum corneum, which is composed of large, polyhedral, plate-like envelopes filled with keratin which are the dead cells that have migrated up from the stratum granulosum.	角化过度	角化过度是由皮肤最外层的角质层异常增厚所致，角质层是由大量从颗粒层退化的充满角蛋白的多面扁平状角质细胞构成。
HP:0000963	体壁的异常	Thin skin	Reduction in thickness of the skin, generally associated with a loss of suppleness and elasticity of the skin.	皮肤变薄	皮肤的厚度降低，通常和皮肤的弹性和柔软度缺失有关。
HP:0000964	体壁的异常,免疫系统异常	Eczema	Eczema is a form of dermatitis. The term eczema is broadly applied to a range of persistent skin conditions and can be related to a number of underlying conditions. Manifestations of eczema can include dryness and recurring skin rashes with redness, skin edema, itching and dryness, crusting, flaking, blistering, cracking, oozing, or bleeding.	湿疹	湿疹是皮炎的一种表现，这个术语可用于很多皮肤病变，且可能与大量潜在因素相关。湿疹的皮损呈多形性，可包括干燥伴反复发生的红色皮疹、水肿、干燥伴瘙痒、结痂、剥落、水泡、裂隙、渗血或出血。
HP:0000965	心血管系统异常,体壁的异常	Cutis marmorata	A reticular discoloration of the skin with cyanotic (reddish-blue appearing) areas surrounding pale central areas due to dilation of capillary blood vessels and stagnation of blood within the vessels. Cutis marmorata, also called livedo reticularis, generally occurs on the legs, arms and trunk and is often more severe in cold weather.	大理石样皮肤	因皮肤毛细血管扩张和静脉淤血，皮肤出现紫色（表现为红蓝色）围绕中央苍白区呈网状改变，大理石样皮肤又称网状青斑，常发生在下肢、手臂和躯干，在冬季病情加重。
HP:0000966	体壁的异常	Hypohidrosis	Abnormally diminished capacity to sweat.	少汗症	汗腺分泌能力异常减弱。
HP:0000967	心血管系统异常,体壁的异常,血液和造血组织异常	Petechiae	Petechiae are pinpoint-sized reddish/purple spots, resembling a rash, that appear just under the skin or a mucous membrane when capillaries have ruptured and some superficial bleeding into the skin has happened. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing petechiae.	瘀点	瘀点是针尖大小的红色或紫色的斑点，类似红疹，是皮肤或粘膜下毛细血管破裂浅表出血的表现。瘀点一般有发生出血的倾向。
HP:0000968	体壁的异常	Ectodermal dysplasia	Ectodermal dysplasia is a group of conditions in which there is abnormal development of the skin, hair, nails, teeth, or sweat glands.	外胚层发育不良	外胚层发育不良是一组累及皮肤、头发、指甲、牙齿以及汗腺发育异常的先天性疾病。
HP:0000969	代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	Edema	An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin, or in one or more cavities of the body.	水肿	液体在皮下或者在身体的一个或多个腔内异常积聚。
HP:0000970	体壁的异常	Anhidrosis	Inability to sweat.	无汗症	身体无法出汗。

HP:0000978	心血管系统异常,体壁的异常,血液和造血组织异常	Bruising susceptibility	An ecchymosis (bruise) refers to the skin discoloration caused by the escape of blood into the tissues from ruptured blood vessels. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to bruising. The corresponding phenotypic abnormality is generally elicited on medical history as a report of frequent ecchymoses or bruising without adequate trauma.	瘀斑易感性	瘀斑（青肿）指的是由于血液从破裂的血管逸入组织而引起的皮肤变色。瘀斑易感性指的是瘀伤易感性的异常增加。病例报道中发现其相应的表型异常通常表现为无外伤但出现频繁的青紫和瘀斑。
HP:0000979	心血管系统异常,体壁的异常,血液和造血组织异常	Purpura	Purpura (from Latin: purpura, meaning &quot;purple&quot;) is the appearance of red or purple discolorations on the skin that do not blanch on applying pressure. They are caused by bleeding underneath the skin. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing purpura. Purpura are larger than petechiae.	紫癜	紫癜（源自拉丁语:purpura，意为“紫色”）是一种触压不褪色的皮肤紫红色斑。通常由皮下出血引起。由于毛细血管脆性增加而发展成紫癜。紫癜比瘀点大。

HP:0000992	体壁的异常	Cutaneous photosensitivity	An increased sensitivity of the skin to light. Photosensitivity may result in a rash upon exposure to the sun (which is known as photodermatosis). Photosensitivity can be diagnosed by phototests in which light is shone on small areas of skin.	光感性皮肤	指皮肤对日光的敏感性增加，可在光照后引起暴露部位红斑（称光感性皮炎）。可以通过局部皮肤暴露光照后的光斑试验来诊断。

HP:0000995	体壁的异常	Melanocytic nevus	A oval and round, colored (usually medium-to dark brown, reddish brown, or flesh colored) lesion. Typically, a melanocytic nevus is less than 6 mm in diameter, but may be much smaller or larger.	黑素细胞痣	黑素细胞痣呈圆形或椭圆形，颜色常接近深褐色、红褐色或肉色，直径一般小于6毫米，也可以更小或更大。

HP:0001009	心血管系统异常,体壁的异常	Telangiectasia	Telangiectasias refer to small dilated blood vessels located near the surface of the skin or mucous membranes, measuring between 0.5 and 1 millimeter in diameter. Telangiectasia are located especially on the tongue, lips, palate, fingers, face, conjunctiva, trunk, nail beds, and fingertips.	毛细血管扩张	毛细血管扩张指位于皮肤或粘膜表面的小血管扩张，直径在0.5~1mm之间。毛细血管扩张主要位于舌部，唇部，上腭，手指，面部，结膜，躯干，甲床和指尖。

HP:0001013	体壁的异常	Eruptive xanthomas	Eruptive xanthomas are yellow-orange-to-red-brown papules that are often surrounded by an erythematous halo. They appear in crops on the buttocks, extensor surfaces of the extremities, and flexural creases. Acutely, variable amounts of pruritus and pain occur.	发疹性黄瘤	发疹性黄瘤表现为橙黄色到红褐色的丘疹，周围有红晕。常突然成批发生于臀部、四肢伸侧及皱褶部位，严重者可伴不同程度的瘙痒和疼痛。
HP:0001014	心血管系统异常,体壁的异常	Angiokeratoma	A vascular lesion defined histologically as one or more dilated blood vessels lying directly subepidermal and showing an epidermal proliferative reaction. Clinically, angiokeratoma presents as a small, raised, dark-red spot.	血管角皮瘤	血管角皮瘤是一种血管病变，在组织学上表现为一个或多个直接位于表皮下的血管扩张以及表皮的增生性反应。临床表现为凸起的,深红色的小斑点。

HP:0001019	体壁的异常,免疫系统异常	Erythroderma	An inflammatory exfoliative dermatosis involving nearly all of the surface of the skin. Erythroderma develops suddenly. A patchy erythema may generalize and spread to affect most of the skin. Scaling may appear in 2-6 days and be accompanied by hot, red, dry skin, malaise, and fever.	剥脱性皮炎	剥脱性皮炎是一种几乎累及全身皮肤的炎症性剥脱性皮肤病，往往起病较急，通常表现为片状红斑并泛发扩散至全身， 2-6天后开始脱屑并伴有皮肤发热潮红、干燥不适和体温升高。

HP:0001028	肿瘤,心血管系统异常	Hemangioma	A hemangioma is a benign tumor characterized by blood-filled spaces lined by benign endothelial cells. A hemangioma characterized by large endothelial spaces (caverns) is called a cavernous hemangioma (in contrast to a hemangioma with small endothelial spaces, which is called capillary hemangioma).	血管瘤	血管瘤是一种良性肿瘤，其特征为由良性血管内皮细胞衬覆的血管腔。以大内皮腔（海绵体腔）为特征的血管瘤被称为海绵状血管瘤（与被称为毛细管血管瘤的小内皮腔不同）。
HP:0001029	体壁的异常	Poikiloderma	Poikiloderma refers to a patch of skin with (1) reticulated hypopigmentation and hyperpigmentation, (2) wrinkling secondary to epidermal atrophy, and (3) telangiectasias.	皮肤异色症	皮肤异色指皮肤表面出现（1）网状色素减退和色素沉着；（2）继发于表皮萎缩的皱褶，及（3）毛细血管扩张形成的斑片。

HP:0001051	体壁的异常,免疫系统异常	Seborrheic dermatitis	Seborrheic dermatitis is a form of eczema which is closely related to dandruff. It causes dry or greasy peeling of the scalp, eyebrows, and face, and sometimes trunk.	脂溢性皮炎	脂溢性皮炎是湿疹的一种类型，和皮屑密切相关。它可以导致头皮、眉部、面部，甚至躯干的干燥或油腻性脱屑。

HP:0001056	体壁的异常	Milia	Presence of multiple small cysts containing keratin (skin protein) and presenting as tiny pearly-white bumps just under the surface of the skin.	粟丘疹	皮下的多个呈细小白色珠状的丘疹，内含角蛋白（皮肤蛋白）。
HP:0001057	体壁的异常	aplasia cutis congenita	A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin in multiple or solitary non-inflammatory, well-demarcated, oval or circular ulcers with a diameter of about 1 to 2 cm. Aplasia cutis congenita most commonly occurs on the scalp, but may present in the face, trunk, or limbs.	先天性表皮发育不全	发育缺陷导致的多个或单独的非炎症性的,边界清楚，直径约1 - 2厘米的椭圆形或圆形溃疡，是一种先天性皮肤缺损。这种先天性表皮发育不全最常发生在头皮上,但也可能出现在面部、躯干或四肢。

HP:0001061	体壁的异常,免疫系统异常	Acne	A skin condition in which there is an increase in sebum secretion by the pilosebaceous apparatus associated with  open comedones (blackheads), closed comedones (whiteheads), and pustular nodules (papules, pustules, and cysts).	痤疮	主要表现为皮脂分泌增加，根据毛囊皮脂腺的状态分为开放性粉刺（黑头）、闭合性粉刺（白头）和脓疱结节（丘疹，脓疱，和囊肿）。

HP:0001065	体壁的异常	Striae distensae	Thinned, erythematous, depressed bands of atrophic skin. Initially, striae appear as flattened and thinned, pinkish linear regions of the skin. Striae tend to enlarge in length and become reddish or purplish. Later, striae tend to appear as white, depressed bands that are parallel to the lines of skin tension. Striae distensae occur most often in areas that have been subject to distension such as the lower back, buttocks, thighs, breast, abdomen, and shoulders.	萎缩纹	皮肤表现为红色、较薄的凹陷性萎缩带。初起为粉红色的线状萎缩，接着，线状拉长且颜色变为淡红或略带紫色，最后，表现为白色的与皮纹方向平行的凹陷性萎缩带。萎缩纹最常发生在弹性较大的部位，如腰部、臀部、大腿、胸部、腹部和肩部。

HP:0001076	肿瘤,心血管系统异常	Glabellar hemangioma	Glabellar hemangioma,which is a benign and usually self-involuting tumor (swelling or growth) of the endothelial cells that line blood vessels that is characterised by increased number of normal or abnormal vessels filled with blood.	眉间血管瘤	血管瘤是一种良性的、通常能够自行消退的内皮细胞肿瘤（膨大或者生长），以正常或异常的充满血液的血管数量增多为特征。发生在眉间的血管瘤即眉间血管瘤。

HP:0001082	消化系统异常	Cholecystitis	The presence of `inflammatory` (PATO:0002104) changes in the `gallbladder` (FMA:7202).	胆囊炎	胆囊存在炎症改变。
HP:0001083	眼部异常	Ectopia lentis	Dislocation or malposition of the crystalline lens of the eye. A partial displacement (or dislocation) of the lens is described as a subluxation of the lens, while a complete displacement is termed luxation of the lens. A complete displacement occurs if the lens is completely outside the patellar fossa of the lens, either in the anterior chamber, in the vitreous, or directly on the retina. If the lens is partially displaced but still contained within the lens space, then it is termed subluxation.	晶状体异位	晶状体的错位。晶状体的局部位移（或错位）被称为晶状体的半脱位，而一个完整的位移被称为晶状体的脱位。晶状体脱位是晶状体完全脱出晶状体窝，位于前房，玻璃体或视网膜上。如果晶状体部分错位，但仍然包含在晶体空间内，则它被称为半脱位。
HP:0001084	眼部异常	Corneal arcus	A hazy, grayish-white ring about 2 mm in width located close to but separated from the limbus (the corneoscleral junction). Corneal arcus generally occurs bilaterally, and is related to lipid deposition in the cornea. Corneal arcus can occur in elderly persons as a part of the aging process but may be associated with hypercholesterolemia in people under the age of 50 years.	角膜环	角膜缘（角巩膜交界处）的朦胧的，灰白色的约2毫米宽的环形带。角膜环一般在双侧均发生，并与角膜脂质沉积相关。角膜环可发生于老年人，是衰老过程的一部分，也可发生于50岁以下患有高胆固醇血症的人。
HP:0001085	眼部异常	Papilledema	Papilledema refers to edema (swelling) of the optic disc secondary to any factor which increases cerebral spinal fluid pressure.	视乳头水肿	乳头水肿指继发于任何导致脑脊髓液压力增高的因素，视盘发生水肿（肿胀）。

HP:0001097	头部和颈部的异常,免疫系统异常,眼部异常	Keratoconjunctivitis sicca	Dryness of the eye related to deficiency of the tear film components (aqueous, mucin, or lipid), lid surface abnormalities, or epithelial abnormalities. Keratoconjunctivitis sicca often results in a scratchy or sandy sensation (foreign body sensation) in the eyes, and may also be associated with itching, inability to produce tears, photosensitivity, redness, pain, and difficulty in moving the eyelids.	干燥性角结膜炎	干眼可由相关的泪膜成分（水，粘蛋白，或脂质）缺乏，眼睑异常，或上皮异常所致。干燥性角结膜炎通常导致眼睛内出现划痕或砂砾样的感觉（异物感），可同时伴有瘙痒，泪少，对光敏感，发红，疼痛和眼睑移动困难。

HP:0001142	眼部异常	Lenticonus	A conical projection of the anterior or posterior surface of the lens, occurring as a developmental anomaly.	圆锥形晶状体	晶状体的前部或后部表面的锥形突起，是一种发育异常。
HP:0001144	头部和颈部的异常	Orbital cyst	Presence of a cyst in the region of the orbita. Orbital cysts can be derived from epithelial or glandular tissue within or surrounding the orbit (lacrimal glands, salivary glands, conjunctival, oral, nasal, or sinus epithelium).	眼眶囊肿	眼眶区域的囊肿。眼眶囊肿可从眼眶内或周围的上皮或腺组织（泪腺，唾液腺，结膜，口腔，鼻腔，鼻窦或上皮）衍生。
HP:0001145		Chorioretinopathy	Chorioretinopathy	脉络膜视网膜病变	发生于脉络膜视网膜的病变
HP:0001146	眼部异常	Pigmentary retinal degeneration	Pigmentary retinal degeneration	色素性视网膜变性	色素性视网膜变性。
HP:0001147	眼部异常	Retinal exudate	Fluid which has escaped from retinal bllod vessels with a high concentration of lipid, protein, and cellular debris with a typically bright, reflective, white or cream colored appearance on the surface of the retina.	视网膜渗出	视网膜血管中含有高浓度脂质，蛋白质和细胞碎片的液体渗出，视网膜表面呈现典型的反射性、明亮、白色或乳白色的彩色外观。
HP:0001149	眼部异常	Lattice corneal dystrophy	The presence of fine, branching linear opacities in Bowman&#39;s layer in the central area that may spread to the periphery in the clinical course. The deep corneal stroma may be involved but the process does not reach Descemet&#39;s membrane. Recurrent corneal erosion may occur. Histologic examination reveals amyloid deposits in the collagen fibers of the cornea.	格子样角膜营养不良	角膜上Bowman层出现细小分枝状的浑浊，随病程进展可能从中央部扩散到周边。病变可能累及深角膜基质，但不会影响Descemet膜，可能会经常性出现角膜糜烂。组织学检查显示在角膜中出现胶原纤维淀粉样蛋白沉积物。
HP:0001150		Choroidal sclerosis	Choroidal sclerosis is a descriptive term applied to the ophthalmoscopic appearance of prominent white choroidal vessels in which the blood columns are not seen or are sheathed by white lines.	脉络膜硬化	脉络膜硬化是一种描述性术语，用于描述眼底检查中不能看到脉络膜血管或脉络膜血管有白线护套。
HP:0001151	眼部异常	Impaired horizontal smooth pursuit	An `abnormality of ocular smooth pursuit` (HP:0000617) characterized by an impairment of the ability to track horizontally moving objects.	水平平滑追随眼动受损	眼部平滑追踪功能出现异常（HP:0000617），其特征为追踪水平移动物体的能力发生损害。
HP:0001152	眼部异常	Saccadic smooth pursuit	An abnormality of tracking eye movements in which smooth pursuit is interrupted by an abnormally high number of saccadic movements.	扫视追求平稳运动异常	#####
HP:0001153	泌尿生殖系统异常	Septate vagina	The presence of a vaginal septum, thereby creating a vaginal duplication. The septum is longitudinal in the majority of cases.	阴道纵膈	阴道存在隔膜，在大多数病例隔膜是纵向的，故产生了两个阴道。
HP:0001155	肢体异常	Abnormality of the hand	An abnormality affecting one or both hands.	手异常	影响到一只手或双手的异常。
HP:0001156	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Brachydactyly syndrome	Digits that appear disproportionately short compared to the hand/foot. The word brachydactyly is used to describe a series of Mendelian diseases characterized by distinct patterns of shortened digits (brachydactyly types A-E). This is the sense used here, however, it is preferable to described the observed phenotypic abnormalities precisely.	短指畸形综合征	指（趾）与手/脚不成比例的短小。短指用来描述了一系列具有明显缩短的指（趾）模式（短指类型A-E）的孟德尔疾病，也是这里使用的释义。但是它更适合精确描述所观察到的表型异常。
HP:0001159	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Syndactyly	Webbing or fusion of the fingers or toes, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are revered to as &quot;bony&quot; syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers or toes in a proximo-distal axis are refered to as &quot;symphalangism&quot;.	并指（趾）畸形	手指或脚趾间出现蹼或融合，可以仅涉及软组织或包括骨结构。发生在桡尺轴线的骨性融合被称为“骨性并指”。手指或脚趾在近-远轴的骨头融合称为“关节粘连”。
HP:0001161	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Hand polydactyly	A kind of `polydactyly` (HP:0010442) characterized by the presence of a supernumerary finger or fingers.	多指	一种多指（趾）类型（HP:0010442），特点是存在额外的手指。
HP:0001162	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Postaxial hand polydactyly	Supernumerary digits located at the ulnar side of the hand (that is, on the side with the fifth finger).	轴后多指畸形	额外的手指位于手尺侧（即第五指的一侧）。
HP:0001163	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Abnormality of the metacarpal bones	An abnormality of the `metacarpal bones`(FMA:71336).	掌骨异常	掌骨的异常(FMA:71336)。
HP:0001166	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Arachnodactyly	Abnormally long and slender fingers (&quot;spider fingers&quot;).	细长指(趾)	异常修长的手指（“蜘蛛指”）。
HP:0001167	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Abnormality of finger	An abnormal movement of any finger.	手指异常	手指的运动异常。
HP:0001169	肢体异常	Broad palm	For children from birth to 4 years of age the palm width is more than 2 SD above the mean; for children from 4 to 16 years of age the palm width is above the 95th centile; or, the width of the palm appears disproportionately wide for the length.	宽掌	儿童从出生至4岁的手掌宽度大于平均值2个标准差；4至16岁儿童的手掌宽度大于第95百分位数;或者手掌过宽，与长度不成比例。
HP:0001171	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Split hand	A condition in which middle parts of the hand (fingers and metacarpals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic middle fingers over absent middel fingers as far as oligo- or monodactyl hands.	手劈裂	手的中间部分（手指和掌骨）丢失，给人一种劈裂的外观。其严重程度是变化很大，从中指略微发育不良、中指缺如，以至寡指或单指手。
HP:0001172	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Abnormality of the thumb	An anomaly of the `thumb`(FMA:24938).	拇指异常	拇指的异常(FMA:24938)。
HP:0001176	肢体异常	Large hands	#####	巨手	#####
HP:0001177	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Preaxial hand polydactyly	Supernumerary digits located at the radial side of the hand. Polydactyly (supernumerary digits) involving the thumb occurs in many distinct forms of high variability and severity. Ranging from fleshy nubbins over varying degrees of partial duplication/splitting to completely duplicated or even triplicated thumbs or preaxial (on the radial side of the hand) supernumerary digits.	轴前多指急性	额外的手指位于手的桡侧。（桡侧）多指的形式和严重程度变异性大，甚至涉及部分重复/分叉、完全重复、三倍重复的拇指，或者在内侧（手的桡侧）出现多指。
HP:0001178	肢体异常	Ulnar claw	An abnormal hand position characterized by hyperextension of the fourth and fifth fingers at the metacarpophalangeal joints and flexion of the interphalangeal joints of the same fingers such that they are curled towards the palm.	尺侧爪形手	手的姿态异常，特征是无名指和小手指掌指关节的过伸，同时发生指间关节弯曲，向掌心屈曲。
HP:0001180	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Oligodactyly (hands)	A developmental defect resulting in the presence of fewer than the normal number of fingers.	少指（趾）畸形	发育缺陷造成手指数量较正常少。
HP:0001181	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Adducted thumb	In the resting position, the tip of the thumb is on, or near, the palm, close to the base of the fourth or fifth finger.	拇指内收	在静止位时，拇指尖端靠近或位于手掌、第四或第五指根部。
HP:0001182	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Tapered finger	The gradual reduction in girth of the digit from proximal to distal.	锥形指	手指的指围从近端向末端逐渐减少。
HP:0001187	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Hyperextensibility of the finger joints	The ability of the finger joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.	指间关节过伸	指间关节的活动能力超过其运动正常范围。
HP:0001188	肢体异常	Hand clenching	An abnormal hand posture in which the hands are clenched to fists. All digits held completely flexed at the metacarpophalangeal and interphalangeal joints.	攥拳手	不正常的手姿势，双手攥紧成拳。所有手指的掌指及指间关节完全屈曲。
HP:0001191	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Abnormality of the carpal bones	An abnormality affecting the carpal bones of the wrist (scaphoid, lunate, triquetral, pisiform, trapezium, trapezoid, capitate, hamate).	腕骨异常	影响手腕骨骼的异常，组成手腕的骨骼有舟骨、月骨、三角骨、豆状骨、大多角骨、小多角骨、头状骨和钩骨。
HP:0001193	肢体异常	Ulnar deviation of the hand or of fingers of the hand	#####	手或手指尺侧偏斜	#####
HP:0001194	胎儿产前发育或出生异常	Abnormalities of placenta and umbilical cord	An abnormality of the placenta (the organ that connects the developing fetus to the uterine wall) or of the umbilical cord (the cord that connects the fetus to the placenta).	胎盘和脐带的异常	胎盘（发育中的胎儿子宫壁连接的器官）或脐带的（胎儿与胎盘的连接）中的异常。
HP:0001195	心血管系统异常,胎儿产前发育或出生异常	Single umbilical artery	Single umbilical artery (SUA) is the absence of one of the two umbilical arteries surrounding the fetal bladder and in the fetal umbilical cord.	单脐动脉	单脐动脉（SUA）是指在超声影像下缺乏脐带中两条脐动脉围绕胎儿膀胱的正常声像特征，而仅见其中一条。
HP:0001196	胎儿产前发育或出生异常	Short umbilical cord	Decreased length of the `umbilical cord` (FMA:85541).	脐带过短	脐带长度缩短。
HP:0001197	胎儿产前发育或出生异常	Abnormality of prenatal development or birth	An abnormality of the fetus or the birth of the fetus, excluding structural abnormalities.	胎儿产前发育或出生异常	胎儿的异常或胎儿出生异常，不含结构异常。
HP:0001199	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Triphalangeal thumb	A thumb with three phalanges in a single, proximo-distal axis. Thus, this term applies if the thumb has an accessory phalanx, leading to a digit like appearance of the thumb.	三指节拇指	拇指在近-远轴上有三节指骨。该术语用于描述拇指有一个额外的指骨，拇指变成与其他手指一样的外观。
HP:0001204	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Distal symphalangism (hands)	The term distal symphalangism refers to a bony fusion of the distal and middle phalanges of the digits of the hand, in other words the distal interphalangeal joint (DIJ) is missing which can be seen either on x-rays or as an absence of the distal interphalangeal finger creases.	远端指间关节粘连	术语远端指间关节粘连指手指远节指骨和中节指骨的骨融合，即在X线下可见远端指间关节（DIJ）缺如或指远侧纹缺如，。
HP:0001211	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Abnormality of the fingertips	#####	指尖异常	指尖异常
HP:0001212	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常,体壁的异常	Prominent fingertip pads	A soft tissue prominence of the ventral aspects of the fingertips. The term &quot;persistent fetal fingertip pads&quot; is often used as a synonym, but should better not be used because it implies knowledge of history of the patient which often does not exist.	指尖垫突出	指尖的腹侧方面的软组织突出。术语“持续胎儿指尖垫”经常被用作同义词，但是最好不要使用，因为它暗示病人有不存在的病史。
HP:0001215	肌肉组织异常,肢体异常,结缔组织异常,骨骼系统异常	Camptodactyly of 2nd-5th fingers	The distal interphalangeal joint and/or the proximal interphalangeal joint of the second to fifth fingers cannot be extended to 180 degrees by either active or passive extension.	第2-5指全屈曲	远端指间关节和/或第2-5手指的近端指间关节无法通过主动或被动的伸展，伸直到180度。
HP:0001216	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Delayed ossification of carpal bones	Ossification of carpal bones occurs later than age-adjusted norms.	腕骨骨化延迟	腕骨骨化发生比相应年龄阶段迟。
HP:0001217	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Clubbing	Broadening of the soft tissues (non-edematous swelling of soft tissues) of the digital tips in all dimensions associated with an increased longitudinal and lateral curvature of the nails.	杵状指	指端软组织增宽（软组织无肿胀水肿）合并指甲的纵向和横向弧度增加。
HP:0001218	肢体异常	Autoamputation	Spontaneous detachment (amputation) of an appendage from the body.	自发性肢体离断	身体的附肢自发断肢（截肢）。
HP:0001220	肌肉组织异常,肢体异常,结缔组织异常,骨骼系统异常	Interphalangeal joint contracture of finger	Chronic loss of joint motion in an interphalangeal joint of a finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.	手指指间关节挛缩	由于非骨组织结构变化，手指指间关节的运动能力慢性受损。
HP:0001222	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Spatulate thumbs	Spoon-shaped, broad thumbs.	匙状拇指	匙状的宽拇指。
HP:0001223	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Pointed proximal second through fifth metacarpals	All of the metacarpal bones of the hand have a pointed proximal appearance.	第2-5掌骨近端尖	所有掌骨具有近侧尖端的外观。
HP:0001225	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Wrist swelling	#####	腕肿胀	#####
HP:0001226	肢体异常,体壁的异常	Acral ulceration and osteomyelitis leading to autoamputation of digits	Ulceration and osteomyelitis of the distal parts of the limbs associated with necrosis and spontaneous detachment of digits or parts of digits.	肢端溃疡和骨髓炎导致手指自发性离断	肢体远端出现溃疡和骨髓炎，与手指坏死和手指或部分手指从四肢的前端部自发性离断有关。
HP:0001227	肌肉组织异常,肢体异常	Abnormality of the thenar eminence	An abnormality of the thenar eminence, i.e., of the muscle on the palm of the human hand just beneath the thumb.	大鱼际异常	大鱼际的异常，大鱼际是拇指下方的手掌肌肉。
HP:0001230	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Broad metacarpals	Abnormally broad metacarpal bones.	掌骨变宽	#####
HP:0001231	体壁的异常	Abnormality of the fingernails	An abnormality of the `fingernails` (FMA:54327).	指甲异常	指甲的异常。
HP:0001232	心血管系统异常,体壁的异常	Nail bed telangiectasia	Telangiectases in the area of the `nails` (FMA:54326).	甲床毛细血管扩张	指甲基底部毛细血管扩张。
HP:0001233	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	2-3 finger syndactyly	2-3 finger syndactyly means the fusion of 2nd to 3rd finger.	第2-3指并指	第2-3个手指融合。
HP:0001234	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Hitchhiker thumb	With the hand relaxed and the thumb in the plane of the palm, the axis of the thumb forms an angle of at least 90 degrees with the long axis of the hand.	“打车手势”拇指	手放松且拇指位于掌平面时，拇指的轴线与手的长轴形成至少90度角。
HP:0001238	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Slender finger	Digits are disproportionately narrow (reduced girth) for the hand/foot size or build of the individual.	手指细长	手/足指/趾不成比例的狭窄（周长减少）。
HP:0001239	肌肉组织异常,肢体异常,结缔组织异常,骨骼系统异常	Wrist flexion contracture	A chronic loss of wrist joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevent normal movement of the joints of the wrist.	腕关节屈曲挛缩	由于肌肉、肌腱、韧带或皮肤的结构性变化，使腕关节活动度慢性丧失，妨碍了手腕关节的正常运动。
HP:0001241	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Capitate-hamate fusion	#####	头钩骨融合	#####
HP:0001245	肌肉组织异常,肢体异常	Small thenar eminence	Underdevelopment of the thenar eminence with reduced palmar soft tissue mass surrounding the base of the thumb.	小鱼际小	小鱼际发育不好，拇指根部手掌软组织减少。
HP:0001248	肢体异常	Short tubular bones (hand)	#####	短管状骨（手）	#####
HP:0001249	神经系统异常	Intellectual disability	Subnormal intellectual functioning which originates during the developmental period. Intellectual disability, previously referred to as mental retardation, has been defined as an IQ score below 70.	智力残疾	源于发育阶段的智力功能低于正常。智力残疾，以前被称为精神发育迟滞，定义为智商得分低于70。
HP:0001250	神经系统异常	Seizures	Seizures are an intermittent `abnormality of the central nervous system` (FMA:HP:0002011) due to a sudden, excessive, disorderly discharge of cerebral neurons and characterized clinically by some combination of disturbance of sensation, loss of consciousness, impairment of psychic function, or convulsive movements. The term epilepsy is used to describe chronic, recurrent seizures.	癫痫发作	癫痫发作是中枢神经系统（FMA:HP:0002011）因突然，过度，无序大脑神经元放电而产生的间歇性异常；临床特点由感觉障碍、意识丧失、精神功能受损、或抽搐的动作为特征。术语“癫痫”用于描述慢性，复发性癫痫发作。
HP:0001251	神经系统异常	Ataxia	Cerebellar ataxia refers to ataxia due to dysfunction of the cerebellum. This causes a variety of elementary neurological deficits including asynergy (lack of coordination between muscles, limbs and joints), dysmetria (lack of ability to judge distances that can lead to under- oder overshoot in grasping movements), and dysdiadochokinesia (inability to perform rapid movements requiring antagonizing muscle groups to be switched on and off repeatedly).	共济失调	小脑共济失调是指由于小脑功能障碍导致的共济失调。这引起了各种基本的神经缺陷，包括协调不能（缺乏肌肉，四肢和关节之间的协调），辨距障碍（缺乏判断距离能力，可导致抓握运动时不能达到或超过目标），和轮替运动障碍（不能进行需要拮抗肌群反复切换开关的快速运动）。
HP:0001252	肌肉组织异常	Muscular hypotonia	Muscular hypotonia is an abnormally low muscle tone (the amount of tension or resistance to movement in a muscle), often involving reduced muscle strength. Hypotonia is characterized by a diminished resistance to passive stretching.	肌张力减退	肌张力减退是指肌张力异常低下（张力运动或拮抗运动肌肉量），常累及肌力减退。张力减退的特征在于拮抗运动减少，以被动伸展为主。
HP:0001254	神经系统异常	Lethargy	A state of  disinterestedness, listlessness, and indifference, resulting in difficulty performing simple tasks or concentrating.	昏睡	一种漠不关心，精神萎靡，无欲的状态，导致难以执行简单任务或集中注意力。
HP:0001256	神经系统异常	Intellectual disability, mild	Mild intellectual disability is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 50-69.	轻度智力残疾	轻度智力残疾定义为智商（IQ）在50-69的范围内。
HP:0001257	肌肉组织异常,神经系统异常	Spasticity	A motor disorder characterized by a velocity-dependent increase in tonic stretch reflexes with increased muscle tone, exaggerated (hyperexcitable) tendon reflexes.	痉挛	一种运动系统疾病，特征是速度依赖性牵张反射伴与肌张力增高，腱反射亢进（过度兴奋）。
HP:0001258	肌肉组织异常,神经系统异常	Spastic paraplegia	Spasticity and weakness of the leg and hip muscles.	痉挛性截瘫	痉挛状态和小腿和臀部的肌肉无力。
HP:0001259	神经系统异常	Coma	Complete absence of wakefulness and content of conscience, which manifests itself as a lack of response to any kind of external stimuli.	昏迷	完全没有觉醒和意识内容，表现为对任何外部刺激没有反应。
HP:0001260	神经系统异常	Dysarthria	Dysarthric speech is a general description referring to a neurological speech disorder characterized by poor articulation. Depending on the involved neurological structures, dysarthria may be further classified as spastic, flaccid, ataxic, hyperkinetic and hypokinetic, or mixed.	构音障碍	构音障碍一般用于描述语言清晰度降低的神经言语障碍。根据受损的神经结构不同，可分为痉挛性、弛缓性、共济失调性、运动过度性、运动减弱性或混合性构音障碍。
HP:0001262	神经系统异常	Somnolence	#####	嗜睡	#####
HP:0001263	神经系统异常	Global developmental delay	A delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child, including motor skills, speech and language, cognitive skills, and social and emotional skills. This term should only be used to describe children younger than five years of age.	全面发育迟缓	儿童重要的运动功能和精神发育迟缓，包括运动技能，言语和语言能力，认知能力和社会情感能力。此术语应仅用于描述的年龄小于五岁儿童。
HP:0001264	肌肉组织异常,神经系统异常	Spastic diplegia	Spasticity (neuromuscular hypertonia) primarily in the muscles of the legs, hips, and pelvis.	痉挛性双侧瘫痪	痉挛（神经肌肉张力增高）主要集中在腿部，臀部和骨盆的肌肉。
HP:0001265	神经系统异常	Hyporeflexia	Reduction of neurologic reflexes such as the knee-jerk reaction.	腱反射减弱	神经反射减弱，如膝腱反射。
HP:0001266	神经系统异常	Choreoathetosis	Involuntary movements characterized by both athetosis (inability to sustain muscles in a fixed position) and chorea (widespread jerky arrhythmic movements).	舞蹈手足徐动	以手足徐动（无法维持肌肉在固定位置）和舞蹈样运动（广泛无节奏的不自主强行运动）为特征的不自主运动。
HP:0001268	神经系统异常	Mental deterioration	Loss of previously present mental abilities, generally in adults.	智能衰退	既往存在的智能丧失，一般指成人。
HP:0001269	神经系统异常	Hemiparesis	Relatively mild weakness in the arm, leg, and in some cases the face on one side of the body.	轻偏瘫	一侧上下肢相对较轻的无力，有时累及面部。
HP:0001270	神经系统异常	Motor delay	A type of `Developmental delay` (HP:0001263) characterized by a delay in acquiring motor skills.	运动发育迟缓	一种主要表现为运动技能学习能力延迟的发育迟滞。
HP:0001271	神经系统异常	Polyneuropathy	A generalized disorder of peripheral nerves.	多发性神经病	周围神经的广泛疾病
HP:0001272	神经系统异常	Cerebellar atrophy	Atrophy (wasting) of the cerebellum`(FMA:67944).	小脑萎缩	小脑萎缩（缩小）（FMA:67944）。
HP:0001273	神经系统异常	Abnormality of the corpus callosum	Abnormality of the `corpus callosum` (FMA:86464).	胼胝体异常	`胼胝体`的异常（FMA:86464）。
HP:0001274	神经系统异常	Agenesis of corpus callosum	Absence of the corpus callosum as a result of the failure of the corpus callosum to develop, which can be the result of a failure in any one of the multiple steps of callosal development including cellular proliferation and migration, axonal growth or glial patterning at the midline.	胼胝体发育不全	胼胝体发育障碍导致的胼胝体缺如，它可以由发育过程中的多个步骤的障碍引起，包括在中线的细胞增殖和迁移，轴突生长或神经胶质细胞生长。
HP:0001276	肌肉组织异常,神经系统异常	Hypertonia	#####	肌张力增高	一种肌张力增高的状态，以至于手臂和腿部僵硬无法运动。
HP:0001278	神经系统异常,心血管系统异常	Orthostatic hypotension	A form of hypotension characterized by a sudden fall in blood pressure that occurs when a person assumes a standing position.	体位性低血压	当一个人变换为站立位时血压突然下降的一种低血压。
HP:0001279	心血管系统异常	Syncope	Syncope is defined as a short loss of consciousness and muscle strength, characterized by a fast onset, short duration, and spontaneous recovery.	晕厥	晕厥是指暂时性意识丧失和肌肉无力，特点是发作迅速，持续时间短，能自然恢复。
HP:0001281	肌肉组织异常	Tetany	A disorder characterized by muscle twitches, cramps, and carpopedal spasm, and when severe, laryngospasm and seizures. This condition is associated with unstable depolarization of axonal membranes, primarily in the peripheral nervous system.	手足抽搐	一个疾病的特点是肌肉抽搐，痉挛，及手足痉挛，严重时，出现喉痉挛和癫痫发作。这种病症与轴突膜不稳定去极化相关联，主要在周围神经系统。
HP:0001283	肌肉组织异常,神经系统异常	Bulbar palsy	Bulbar weakness (or bulbar palsy) refers to bilateral impairment of function of the lower cranial nerves IX, X, XI and XII, which occurs due to lower motor neuron lesion either at nuclear or fascicular level in the medulla or from bilateral lesions of the lower cranial nerves outside the brain-stem. Bulbar weakness is often associated with difficulty in chewing, weakness of the facial muscles, dysarthria, palatal weakness and regurgitation of fluids, dysphagia, and dysphonia.	球麻痹	球麻痹（或延髓麻痹）是指后组颅神经（九、十、十一和十二）双侧功能损害。延髓核或束水平的下运动神经元病变或者发自脑干的后组颅神经双侧病变时出现球麻痹。球麻痹往往与咀嚼困难，面部肌肉无力，构音障碍，软腭无力和呛咳，吞咽困难，发音困难相关。
HP:0001284	神经系统异常	Areflexia	Absence of neurologic reflexes such as the knee-jerk reaction.	神经反射消失	没有神经反射，如膝腱反应。
HP:0001285	肌肉组织异常,神经系统异常	Spastic tetraparesis	Spastic weakness affecting all four limbs.	痉挛性四肢瘫	痉挛性无力影响到四肢。
HP:0001287	神经系统异常,免疫系统异常	Meningitis	`Inflammation` (MPATH:212) of the `meninges` (FMA:231572).	脑膜炎	`脑膜（FMA:231572）的炎症 (MPATH:212)。
HP:0001288	神经系统异常	Gait disturbance	The term gait disturbance can refer to any disruption of the ability to walk. In general, this can refer to neurological diseases but also fractures or other sources of pain that is triggered upon walking. However, in the current context gait disturbance refers to difficulty walking on the basis of a neurological or muscular disease.	步态不稳	步态不稳可以用于描述任何形式的行走能力受损。广义上，指因神经系统病变影响行走，但是也可以是骨折或其他原因的疼痛。目前步态不稳指因神经或肌肉病变导致的行走困难。
HP:0001289	神经系统异常	Confusion	Lack of clarity and coherence of thought, perception, understanding, or action.	意识模糊	缺乏明确、连贯的思维、感知、理解或行动。
HP:0001290	肌肉组织异常	Generalized hypotonia	Generalized muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone).	全身性肌张力减低	广泛的肌张力减退（异常低肌张力）。
HP:0001291	神经系统异常	Abnormality of the cranial nerves	Abnormality affecting one or more of the `cranial nerves` (FMA:5865), which emerge directly from the brain stem.	颅神经异常	一支或多支颅神经（FMA:5865）的异常，颅神经是直接从脑干发出的神经。
HP:0001293	神经系统异常	Cranial nerve compression	Intracranial space-occupying lesions, such as intracranial tumors, brain abscess, as well as craniocerebral trauma caused by intracranial hematoma, depressed skull fractures, can lead to the symptoms of oppression of the brain.	颅神经受压	颅内占位性病变，如颅内肿瘤、脑脓肿等，以及颅脑外伤导致的颅内血肿、凹陷性颅骨骨折，均可以出现压迫大脑神经的症状。
HP:0001297	神经系统异常,心血管系统异常	Stroke	Sudden impairment of blood flow to a part of the brain due to occlusion or rupture of an artery to the brain.	卒中	由于大脑动脉闭塞或破裂，导致供应部分大脑的血流突然受损。
HP:0001298	神经系统异常	Encephalopathy	Encephalopathy is a term that means brain disease, damage, or malfunction. In general, encephalopathy is manifested by an altered mental state.	脑病	脑病是用于描述脑部疾病、损伤或故障的术语。一般情况下，脑病可表现为精神状态改变。
HP:0001300	神经系统异常	Parkinsonism	Characteristic neurologic anomaly resulting form degeneration of dopamine-generating cells in the substantia nigra, a region of the midbrain, characterized clinically by shaking, rigidity, slowness of movement and difficulty with walking and gait.	帕金森症	由于中脑黑质产生多巴胺的神经元变性而导致以震颤、强直、行动迟缓和步态异常为特征的神经系统异常
HP:0001301	神经系统异常	Chronic sensorineural polyneuropathy	#####	慢性多发性感觉神经病	#####
HP:0001302	神经系统异常	Pachygyria	A congenital abnormality of the cerebral hemisphere chacterized by unusually thick gyrations (convolutions) of the cerebral cortex.	巨脑回	一种表现为大脑半球皮层脑回异常增厚的一种先天性畸形。
HP:0001304	神经系统异常	Torsion dystonia	Sustained involuntary  muscle contractions that produce twisting and repetitive movements of the body.	扭转性肌张力障碍	持续不自主的肌肉收缩引起身体的扭曲和重复的动作。
HP:0001305	神经系统异常,骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Dandy-Walker malformation	A congenital brain malformation typically characterized by incomplete formation of the cerebellar vermis, dilation of the fourth ventricle, and enlargement of the posterior fossa. In layman&#39;s terms, Dandy Walker malformation is a cyst in the cerebellum (typically symmetrical) that is involved with the fourth ventricle. This may interfere with the ability to drain cerebrospinal fluid from the brain, resulting in hydrocephalus. Dandy Walker cysts are formed during early embryonic development, while the brain forms. The cyst in the cerebellum typically has several blood vessels running through it connecting to the brain, thereby prohibiting surgical removal.	第四脑室孔闭塞综合征（Dandy-Walker畸形）	先天性脑畸形典型特征是小脑蚓部形成不完整，第四脑室扩张，以及后颅窝扩大。通俗地说，丹迪•沃克畸形是小脑和第四脑室相关的囊肿（通常是对称的）。这可能会干扰到脑脊液从脑流出的能力，导致脑积水。丹迪•沃克囊肿是在早期胚胎发育大脑形成时形成的。小脑的囊肿通常有几条血管贯穿其连接到大脑，因而无法手术切除。
HP:0001308	神经系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Tongue fasciculations	Fasciculations or fibrillation affecting the tongue muscle.	舌肌束震颤	舌肌肌束颤动或震动。
HP:0001310	神经系统异常	Dysmetria	A type of `ataxia` (HP:0001251) characterized by the inability to carry out movements with the correct range and motion across the plane of more than one joint related to incorrect estimation of the distances required for targeted movements.	辨距不良	`共济失调`（HP:0001251）的一种，表现为因对完成目标动作需要的距离估计错误，导致不能在正确的范围内执行运动。
HP:0001311	神经系统异常	Abnormal nervous system electrophysiology	An abnormality of the function of the electrical signals with which nerve cells communicate with each other or with muscles.	神经系统电生理检查异常	神经细胞之间或神经细胞与肌肉之间联系的电信号异常。
HP:0001312	神经系统异常	Giant somatosensory evoked potentials	An abnormal enlargement (i.e. increase in measured voltage) of somatosensory evoked potentials.	巨大的体感诱发电位	一种异常增大的（如波幅增高）体感诱发电位。
HP:0001315	神经系统异常	Reduced tendon reflexes	Diminution of tendon reflexes, which is an invariable sign of peripheral nerve disease.	腱反射减低	腱反射的降低，多为周围神经疾病较恒定的体征。

HP:0001326	神经系统异常	EEG with irregular generalized spike and wave complexes	EEG shows spikes (&lt;80 ms) and waves, which are recorded over the entire scalp and do not have a specific frequency.	脑电图，不规则的全面性棘慢复合波	脑电图显示的棘慢复合波（棘波时限小于80ms），整个头皮均可记录到，不具有特定的频率。
HP:0001327	神经系统异常	Photomyoclonic seizures	#####	光肌阵挛	#####
HP:0001328	神经系统异常	Specific learning disability	Impairment of certain skills such as reading or writing, coordination, self-control, or attention that interfere with the ability to learn. The impairment is not related to a global deficiency of intelligence.	特定的学习障碍	某些技能，如阅读或写作、协调、自我控制、或注意力受损，影响学习能力。该损害是全面性智力障碍无关。
HP:0001331	神经系统异常	Absent septum pellucidum	Absence of the `septum pellucidum` (FMA:61844).	透明隔缺如	`透明隔`缺如（FMA:61844）。
HP:0001332	神经系统异常	Dystonia	An abnormally increased muscular tone that causes fixed abnormal postures. There is a slow, intermittent twisting motion that leads to exaggerated turning and posture of the extremities and trunk.	肌张力障碍	肌张力异常增加导致固定的异常姿势。因为缓慢和间歇的扭转运动导致四肢和躯干的夸张旋转和姿势。
HP:0001334	神经系统异常	Communicating hydrocephalus	A form of `hydrocephalus` (HP:0000238) in which there is no visible obstruction to the flow of the cerebrospinal fluid between the ventricles and subarachnoid space.	交通性脑积水	一种脑积水（HP:0000238）类型，在脑室和蛛网膜下腔之间的脑脊液流动中没有可见的梗阻。
HP:0001335	神经系统异常	Bimanual synkinesia	Mirror hand movements.	双手联带运动	镜像手部协同运动。
HP:0001336	神经系统异常	Myoclonus	Very brief, involuntary random muscular contractions occurring at rest, in response to sensory stimuli, or accompanying voluntary movements.	肌阵挛	很简短，随意不自主的肌肉收缩发生在休息，以应对感官刺激，或陪同随意运动。
HP:0001337	神经系统异常	Tremor	An unintentional, oscillating to-and-fro muscle movement.	震颤	一种无意的，振荡的肌肉往复运动。
HP:0001338	神经系统异常	Partial agenesis of the corpus callosum	A partial failure of the development of the corpus callosum.	局部胼胝体发育不全	部分胼胝体发育不足
HP:0001339	神经系统异常	Lissencephaly	A congenital absence of the convolutions of the cerebral cortex and a poorly formed sylvian fissure.	无脑回畸形	先天性大脑皮层的脑回缺乏和外侧裂形成不良。
HP:0001340	神经系统异常	Enhancement of the C-reflex	Increase in amplitude of a long-loop response upon somatosensory evoked potential testing, representing an electrically evoked myoclonic response.	C-反射增强	体感诱发电位长环路反应的波幅增高，代表一种电诱发的肌阵挛反应。
HP:0001341	神经系统异常	Olfactory lobe agenesis	An olfactory disorder is the partial or complete loss, abnormality of the olfactory functions.	嗅觉减退	嗅觉减退是指部分或全部嗅觉功能下降、丧失或异常。
HP:0001342	神经系统异常,血液和造血组织异常,心血管系统异常	Cerebral hemorrhage	`Hemorrhage` (MPATH:119) into the parenchyma of the `brain` (FMA:50801).	脑出血	脑实质（FMA:50801）的出血(MPATH:119)。
HP:0001343	神经系统异常	Kernicterus	Damage to cerebral nuclei caused in infants by highly increased levels of unconjugated bilirubin. The basal ganglia and brainstem nuclei could be shown to have a yellow staining historically in infants who died of kernicterus, that is, kernicterus is strictly speaking a pathological diagnosis. The presence of kernicterus may be inferred in infants with characteristic acute or chronic bilirubin-induced neurological dysfunction.	核黄疸	间接胆红素水平极度升高导致的婴儿大脑核团损害。死于核黄疸的婴儿组织学上显示基底节和脑干黄染，也就是说，核黄疸严格来说是一个病理诊断。婴儿存在核黄疸意味着特征性急性或慢性胆红素引起的神经功能障碍。
HP:0001344	神经系统异常	Absent speech	Complete lack of development of speech and language abilities.	失语	完全没有言语和语言能力的发育。
HP:0001345	神经系统异常	Psychotic mentation	Temporary mind Orientation and psychological situation of Human 's ideology.	精神心理状态	人的思想意识和心理情况的临时定位。
HP:0001347	神经系统异常	Hyperreflexia	The presence of overactive or overresponsive reflexes.	反射亢进	反射的过度活动或过度反应。
HP:0001348	神经系统异常	Brisk reflexes	#####	反射活跃	#####
HP:0001349	肌肉组织异常,神经系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Facial diplegia	Facial diplegia refers to bilateral facial palsy (bilateral facial palsy is much rarer than unilateral facial palsy).	双侧面瘫	双侧面瘫指双侧面部神经麻痹（双侧面部麻痹比单侧面部麻痹更罕见许多）。
HP:0001350	神经系统异常	Slurred speech	Abnormal coordination of muscles involved in speech.	言语不清	参与发声肌肉的异常共济失调。
HP:0001351	神经系统异常	Jerk-locked premyoclonus spikes	#####	抽动锁时的肌阵挛前棘波	#####
HP:0001355	神经系统异常	Megalencephaly	Enlargement of all or parts of the cerebral hemispheres.	巨脑	大脑半球全部或部分增大。
HP:0001357	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Plagiocephaly	Asymmetric head shape, which is usually a combination of unilateral occipital flattening with ipsilateral frontal prominence, leading to rhomboid cranial shape.	斜头畸形	非对称的头部形状，这通常是单侧枕骨平坦化合并同侧额叶突出，从而导致菱形颅骨形态。
HP:0001360	神经系统异常	Holoprosencephaly	Holoprosencephaly is a structural anomaly of the brain in which the developing forebrain fails to divide into two separate hemispheres and ventricles.	前脑无裂畸形	前脑无裂畸形是一种发育时前脑未能分成两个单独的半球和脑室的脑结构异常。
HP:0001361	眼部异常	Nystagmus-induced head nodding	Head movements associated with nystagmus, that may represent an attempt to compensate for the involuntary eye movements and to improve vision.	眼球震颤诱导点头运动	头的活动与眼球震颤相联系，这可能是企图以头颅的运动代偿眼球不自主运动，提高视力。
HP:0001362	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Skull defect	A localized defect in the bone of the skull resulting from abnormal embryological development. The defect is covered by normal skin. In some cases, skull x-rays have shown underlying lytic bone lesions which have closed before the age of one year.	颅骨缺损	由胚胎期发育异常所导致的颅骨部分缺损。缺损的部位覆盖正常的皮肤。在某些病例，头颅的X射线表明潜在的溶骨性病变在一岁之前已停止。
HP:0001363	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Craniosynostosis	Craniosynostosis refers to the premature closure of the cranial sutures. Primary craniosynostosis refers to the closure of one or more sutures due to abnormalities in skull development, and secondary craniosynostosis results from failure of brain growth.	颅缝早闭	颅缝早闭指颅缝的过早闭合。原发性颅缝早闭指由于头骨发育异常而导致的一个或多个颅骨缝合线闭合过早，而继发性颅缝早闭指由于大脑发育失败导致的结果。
HP:0001367	骨骼系统异常	Abnormal joint morphology	An abnormal structure or form of any joints.	关节形态异常	关节结构或形态异常。
HP:0001369	骨骼系统异常	Arthritis	Inflammation of a joint.	关节炎	关节的炎症。
HP:0001370	骨骼系统异常	Rheumatoid arthritis	Inflammatory changes in the synovial membranes and articular structures with widespread fibrinoid degeneration of the collagen fibers in mesenchymal tissues, as well as atrophy and rarefaction of bony structures.	类风湿关节炎	#####
HP:0001371	肌肉组织异常,结缔组织异常,骨骼系统异常	Flexion contracture	A flexion contracture is a bent (flexed) joint that cannot be straightened actively or passively. It is thus a chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement of joints.	屈曲挛缩	屈曲挛缩指关节弯曲，不能主动或被动伸直。因此它是由于肌肉、肌腱、韧带或皮肤的结构变化导致的关节运动慢性损失，阻碍关节的正常运动。
HP:0001373	骨骼系统异常	Joint dislocation	Displacement or malalignment of joints.	关节脱位	#####

HP:0001417	遗传模式	X-linked inheritance	A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome.	X-连锁遗传	#####
HP:0001419	遗传模式	X-linked recessive inheritance	A mode of inheritance that is observed for recessive traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome. In the context of medical genetics, X-linked recessive disorders manifest in males (who have one copy of the X chromosome and are thus hemizygotes), but generally not in female heterozygotes who have one mutant and one normal allele.	X-连锁隐性遗传	#####
