HP:0002341	神经系统异常	Cervical cord compression	Compression of the spinal cord in the cervical region, generally manifested by paresthesias and numbness, weakness, difficulty walking, abnormalities of coordination, and neck pain or stiffness.	颈脊髓压迫症	颈部脊髓压迫，一般表现为感觉异常、麻木、无力、行走困难、协调性障碍、颈部疼痛或僵硬。
HP:0002342	神经系统异常	Intellectual disability, moderate	Moderate mental retardation is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 35-49.	中度智力残疾	中度精神发育迟滞定义为智商（IQ）在35-49的范围内。
HP:0002343	神经系统异常	Normal pressure hydrocephalus	A form of `hydrocephalus` (HP:0000238) characterized by enlarged cerebral ventricles and normal cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) pressure upon lumbar puncture.	正常压力性脑积水	伴有腰穿检测脑脊液压力正常的脑室系统扩大的一种脑积水
HP:0002344	神经系统异常	Progressive neurologic deterioration	#####	进行性神经功能恶化	#####
HP:0002345	神经系统异常	Action tremor	A tremor present when the limbs are active, either when outstretched in a certain position or throughout a voluntary movement.	动作性震颤	当肢体处于活动状态，或者当肢体伸出在某个位置或在自主运动过程中出现的震颤。
HP:0002346	神经系统异常	Head tremor	An unintentional, oscillating to-and-fro muscle movement affecting head movement.	头部震颤	无意识的，影响头部运动的反复的肌肉振荡运动。
HP:0002349	神经系统异常	Focal seizures without impairment of consciousness or awareness	A `partial seizure` (HP:0007359) in which consciousness is maintained.	局灶性发作不伴有意识障碍	一个`部分性癫痫发作`（HP:0007359），其中意识得以保持。
HP:0002350	神经系统异常	Cerebellar cyst	Cerebellar cyst is located in the cerebellar cystic benign mass, the nature of the contents is liquid	小脑囊肿	小脑囊肿即位于小脑的囊状的良性包块，其内容物的性质是液态的.
HP:0002352	神经系统异常	Leukoencephalopathy	This term describes abnormality of the white matter of the cerebrum resulting from damage to the myelin sheaths of nerve cells.	白质脑病	该术语描述源于神经细胞的髓鞘损害所致的大脑白质异常。
HP:0002353	神经系统异常	EEG abnormality	Abnormality observed by electroencephalogram (EEG), which is used to record of the brain&#39;s spontaneous electrical activity from multiple electrodes placed on the scalp.	脑电图异常	通过头皮电极记录大脑的自发电活动的脑电图（EEG）观察到的异常。
HP:0002354	神经系统异常	Memory impairment	An impairment of memory as manifested by a reduced ability to remember things such as dates and names, and increased forgetfulness.	记忆障碍	记忆障碍，表现为记住事情的能力下降和遗忘增加，如日期、名称。
HP:0002355	肌肉组织异常,神经系统异常	Difficulty walking	Reduced ability to walk (ambulate).	行走困难	行走（走动）能力下降。
HP:0002356	神经系统异常	Writer&#39;s cramp	A focal dystonia of the fingers, hand, and/or forearm that appears when the affected person attempts to do a task that requires fine motor movements such as writing or playing a musical instrument.	书写痉挛	手指，手和/或前臂的局灶性肌张力障碍，在受影响的人试图完成需要精细动作的任务时出现，如书写或玩乐器的任务出。
HP:0002357	神经系统异常	Dysphasia	problems in the early development of the normal language acquisition methods,which is the delay and abnormalities of the pronunciation, language understanding, or the development of language expression skills.	语言障碍	在发育早期就有正常语言获得方式的紊乱，表现为发音、语言理解，或语言表达能力发育的延迟和异常.

HP:0002360	神经系统异常	Sleep disturbance	An abnormality of sleep including such phenomena as 1) insomnia/hypersomnia, 2) non-restorative sleep, 3) sleep schedule disorder, 4) excessive daytime somnolence, 5) sleep apnea, and 6) restlessness.	睡眠障碍	是一种睡眠异常包括以下现象:1）失眠/睡眠过度，2）非恢复性睡眠，3）睡眠节律紊乱，4）白天过度嗜睡，5）睡眠呼吸暂停，和6）躁动。
HP:0002361	神经系统异常	Psychomotor deterioration	Loss of previously present mental and motor abilities.	精神运动性恶化	现有智能和运动能力的下降
HP:0002362	神经系统异常	Shuffling gait	Lower limb straight, foot varus, the body tilt in the healthy side when walking ,the suffering foot rejection, draw half a circle.	曳行步态	即下肢伸直，足内翻下垂，步行时躯体向内健侧倾斜，患足向外甩，画半圈。

HP:0002366	神经系统异常	Abnormality of the lower motor neuron	An abnormality of the `lower motor neuron` (FMA:84632).	下运动神经元的异常	在`下运动神经元`的异常（FMA:84632）。
HP:0002367	神经系统异常	Visual hallucinations	A kind of hallucination,which can see the image of a simple form. pathological illusion,if when awareness is clear which is more common in schizophrenia, while in the sense of disturbance occurs, which is more common in delirium or hazy state.	幻视	幻觉的一种。可以看到简单不成形的形象，病理性幻视如在意识清晰时出现，多见于精神分裂症，如在意识障碍时出现，则多见于谵妄状态或朦胧状态。

HP:0002373	神经系统异常	Febrile seizures	Febrile seizures are convulsions induced by a fever in infants or small children and are generally characterized by loss of consciousness and tonic-clonic movements. Most febrile seizures last a minute or two.	高热惊厥	指婴儿或幼儿发热导致的抽搐，通常表现为意识丧失和强直-阵挛发作。大多数热性惊厥持续一到两分钟。
HP:0002374	神经系统异常	Diminished movement	#####	运动减少	#####
HP:0002375	神经系统异常	Hypokinesia	Abnormally diminished motor activity. In contrast to paralysis, hypokinesia is not characterized by a lack of motor strength, but rather by a poverty of movement. The typical habitual movements (e.g., folding the arms, crossing the legs) are reduced in frequency.	少动	异常的运动减少。与瘫痪相比，运动迟缓并不是缺乏运动的力量，而是运动的贫乏。典型的习惯性动作（如交叉双臂，盘腿）的频率减低。
HP:0002376	神经系统异常	Developmental regression	Loss of developmental skills, as manifested by loss of developmental milestones.	发育倒退	丧失发育能力，表现为缺少里程碑性的发育标志。
HP:0002377		Paraganglioma-related cranial nerve palsy	A cranial nerve palsy associated with a paraganglioma of the head or neck.	副神经节瘤相关的颅神经麻痹	与头部或颈部的副神经节瘤相关的颅神经麻痹。
HP:0002378	神经系统异常	Hand tremor	#####	手部震颤	#####
HP:0002380	神经系统异常	Fasciculations	Fasciculations are observed as small, local, involuntary muscle contractions (twitching) visible under the skin. Fasciculations result from increased irritability of an axon (which in turn is often a manifestation of disease of a motor neuron). This leads to sporadic discharges of all the muscle fibers controlled by the axon in isolation from other motor units.	肌束震颤	指在皮肤下观察到的细微、局部及不自主地肌肉收缩（抽搐），是由于轴索的兴奋性增高导致的（通常是运动神经元病的表现）。这导致了轴索支配的所有肌肉纤维独立于其他运动单位的自发性放电。
HP:0002381	神经系统异常	Aphasia	#####	失语症	#####

HP:0002385	神经系统异常	Paraparesis	Weakness or partial paralysis in the lower limbs.	下肢轻瘫	双下肢力弱或部分瘫痪
HP:0002389	神经系统异常	Cavum septum pellucidum	If the two laminae of the septum pellucidum are not fused then a fluid-filled space or cavum is present. The cavum septum pellucidum is present at birth but usually obliterates by the age of 3 to 6 months. It is up to 1cm in width and the walls are parallel. It is an enclosed space and is not part of the ventricular system or connected with the subarachnoid space.	第五脑室	如果透明隔的两个薄层未融合在一起，那么就会出现的一个充满液体的空间或空腔。透明隔间腔在出生时存在，但通常3-6个月时消失。它宽约1cm，壁是平行的。它是一个封闭的空间，不属于脑室系统的一部分，不与蛛网膜下腔相连。
HP:0002390	神经系统异常,心血管系统异常	Spinal arteriovenous malformation	#####	脊髓动静脉畸形	脊髓的动静脉连接异常。

HP:0002403	神经系统异常	Positive Romberg sign	The patient stands with the feet placed together and balance and is asked to close his or her eyes. A loss of balance upon eye closure is a positive Romberg sign and is interpreted as indicating a deficit in proprioception.	闭目难立征阳性	病人站立时并脚来保持平衡，然后被要求闭上眼睛。如果闭眼后失去平衡曾考虑为闭目难立征阳性，可能存在本体感觉的异常。

HP:0002410	神经系统异常	Aqueductal stenosis	Stenosis of the cerebral aqueduct (also known as the mesencephalic duct, aqueductus mesencephali, or aqueduct of Sylvius), which connects the third cerebral ventricle in the diencephalon to the fourth ventricle, which is between the pons and cerebellum.	中脑导水管狭窄	脑导水管狭窄（也被称为脑导管，中脑导水管，或西尔维于导水管），导水管连接间脑的第三脑室到第四脑室，位于脑桥和小脑之间。
HP:0002411	神经系统异常	Myokymia	Successive and rapid contractions of motor units associated with chronic nerve injury. The discharges arise from the peripheral aspects of regenerating nerves, and clinically impart a nearly continuous undulation of the body surface overlying the muscle.	肌纤维颤搐	慢性神经损伤相关的运动单位的连续，快速收缩。放电产生于再生神经的周边方面和临床上赋予身体表面覆盖在该肌肉的几乎连续的起伏
HP:0002414	神经系统异常	Spina bifida	Incomplete closure of the embryonic neural tube, whereby some vertebral arches remain unfused and open. The mildest form is spina bifida occulta, followed by meningocele and meningomyelocele.	脊柱裂	胚胎神经管不完全闭合，因此一些椎弓仍然未融合和开放。在最轻的形式是隐性脊柱裂，其次为脑脊髓膜膨出和脑脊髓脊膜膨出。
HP:0002415	神经系统异常	Leukodystrophy	Leukodystrophy refers to deterioration of white matter of the brain resulting from degeneration of myelin sheaths in the CNS. Their basic defect is directly related to the synthesis and maintenance of myelin membranes.	脑白质营养不良	脑白质营养不良是指源于中枢神经系统髓鞘变性的脑白质退变。它们的基本缺陷与髓鞘膜的合成和维持直接相关。
HP:0002416	神经系统异常	Subependymal cysts	#####	室管膜下囊肿	#####
HP:0002418	神经系统异常	Abnormality of midbrain morphology	An abnormality of the `midbrain` (FMA:61993), which has as its parts the tectum, cerebral peduncle, midbrain tegmentum and cerebral aqueduct.	中脑形态异常	中脑（61993 FMA）的形态异常，其组成部分包括中脑顶盖，大脑脚，中脑被盖和中脑导水管。
HP:0002419	神经系统异常	Molar tooth sign on MRI	An abnormal appearance of the midbrain in axial magnetic resonance imaging in which the elongated superior cerebellar peduncles give the midbrain an appearance reminiscent of a molar or wisdom tooth.	磁共振磨牙征	在轴位磁共振成像的中脑异常表现，细长的小脑上脚使中脑呈现磨牙或智齿的外观。

HP:0002427	神经系统异常	Motor aphasia	Impairment of expressive language  and relative preservation of receptive language abilities. That is, the patient understands language (speech, writing) but cannot express it.	运动性失语	语言表达能力障碍，和语言理解能力相对保留。也就是说，病人可以理解语言（语音，文字），但不能表达。

HP:0002445	神经系统异常	Tetraplegia	Paralysis of all four limbs, and trunk of the body below the level of an associated injury to the spinal cord. The etiology of quadriplegia is similar to that of paraplegia except that the lesion is in the cervical spinal cord rather than in the thoracic or lumbar segments of the spinal cord.	四肢瘫	相关的脊髓损伤水平以下的所有四肢、躯干的麻痹。四肢瘫的病因是类似于截瘫的不同之处在于病变是在颈脊髓而不是在脊髓的胸腰椎段。
HP:0002446	神经系统异常	Astrocytosis	Proliferation of `astrocytes` (CL:0000127) in the area of a lesion of the central nervous system.	星形胶质细胞增殖	中枢神经系统病变区域的`星形胶质细胞`（CL:0000127）的增殖。

HP:0002453	神经系统异常	Abnormality of the globus pallidus	An abnormality of the `globus pallidus` (FMA:61835).	苍白球异常	在`苍白球`的异常（FMA:61835）。
HP:0002454	神经系统异常	Eye of the tiger anomaly of globus pallidus	The presence, on T2-weighted magnetic resonance imaging, of markedly low signal intensity if the `globus pallidus` (FMA:61835) that surrounds a central region of high signal intensity in the anteromedial globus pallidus, producing an eye-of-the-tiger appearance.	苍白球虎眼征	双侧苍白球、黑质MRI T2加权像对称性低信号，且在`苍白球`(FMA:61835)低信号的前内侧出现斑点状高信号，外观类似老虎眼。

HP:0002460	肌肉组织异常	Distal muscle weakness	Reduced strength of the musculature of the distal extremities.	远端肌无力	四肢远端的肌肉强度降低。

HP:0002463	神经系统异常	Language impairment	#####	语言障碍	#####
HP:0002464	肌肉组织异常,神经系统异常	Spastic dysarthria	A type of dysarthria related to bilateral damage of the upper motor neuron tracts of the pyramidal and extra- pyramidal tracts. Speech of affected individuals is slow, effortful, and has a harsh vocal quality.	痉挛性构音障碍	一种与双侧上运动神经元的锥体束和锥体外束损伤相关的构音障碍。受累的个体的语言缓慢、费力而且音质刺耳。
HP:0002465	神经系统异常	Poor speech	#####	少言寡语	#####
HP:0002470	神经系统异常	Nonprogressive cerebellar ataxia	#####	非进行性小脑性共济失调	#####
HP:0002472	神经系统异常	Small cerebral cortex	Reduced size of the `cerebral cortex` (FMA:61830).	小大脑皮层	`脑皮质`体积减小（FMA:61830）。
HP:0002474	神经系统异常	Expressive language delay	A delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.	语言表达延迟	延迟获得使用语言进行表达需要、愿望或想法的能力
HP:0002475	神经系统异常	Myelomeningocele	Protrusion of the meninges and portions of the spinal cord through a defect of the vertebral column.	脊髓脊膜膨出	通过脊柱缺损处膨出的脊膜和部分脊髓。
HP:0002476	神经系统异常	Primitive reflexes (palmomental, snout, glabellar)	#####	原始反射（掌颏反射，口鼻部，眉间）	#####
HP:0002478	肌肉组织异常,神经系统异常	Progressive spastic quadriplegia	#####	进行性痉挛性四肢瘫	#####
HP:0002480	神经系统异常	Hepatic encephalopathy	Central nervous system dysfunction in association with liver failure and characterized clinically (depending on degree of severity) by lethargy, confusion, nystagmus, decorticate posturing, spasticity, and bilateral Babinski reflexes.	肝性脑病	肝功能衰竭相关的中枢神经系统功能障碍，临床特点（取决于严重程度）为嗜睡，意识模糊，眼球震颤，去皮层状态，痉挛，双侧巴宾斯基反射阳性。
HP:0002483	神经系统异常	Bulbar signs	#####	延髓征象	#####
HP:0002486	肌肉组织异常	Myotonia	An involuntary and painless delay in the relaxation of skeletal muscle following contraction or electrical stimulation.	肌强直	在收缩或电刺激后发生的一种不自主的、疼痛延迟的骨骼肌松弛状态。
HP:0002487	神经系统异常	Hyperkinesis	Motor hyperactivity with excessive movement of muscles of the body as a whole.	多动	运动多动与整个身体肌肉过度的运动。
HP:0002488	肿瘤,血液和造血组织异常,免疫系统异常	Acute leukemia	#####	急性白血病	#####
HP:0002490	神经系统异常	Increased CSF lactate	Increased concentration of lactate in the cerebrospinal fluid.	脑脊液乳酸升高	脑脊液中乳酸浓度升高。
HP:0002491	肌肉组织异常,神经系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Spasticity of facial muscles	Involuntary twitching of the facial muscles.	面肌痉挛	面部肌肉的不自主收缩。
HP:0002492	神经系统异常	Abnormality of the corticospinal tract	Abnormality of the corticospinal tract, which is the chief element of the pyramidal system (the principle motor tract) and is the only direct connection between the cerebrum and the spinal cord.	皮质脊髓束异常	皮质脊髓束的异常，其是锥体系统的主要组成部分，是大脑和脊髓之间唯一的直接连接。
HP:0002493	神经系统异常	Corticospinal tract dysfunction	A functional deficit of the tract that conveys nervous impulses from the motor cortex of the brain to the spinal cord. The corticospinal tract mediates discrete voluntary skilled movements.	皮质脊髓束功能障碍	从大脑运动皮层传递神经冲动到脊髓束的功能缺损。皮质脊髓束介导不相关联的自主技能运动。
HP:0002494	神经系统异常	Abnormal rapid eye movement (REM) sleep	Abnormality of REM sleep. Phases of REM sleep are characterized by desynchronized EEG patterns, increases in heart rate and blood pressure, sympathetic activation, and a profound loss of muscle tonus except for the eye and middle-ear muscles. There are then phases of rapid eye movements.	快速眼动睡眠异常	REM睡眠异常。 REM睡眠阶段的特点是脑电图模式去同步化，心率增快、血压升高，交感神经激活，除了眼睛和中耳肌肉之外的其它肌张力明显消失。其后跟随快速眼球运动阶段。
HP:0002495	神经系统异常	Impaired vibratory sensation	A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration. Clinically, this is usually tested with a tuning fork which vibrates at 128 Hz and is applied to bony prominences such as the malleoli at the ankles or the metacarpal-phalangeal joints. There is a slow decay of vibration from the tuning fork. The degree of vibratory sense loss can be crudely estimated by counting the number of seconds that the examiner can perceive the vibration longer than the patient.	振动觉障碍	感知振动的能力下降。临床上，通常使用128Hz的音叉放置于骨性突起，如踝尖或掌指关节。音叉的振动缓慢衰减。振动觉缺失的程度可以通过检查者感知振动长于患者的时间粗略计算。
HP:0002497	神经系统异常	Spastic ataxia	#####	痉挛性共济失调	#####

HP:0002503	神经系统异常	Spinocerebellar tract degeneration	#####	脊髓小脑束变性	#####
HP:0002504	神经系统异常,骨骼系统异常,心血管系统异常	Calcification of the small brain vessels	Deposition of calcium salts within small blood vessels of the brain.	脑小血管钙化	大脑内的小血管钙盐沉积。
HP:0002505	神经系统异常	Progressive inability to walk	#####	逐行无法行走	#####
HP:0002506	神经系统异常	Diffuse cerebral atrophy	Diffuse unlocalised atrophy affecting the cerebrum.	弥漫性脑萎缩	大脑弥漫非局灶性萎缩。
HP:0002507	神经系统异常	Semilobar holoprosencephaly	A type of holoprosencephaly in which the left and right frontal and parietal lobes are fused and the interhemispheric fissure is only present posteriorly.	前脑无裂畸形	一种前脑无裂畸形的，其左右侧额顶叶融合，半球间纵裂只出现在后头部。
HP:0002508	神经系统异常	Brainstem dysplasia	A developmental structural anomaly of the stalk-like part of the brain that comprises the midbrain (aka mesencephalon), the pons (aka pons Varolii), and the medulla oblongata, and connects the cerebral hemispheres with the cervical spinal cord.	脑干发育不良	大脑的茎样部分（脑干）的结构发育异常，包括中脑、脑桥和延髓，脑干连接大脑半球与颈部脊髓。
HP:0002509	肌肉组织异常,神经系统异常,肢体异常	Limb hypertonia	#####	肢体张力亢进	#####
HP:0002510	肌肉组织异常,神经系统异常	Spastic tetraplegia	Spastic paralysis affecting all four limbs.	痉挛性四肢瘫	痉挛性瘫痪影响到四肢。
HP:0002511	神经系统异常	Alzheimer disease	A degenerative disease of the brain characterized by the insidious onset of dementia. Impairment of memory, judgment, attention span, and problem solving skills are followed by severe apraxia and a global loss of cognitive abilities. The condition primarily occurs after age 60, and is marked pathologically by severe cortical atrophy and the triad of senile plaques, neurofibrillary tangles, and neuropil threads.	阿尔茨海默病	一种脑部的退行性疾病，其特点是以隐袭性起病的痴呆。记忆、判断力、注意力和解决问题的能力受损，继之出现严重的失用和全面的认知能力损害。首发症状出现在60岁后，其病理学标记是严重的皮质萎缩和老年斑、神经元纤维缠结、神经毡细丝。
HP:0002512	神经系统异常	Brain stem compression	#####	脑干受压	#####

HP:0002515	神经系统异常	Waddling gait	#####	蹒跚步态	#####
HP:0002516	神经系统异常	Increased intracranial pressure	An increase of the pressure inside the cranium (skull) and thereby in the brain tissue and cerebrospinal fluid.	颅内压增高	在颅骨（头骨）、脑组织和脑脊髓液之间的压力增加。

HP:0002521	神经系统异常	Hypsarrhythmia	Hypsarrhythmia is abnormal interictal high amplitude waves and a background of irregular spikes. There is continuous (during wakefulness), high-amplitude (&gt;200 Hz), generalized polymorphic slowing with no organized background and multifocal spikes demonstrated by electroencephalography (EEG).	高度失律	高度失律是发作间歇期异常的高波幅脑波和不规则的棘波背景活动。脑电图（EEG）显示持续的（清醒时），高波幅（&gt; 200赫兹），广泛的多形慢波，伴无组织的背景活动和多灶棘波。
HP:0002522	神经系统异常,肢体异常	Areflexia of lower limbs	Inability to elicit tendon reflexes in the lower limbs.	下肢反射消失	无法产生下肢肌腱反射
HP:0002524	神经系统异常	Cataplexy	A sudden and transient episode of bilateral loss of muscle tone, often triggered by emotions.	猝倒症	突发、短暂性的双侧肌张力下降，常因情绪诱发。
HP:0002526	神经系统异常	Deficit in nonword repetition	Impaired ability to repeat non-word sounds. Nonword repetition (NWR) is a measure of short-term phonological memory.	非词复述缺陷	重复非词语音的能力受损。非词重复（NWR）用于测量语音短期记忆。

HP:0002563	心血管系统异常,免疫系统异常	Constrictive pericarditis	Presence of a thickened, fibrotic pericardium that forms a non-compliant shell around the heart, and resulting from chronic inflammation of the pericardium.	缩窄性心包炎	心包慢性炎症引起心包增厚、纤维化，在心脏周围形成非正常的外壳。
HP:0002564		Malformation of the heart and great vessels	Congenital malformation of the heart or great vessels (i.e., the large blood vesslesentering and leaving the heart: aorta, the pulmonary arteries and veins, and the superior and inferior vena cava).	心脏和大血管畸形	先天性心脏或大血管（如主动脉，肺动脉和肺静脉，上、下腔静脉）畸形。
HP:0002566	消化系统异常	Intestinal malrotation	An abnormality of the intestinal rotation and fixation that normally occurs during the development of the gut. This can lead to volvulus, or twisting of the intestine that causes obstruction and necrosis.	肠旋转不良	通常发生于肠发育过程中的肠道旋转和固定的异常。这将引起肠扭转，导致肠道的阻塞和坏死。
HP:0002570	消化系统异常	Steatorrhea	Greater than normal amounts of fat in the feces. This is a result of malabsorption of lipids in the small intestine and results in frothy foul-smelling fecal matter that floats.	脂肪泻	粪便中脂肪含量高于正常。这是小肠脂肪吸收不良的结果，产生泡沫状、恶臭味的漂浮粪质。
HP:0002571	消化系统异常	Achalasia	A disorder of esophageal motility characterized by the inability of the lower esophageal sphincter to relax during swallowing and by inadequate or lacking peristalsis in the lower half of the body of the esophagus.	贲门失弛缓症	一种食管动力的异常，其特征为食管下段括约肌在吞咽时无法松弛，以及下半食管的蠕动不足或缺乏。
HP:0002572	消化系统异常	Episodic vomiting	Paroxysmal, recurrent episodes of vomiting.	阵发性呕吐	阵发性、反复发作的呕吐。

HP:0002576	消化系统异常	Intussusception	An abnormality of the `intestine` (FMA:7199) in which part of the intestine invaginates (telescopes) into another part of the intestine.	肠套叠	肠道的一种异常，其中部分肠管内陷（叠缩）进入另一部分肠管。
HP:0002577	消化系统异常	Abnormality of the stomach	An abnormality of the `stomach` (FMA:7148).	胃部异常	胃部的异常。
HP:0002578	肌肉组织异常,消化系统异常	Gastroparesis	`Decreased strength` (PATO:0001779) of the `Muscle layer of stomach` (FMA:14909), which leads to a decreased ability to empty the contents of the stomach despite the absence of obstruction.	胃轻瘫	胃肌层张力降低，无阻塞也会出现胃排空能力下降。
HP:0002579	消化系统异常	Gastrointestinal dysmotility	Abnormal intestinal contractions, such as spasms and intestinal paralysis, related to the loss of the ability of the gut to coordinate muscular activity because of endogenous or exogenous causes.	胃肠动力障碍	肠道的异常收缩，如痉挛和肠麻痹，与内源性或外源性因素导致的肠道调节肌肉活性的能力丧失相关。
HP:0002580	消化系统异常	Volvulus	Abnormal twisting of a portion of intestine around itself or around a stalk of mesentery tissue.	肠扭转	小肠的一部分围绕其自身或肠系膜轴的异常旋转。
HP:0002582	消化系统异常	Chronic atrophic gastritis	A form of `chronic gastritis` (HP:0005231) associated with `atrophic` (PATO:0001623) `gastric mucous membrane` (FMA:14907).	慢性萎缩性胃炎	一种伴随胃粘膜萎缩的慢性胃炎。
HP:0002583	消化系统异常,免疫系统异常	Colitis	Colitis refers to an inflammation of the colon and is often used to describe an inflammation of the large intestine (colon, cecum and rectum). Colitides may be acute and self-limited or chronic, and broadly fit into the category of digestive diseases.	结肠炎	结肠炎是指结肠的一种炎症，通常用来描述大肠（结肠，盲肠和直肠）的炎症。结肠炎可以是急性的，自限性的或者慢性的，在广义上属于消化系统疾病。

HP:0002592	消化系统异常	Gastric ulcer	An `ulcer` (MPATH:579), that is, an erosion of an area of the `gastric mucous membrane` (FMA:14907).	胃溃疡	胃溃疡，即，某个区域的胃粘膜的糜烂。

HP:0002594	消化系统异常	Pancreatic hypoplasia	`Hypoplasia` (MPATH:133) of the `pancreas` (FMA:7198).	胰腺发育不良	`胰腺的发育不良。
HP:0002595	消化系统异常	Ileus	Acute obstruction of the intestines preventing passage of the contents of the intestines.	肠梗阻	肠的急性阻塞阻止了肠内容物的通过。
HP:0002597	心血管系统异常	Abnormality of the vasculature	An abnormality of the `vasculature` (FMA:69050), which includes cardiovascular system and lymphatic system.	脉管系统异常	脉管系统异常即体内封闭式循环管道系统（包括心血管系统和淋巴系统）发生的异常（FMA:69050）。
HP:0002599	神经系统异常	Head titubation	A head tremor of moderate speed (3 to 4 Hz) in the anterior-posterior direction.	点头	中等速度（3-4 Hz）的前 - 后方向的头部震颤。
HP:0002600	神经系统异常,肢体异常	Hyporeflexia of lower limbs	Reduced intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in the lower limbs. Reflexes are elicited by stretching the tendon of a muscle, e.g., by tapping.	下肢反射减弱	下肢肌腱反射强度减弱，伸展肌腱并轻拍可以引起反射
HP:0002601	肌肉组织异常,肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Paresis of extensor muscles of the big toe	#####	拇趾伸肌麻痹	#####
HP:0002604	心血管系统异常,消化系统异常,体壁的异常	Gastrointestinal telangiectasia	`Telangiectasia` (MPATH:476) affecting the`gastrointestinal tract` (FMA:71132).	胃肠道毛细血管扩张	累及胃肠道的毛细血管扩张。

HP:0002607	消化系统异常	Bowel incontinence	Involuntary fecal soiling in adults and children who have usually already been toilet trained.	大便失禁	已经过如厕训练的成人和儿童的无意识排便。

HP:0002612	消化系统异常	Congenital hepatic fibrosis	The presence of `fibrosis` (MPATH:181) of that part of the `liver` (FMA:7197) with `congenital onset` (HP:0003577).	先天性肝纤维化	先天发生于肝脏部位的“纤维化”。
HP:0002613	消化系统异常	Biliary cirrhosis	Progressive destruction of the small-to-medium bile ducts of the `intrahepatic biliary tree` (FMA:68016), which leads to progressive cholestasis and often end-stage liver disease.	胆汁性肝硬化	肝内胆道从小胆管到中胆管的进行性破坏，导致进行性胆汁淤积且常发展为终末期肝病。
HP:0002614	消化系统异常	Hepatic periportal necrosis	A type of `hepatic necrosis` (HP:0002605) that is concentrated around the necrosis of hepatocytes localized around the `intrahepatic branch of portal vein` (FMA:15417).	肝脏门脉周围坏死	一种集中发生于肝内门脉分支周围的肝细胞的肝脏坏死。
HP:0002615	心血管系统异常	Hypotension	Low Blood Pressure, vascular hypotension.	低血压	低血压，血管性低血压。
HP:0002616	心血管系统异常	Aortic root dilation	The enlargment of aortic root, which can be caused by many different factors including age, connective tissue disorders, and high blood pressure.	主动脉根部扩张	主动脉根部的扩大，致病原因包括年龄、结缔组织疾病以及高血压。
HP:0002617	心血管系统异常	Aneurysm	Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the wall of an atery, vein or the heart.	动脉瘤	动脉壁、静脉壁或心脏内壁形成的囊样扩张或异常外翻。
HP:0002619	心血管系统异常	Varicose veins	Enlarged and tortuous veins.	静脉曲张	静脉的扩大和迂曲。
HP:0002621	心血管系统异常	Atherosclerosis	A condition characterized by patchy atheromas or atherosclerotic plaques which develop in the walls of medium-sized and large arteries and can lead to arterial stenosis with reduced or blocked blood flow.	动脉粥样硬化	大、中型动脉壁形成片状斑块或粥样斑块，导致动脉狭窄，血流减小或阻断。
HP:0002622	心血管系统异常	Dissecting aortic aneurysm	Dissecting aortic aneurysm occurs when a tear in the tunica intima of the aorta causes blood to flow between the layers of the wall of the aorta, forcing the layers apart.	夹层主动脉瘤	动脉内膜撕裂导致的主动脉瘤，血液在主动脉壁内膜层之间流动，迫使内膜层之间分离。
HP:0002623	心血管系统异常	Overriding aorta	An overriding aorta is a congenital heart defect where the aorta is positioned directly over a ventricular septal defect, instead of over the left ventricle. The result is that the aorta receives some blood from the right ventricle, which reduces the amount of oxygen in the blood. It is one of the four conditions of the Tetralogy of Fallot. The aortic root can be displaced toward the front (anteriorly) or directly above the septal defect, but it is always abnormally located to the right of the root of the pulmonary artery. The degree of override is quite variable, with 5-95% of the valve being connected to the right ventricle.	主动脉骑跨	一种先天性心脏缺陷，指主动脉的位置直接跨过室间隔缺损而不是跨过左心室。其结果是主动脉接收一部分来自右心室的血液，导致血液中氧含量降低。这是法洛四联症的四种临床表现之一，主动脉根部不能位于前方，也不能在室间隔缺损的正上方。骑跨的角度有很多种，其中5-95%的瓣膜都连接右心室。
HP:0002624	心血管系统异常	Venous abnormality	An anomaly of vein (FMA:50723).	静脉血管异常	静脉血管的异常（FMA:50723）。
HP:0002625	血液和造血组织异常	Deep venous thrombosis	Formation of a blot clot in a deep vein. The clot often blocks blood flow, causing swelling and pain. The deep veins of the leg are most often affected.	深静脉血栓形成	血块在深静脉形成。血块通常阻断血流量，引起肿胀和疼痛。腿部深静脉最常受到影响。
HP:0002626	心血管系统异常	Venous varicosities of celiac and mesenteric vessels	Elongated and tortuous mesenteric veins, which comprise the inferior mesenteric vein(FMA:15391) and the superior mesenteric vein(FMA:14332).	腹腔及肠系膜静脉曲张	肠系膜静脉的扭曲、伸长，肠系膜静脉由肠系膜下静脉（FMA:15391）和肠系膜上静脉（FMA:14332）组成。
HP:0002627	心血管系统异常	Right aortic arch with mirror image branching	The aortic arch crosses the right mainstem bronchus and not the left mainstem bronchus, but does not result in the creation of a vascular ring. The first branch is the left brachiocephalic artery which divides into the left carotid artery and left subclavian artery, the second branch is the right carotid artery, the third branch is the right subclavian artery.	右位主动脉弓伴镜像分支	主动脉弓穿过右主支气管而不是左主支气管，但是不导致血管环的产生。第一分支是分成左颈动脉和左锁骨下动脉的左头臂动脉，第二分支是右颈动脉，第三分支是右锁骨下动脉。
HP:0002629	心血管系统异常,消化系统异常	Gastrointestinal arteriovenous malformation	An abnormal connection between arteries and veins in the gastrointestinal tract，bypassing the capillary system.	胃肠道动静脉畸形	#####
HP:0002630	消化系统异常	Fat malabsorption	Abnormality of the absorption of fat from the gastrointestinal tract.	脂肪吸收障碍	自胃肠道吸收脂肪的异常。

HP:0002632	心血管系统异常	Low-to-normal blood pressure	Mild decrease of blood pressure	低至正常血压	是指体循环动脉压力稍低于正常的状态。
HP:0002633	心血管系统异常	Vasculitis	Inflammation of blood vessel.	血管炎	血管的炎症。
HP:0002634	心血管系统异常	Arteriosclerosis	Sclerosis (hardening) of the arteries with increased thickness of the wall of arteries as well as increased stiffness and a loss of elasticity.	动脉硬化	动脉壁增厚，硬度增加，弹性减小。
HP:0002635	心血管系统异常	Atheromatosis	An atheroma is an accumulation of degenerative material in the tunica intima (inner layer) of artery walls. The accumulated material forms a swelling in the artery wall, which may intrude into the channel of the artery, narrowing it and restricting blood flow.	动脉粥样化病	动脉壁内膜退行性物质的积累,引起动脉壁增厚。积累的物质在动脉壁上形成肿块，向内突入动脉腔，缩小动脉腔并且限制血液流动。
HP:0002636	心血管系统异常	Aneurysm of an abdominal artery	Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in an artery that originates from he abdominal aorta.	腹部动脉瘤	源于腹主动脉动脉壁的异常或囊样扩张。

HP:0002638	血液和造血组织异常	Superficial thrombophlebitis	Inflammation of a superficial vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein).	浅表性血栓性静脉炎	浅静脉炎症并导致静脉血栓形成（静脉内血栓形成）。
HP:0002639	心血管系统异常	Budd-Chiari syndrome	Budd–Chiari syndrome is a condition caused by occlusion of the hepatic veins that drain the liver. It presents with the classical triad of abdominal pain, ascites, and liver enlargement.	布-加氏综合征	布-加氏综合征是由肝静脉阻塞引起的疾病，主要症状为腹痛、腹水以及肝脏肿大。
HP:0002640	心血管系统异常	Hypertension associated with pheochromocytoma	A type of `hypertension` (HP:0000822) associated with `pheochromocytoma` (HP:0002666).	嗜铬细胞瘤高血压	一类与嗜铬细胞瘤（HP:0002666）相关的高血压（HP:0000822）。

HP:0002645	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Wormian bones	The presence of extra bones within a cranial suture. Wormian bones are irregular isolated bones which appear in addition to the usual centers of ossification of the cranium.	缝间骨	缝间骨为颅缝中的多余的骨头，呈不规则形且孤立存在，不单单生长在颅骨骨化中心。

HP:0002659	骨骼系统异常	Increased susceptibility to fractures	An abnormally increased tendency to fractures of bones caused by an abnormal reduction in bone strength that is generally associated with an increased risk of fracture.	骨折易感性增加	由于骨强度的异常降低造成的骨折倾向异常增加。

HP:0002664	肿瘤	Neoplasm	An organ or organ-system abnormality that consists of uncontrolled autonomous cell-proliferation which can occur in any part of the body as a benign or malignant `neoplasm` (MPATH:218) (tumour).	肿瘤	由不受控制的自主性细胞增殖而导致的器官或器官系统的异常，可发生于机体任何部位，成为良性或恶性肿瘤。
HP:0002665	肿瘤,血液和造血组织异常	Lymphoma	A cancer originating in lymphocytes and presenting as a solid tumor of lymhpoid cells.	淋巴瘤	一种淋巴细胞起源癌症，以淋巴细胞为主的实体瘤。
HP:0002666	肿瘤,神经系统异常,内分泌系统异常	Pheochromocytoma	Pheochromocytomas (also known as chromaffin tumors) produce, store, and secrete catecholamines. Pheochromocytomas usually originate from the adrenal medulla but may also develop from chromaffin cells in or about sympathetic ganglia. A common symptom of pheochromocytoma is hypertension owing to release of catecholamines.	嗜铬细胞瘤	嗜铬细胞瘤（也称为嗜铬肿瘤）生产，储存，并分泌儿茶酚胺。嗜铬细胞瘤，通常从肾上腺髓质发起的，但也可以从在或约交感神经节铬细胞发展。嗜铬细胞瘤的常见症状是高血压，由于儿茶酚胺的释放。
HP:0002667	肿瘤,泌尿生殖系统异常	Nephroblastoma (Wilms tumor)	The presence of a `nephroblastoma` (MPATH:261), which is a neoplasm of the `kidney` (FMA:7203) that primarily affects children.	肾母细胞瘤（Wilms瘤）	肾脏的一种肿瘤，主要累及儿童。
HP:0002668	肿瘤,神经系统异常,内分泌系统异常	Paraganglioma	A carotid body tumor (also called paraganglionoma or chemodectoma) is a tumor found in the upper neck at the branching of the carotid artery. They arise from the chemoreceptor organ (paraganglion) located in the adventitia of the carotid artery bifurcation.	副神经节瘤	颈动脉体瘤（也称为神经节细胞瘤或化学感受器瘤）是一种位于上颈部颈动脉分叉处的肿瘤。它们产生来自位于颈动脉分叉的外膜的化学感受器器官（副神经节）。
HP:0002669	肿瘤,骨骼系统异常	Osteosarcoma	A malignant bone tumor that usually develops during adolescence and usually affects the long bones including the tibia, femur, and humerus. The typical symptoms of osteosarcoma comprise bone pain, fracture, limitation of motion, and tenderness or swelling at the site of the tumor.	骨肉瘤	一种通常见于青春期的恶性骨肿瘤，通常会累及包括胫骨，股骨，肱骨在内的长骨。骨肉瘤的典型症状包括骨痛，骨折，关节活动受限，压痛或肿瘤的部位肿胀。
HP:0002671	肿瘤,体壁的异常	Basal cell carcinoma	The presence of a `basal cell carcinoma` (MPATH:234) of the `skin` (FMA:7163).	基底细胞癌	存在于皮肤的基底细胞癌。

HP:0002673	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Coxa valga	Coxa valga is a deformity of the hip in which the angle between the femoral shaft and the femoral neck is increased compared to age-adjusted values (about 150 degrees in newborns gradually reducing to 120-130 degrees in adults).	髋外翻	髋外翻是股骨干和股骨颈之间的角度相比相应年龄阶段（新生儿大约150度逐渐减小到成人120-130度）增大的髋关节畸形。

HP:0002680	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	J-shaped sella turcica	A deformity of the sella turcica whereby the sella extends further anterior than normal such that the anterior clinoid process appears to overhang it, giving the appearance of the letter J on imaging of the skull. HP:0002691	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Platybasia	A developmental malformation of the occipital bone and upper end of the cervical spine, in which the latter appears to have pushed the floor of the occipital bone upward such that there is an  abnormal flattening of the skull base.	颅底扁平症	枕骨和颈椎上端的发育畸形，其中后者出现导致枕骨向上的颅底的异常平坦。

HP:0002693	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Abnormality of the skull base	An abnormality of the base of the skull, which forms the floor of the cranial cavity and separates the brain from other facial structures. The skull base is made up of five bones: the ethmoid, sphenoid, occipital, paired frontal, and paired parietal bones, and is subdivided into 3 regions: the anterior, middle, and posterior cranial fossae. The petro-occipital fissure subdivides the middle cranial fossa into 1 central component and 2 lateral components.	颅底异常	颅底的异常。颅底形成颅腔的底部，从而隔离脑部与其他面部结构。颅底由五块骨头（筛窦、蝶窦、枕骨、配对的额骨和配对的顶骨

HP:0002756	骨骼系统异常	Pathologic fracture	A pathologic fracture occurs when a bone breaks in an area that is weakened secondary to another disease process such as tumor, infection, and certain inherited bone disorders. A pathologic fracture can occur without a degree of trauma required to cause fracture in healthy bone.	病理性骨折	当骨破坏发生在继发于另一种疾病过程（如肿瘤，感染和某些遗传骨疾患）而被削弱的区域时，发生病理性骨折。病理性骨折可在不引起健康骨骼骨折的创伤程度下出现。
HP:0002757	骨骼系统异常	Recurrent fractures	The repeated occurence of bone fractures (implying an abnormally increased tendency for fracture).	复发性骨折	骨折的反复发生（提示骨折趋势异常增加）。

Obstructive sleep apnea is related to a relaxation of muscle tone (which normally occurs during sleep) leading to partial collapse of the soft tissues in the airway with resultant obstruction of the air flow.	阻塞性睡眠呼吸暂停	夜间睡眠过程中多次出现呼吸道梗阻而导致睡眠中呼吸暂停。阻塞性睡眠呼吸暂停与肌肉张力松弛（通常是在睡眠时）导致气道内的软组织部分塌陷，从而引起气道阻塞有关。

HP:0002883	呼吸系统异常	Hyperventilation	Hyperventilation refers to an increased pulmonary ventilation rate that is faster than necessary for the exchange of gases. Hyperventilation can result from increased frequency of breathing, an increased tidal volume, or both, and leads to an excess intake of oxygen and the blowing off of carbon dioxide.	过度通气	过度通气指肺通气速率快于所需要的气体交换率。过度通气可由呼吸频率增加、潮气量增加或两者都有的原因所致，可以引起氧摄取和二氧化碳呼出过量。

HP:0002910	消化系统异常	Elevated hepatic transaminases	Elevations of the levels of SGOT and SGPT in the serum. SGOT (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase) and SGPT (serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase) are transaminases primarily found in the liver and heart and are released into the bloodstream as the result of liver or heart damage. SGOT and SGPT are used clinically mainly as markers of liver damage.	肝脏转氨酶升高	血清中SGOT和SGPT水平升高。SGOT（血清谷草转氨酶）和SGPT（血清谷丙转氨酶）是主要发现于肝脏和心脏的转氨酶，当肝脏和心脏损伤时被释放到血液中。临床上SGOT和SGPT是肝损伤的主要标志物。

The delayed hypersensitivity test is an immune function test measuring the presence of activated T cells that recognize a specific antigen and is performed by injecting a small amount of the antigen into the skin. The area of the injection is examined 48-72 hours thereafter.	迟发型皮肤超敏试验异常	由细胞而非抗体介导的皮肤对特异性抗原的迟发免疫应答。迟发型超敏反应试验是通过向皮肤内注入少量的抗原后测量识别特定抗原的活化T细胞的一种免疫功能测试。48-72小时之后观察注射的区域的变化。

HP:0003160	代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	Abnormal isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin	Glycosylated transferrin concentrations can be measured in serum as a marker of N-linked glycosylation fidelity. In the traditional nomenclature for congenital disorders of glycosylation, absence of entire glycans was designated type I, and loss of one or more monosaccharides as type II. These terms are retained for historical reasons but for new annotations the precise glycosylation defect should be recorded.	血清转铁蛋白的等电位聚焦异常	糖基化转铁蛋白的浓度可作为N联糖基化保真度的标记物在血清中检测。在先天性糖基化缺陷病的传统命名法中，整个聚糖的缺失被命名为I型，一个或多个单糖的缺失被命名为II型。这些术语因历史原因被保留，但应记录新的注释作为对糖基化缺陷的精确注解。

HP:0003199	肌肉组织异常	Decreased muscle mass	#####	肌肉容积减少	#####
HP:0003200	肌肉组织异常	Ragged-red muscle fibers	An abnormal appearance of muscle fibers observed on muscle biopsy. Ragged red fibers can be visualized with Gomori trichrome staining as irregular and intensely red subsarcolemmal zones, whereas the normal myofibrils are green. The margins of affect fibers appear red and ragged. The ragged-red  is due to the accumulation of abnormal mitochondria below the plasma membrane of the muscle fiber, leading to the appearance of a red rim and speckled sarcoplasm.	破碎红纤维	肌肉活检可见肌纤维异常。粗糙的红肌纤维可与莫里三色染色不规则和强烈的红色肌膜区域进行可视化，而正常的肌原纤维是绿色的。影响纤维的边缘出现红色粗糙的形态，异常形态的原因是由于肌肉纤维的质膜以下异常线粒体的积累，导致了红色边缘和肌浆斑点的外观。

HP:0003203	血液和造血组织异常,免疫系统异常	Negative nitroblue tetrazolium (NBT) reduction test	In the NBT test, neutrophils change the colorless compound NBT into a compound with a deep blue color. If this test is negative (i.e., no blue color is produced), then this indicates a defect in `superoxide-generating NADPH oxidase activity` (GO:0016175) with inability to efficiently kill phagocytized bacteria.	四氮唑蓝（NBT）还原试验阴性	在NBT法检测中，中性粒细胞使无色化合物NBT变成深蓝色。如果该测试阴性（即没有蓝色产生），提示&#39;可以生成超氧化物的NADPH氧化酶活性缺陷（GO:0016175），以及中性粒细胞不能有效地杀灭吞噬细菌。

HP:0003337	血液和造血组织异常	Reduced prothrombin consumption	The prothrombin consumption test measures the formation of intrinsic thromboplastin by determining the residual serum prothrombin after blood clotting is complete. If there is a defect in the process, less prothrombin will be converted to thrombin than normal (less prothrombin is consumed). This test may be abnormal with conditions including deficiency of factors VIII or IX, with circulating anticoagulants, thrombocytopenia.	凝血酶原消耗减少	凝血酶原消耗测试通过确定血液凝固完成后残留血清凝血酶原浓度来测量内源性凝血酶的形成。如果此过程中存在缺陷，较少的凝血酶原被转化为凝血酶（较少的凝血酶原被消耗）。该测试结果异常可见于多种异常情况，包括VIII因子或IX因子缺乏，使用循环抗凝剂，血小板减少症。

HP:0003376	神经系统异常	Steppage gait	An abnormal gait pattern that arises from weakness of the pretibial and peroneal muscles due to a lower motor neuron lesion. Affected patients have footdrop and are unable to dorsiflex and evert the foot. The leg is lifted high on walking so that the toes clear the ground, and there may be a slapping noise when the foot strikes the ground again.	跨阈步态	一种由于胫前肌和腓骨肌下运动神经元病变导致肌无力而产生的异常步态。患者有足下垂，并且不能足不能背屈和外翻。行走时腿部高举以使脚趾离开地面，脚步落地时可能因为足部和地面碰撞而产生拍击声。

HP:0003403	肌肉组织异常	EMG: decremental response of compound muscle action potential (CMAP) to repetitive nerve stimulation	A compound muscle action potential (CMAP) is a type of electromyography (EMG). CMAP refers to a group of almost simultaneous action potentials from several muscle fibers in the same area evoked by stimulation of the supplying motor nerve and are recorded as one multipeaked summated action potential. This abnormality refers to a greater than normal decrease in the amplitude during the course of the investigation.	肌电图:复合肌肉动作电位对神经重复刺激的递减反应	复合肌肉动作电位（CMAP）是肌电图（EMG）的一种类型。 CMAP是指由供给运动神经刺激引起同一部位的若干个肌肉纤维几乎同时的动作电位，被记录为一个多峰累加动作电位。这种异常在检查过程中呈现大于正常的减少幅度。

HP:0003463	神经系统异常	Increased extraneuronal autofluorescent lipopigment	Lipofuscin, a generic term applied to autofluorescent lipopigment, is a mixture of protein and lipid that accumulates in most aging cells, particularly those involved in high lipid turnover (e.g., the adrenal medulla) or phagocytosis of other cell types (e g., the retinal pigment epithelium or RPE; macrophage). This term pertains if there is an increase in the extraneuronal accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.	神经元外自体荧光脂褐素增加	脂褐素，自体荧光脂褐素的专业术语，是积聚在最衰老细胞的蛋白质和脂质混合物，尤其是涉及高脂质转换（例如，肾上腺髓质）或吞噬的其他类型细胞（例如视网膜色素上皮细胞或RPE；巨噬细胞）。此术语适用于神经元外脂褐素（也称为自身荧光脂蛋白）的积聚增加是否超过患者预期的年龄。

HP:0003470	神经系统异常	Paralysis	Paralysis of voluntary muscles means loss of contraction due to interruption of one or more motor pathways from the brain to the muscle fibers. Although the word paralysis is often used interchangeably to mean either complete or partial loss of muscle strength, it is preferable to use paralysis or plegia for complete or severe loss of muscle strength, and paresis for partial or slight loss. Motor paralysis results from deficits of the upper motor neurons (corticospinal, corticobulbar, or subcorticospinal).	瘫痪	由于一组或多组从脑发出的支配肌肉的神经纤维受损后引起骨骼随意肌收缩功能的丧失，可以是肌力部分或完全的丧失，用paralysis或plegia来表示肌力完全或严重丧失，paresis表示部分或轻微的肌力丧失。运动性瘫痪由上运动神经元损伤（皮质脊髓束、皮质延髓、或皮质脊髓下）引起。
HP:0003472	神经系统异常,代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	Hypocalcemic tetany	Hyperexcitability of the neuromuscular system related to abnormally low level of calcium in the blood, resulting in carpopedal or generalized spasms.	低钙搐搦	与血液中钙水平异常减低相关的神经肌肉统过度兴奋，导致手足搐搦或广泛痉挛。
HP:0003473	肌肉组织异常,神经系统异常	Fatigable weakness	A type of weakness that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.	疲劳性无力	肌肉运动后出现的无力感，休息后可以减轻。即肌肉重复运动后力量下降。
HP:0003474	神经系统异常	Sensory impairment	An abnormality of the primary sensation that is mediated by peripheral nerves (pain, temperature, touch, vibration, joint position). The word hypoesthesia (or hyesthesia) refers to a reduction in cutaneous sensation to a specific type of testing.	感觉损害	初级感觉的异常是由末梢神经（疼痛，温度，触觉，振动，关节位置）介导的。感觉减退（或hyesthesia）是指在皮肤感觉测试中某一特定感觉类型的减退。

HP:0003482	肌肉组织异常	EMG: axonal abnormality	Electromyographic (EMG) findings characteristic of axonal neuropathy, with normal or slightly decreased nerve conduction velocities, normal or slightly prolonged distal latencies, but significantly reduced motor potentials and sensory amplitudes. There may be spontaneous activity upon needle EMG studies, such as increased insertional activity, positive sharp waves and fibrillation potentials.	肌电图:轴索异常	肌电图（EMG）发现轴突性神经病变，神经传导速度正常或略有下降，远端潜伏期正常或稍长时间，但动作电位和感觉电位幅度显著降低。有可能是在肌电图中的自发活动，如增加插入性活动，正锐波和纤颤电位。

HP:0003487	神经系统异常	Babinski sign	Upturning of the big toe (and sometimes fanning of the other toes) in response to stimulation of the sole of the foot. If the Babinski sign is present it can indicate damage to the corticospinal tract.	巴彬斯基征	刺激足底后出现踇趾背屈（有时其余脚趾成扇形分开）的体征。如果查体出现巴彬斯基征，指示皮质脊髓束损害。

HP:0003547	肌肉组织异常,肢体异常	Shoulder girdle muscle weakness	The shoulder, or pectoral, girdle is composed of the clavicles and the scapulae. Shoulder-girdle weakness refers to lack of strength of the muscles attaching to these bones, that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the shoulders.	肩胛带肌肉无力	肩或胸部肢带由锁骨和肩胛骨构成。肩部肢带无力是指连接到这些骨头的肌肉无力，即肩膀肌肉的力量缺乏。
HP:0003548	肌肉组织异常	Subsarcolemmal accumulations of abnormally shaped mitochondria	An abnormally increased number of mitochondria in the cytoplasma adjacent to the sarcolemma (muscle cell membrane), whereby the mitochondria also possess an abnormal morphology.	形状异常线粒体肌膜下沉积	细胞质中邻近肌纤维膜（肌细胞膜）的线粒体数量异常增加，线粒体形态也异常。
HP:0003549	结缔组织异常	Abnormality of connective tissue	Any abnormality of the soft tissues, including both connective tissue (tendons, ligaments, fascia, fibrous tissues, and fat).	结缔组织异常	软组织的任何异常，包括结缔组织（肌腱、韧带、筋膜、纤维组织）和脂肪。
HP:0003550	代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	Predominantly lower limb lymphedema	Localized fluid retention and tissue swelling caused by a compromised `lymphatic system` (FMA:7162), affecting mainly the legs.	主要累及下肢的淋巴水肿	`淋巴系统`（FMA：7162）引起的局部性液体滞留和组织水肿，主要影响腿部。
HP:0003551	肌肉组织异常	Difficulty climbing stairs	Reduced ability to climb stairs.	爬楼梯困难	爬楼梯能力下降。
HP:0003552	肌肉组织异常	Muscle stiffness	A condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm.	肌肉僵硬	一种肌肉不能迅速移动的状态，不伴随疼痛或痉挛。
HP:0003553	结缔组织异常,免疫系统异常	Cellulitis due to immunodeficiency	The presence of cellulitis (a diffuse inflammation of connective tissue) on the basis of an immunodeficiency.	免疫缺陷性蜂窝织炎	由于免疫缺陷所致的蜂窝织炎（一种弥漫性结缔组织炎症）。
HP:0003554	肌肉组织异常	Type 2 muscle fiber atrophy	Atrophy (wasting) affecting primary type 2 muscle fibers. This feature in general can only be observed on muscle biopsy.	2型肌纤维萎缩	萎缩（消瘦）主要影响2型肌肉纤维。一般该特征只能在肌肉活检中观察到。
HP:0003555	肌肉组织异常	Muscle fiber splitting	Fiber splitting or branching is a common finding in human and rat skeletal muscle pathology. Fiber splitting refers to longitudinal halving of the complete fiber, while branching originates from a regenerating end of a necrotic fiber as invaginations of the sarcolemma. In fiber branching, one end of the fiber remains intact as a single entity, while the other end has several branches.	肌纤维分裂	纤维分裂或分叉是一种表现在人类和大鼠骨骼肌病理的常见现象。纤维分裂表现为完整纤维的纵向对分，而纤维分叉则是起源于坏死纤维再生末端由于肌纤维膜内陷所致。在纤维分叉中，纤维一端保持为单个整体，而另一端则有多个分叉。
HP:0003557	肌肉组织异常	Increased variability in muscle fiber diameter	An abnormally high degree of muscle fiber size variation. This phenotypic feature can be observed upon muscle biopsy.	肌纤维直径变异性增大	异常高的程度的肌纤维大小的变化。此表型特征可根据肌肉活检观察。

HP:0003560	肌肉组织异常	Muscular dystrophy	The term dystrophy means abnormal growth. However, muscular dystrophy is used to describe primary myopathies with a genetic basis and a progressive course characterized by progressive skeletal muscle weakness, defects in muscle proteins, and the apoptosis of muscle cells.	肌营养不良	术语营养不良是指生长异常。然而，肌营养不良是用来描述原发性肌肉疾病具有遗传基础及渐进的过程，其特征为进行性骨骼肌无力，肌蛋白的缺陷，以及肌细胞的凋亡。

Phospholipid, and activator, and calcium are mixed into an anticoagulated plasma sample, and the time is measured until a thrombus forms.	部分凝血活酶时间延长	部分凝血活酶时间（PTT）测试可测量内源性和共同凝血通路中的凝血时间延长。将磷脂，活化剂以及钙混入抗凝血处理的血浆样品，测量血栓形成所需的时间。

HP:0003653	代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	Cellular metachromasia	Metachromasia (also known as metachromacy) is a characteristic color change which certain aniline dyes exhibit when bound to particular substances or when concentrated in solution. For example, the basic dye toluidine blue becomes distinctly pink when bound to cartilage matrix. In the sense used here, the metachromasia refers to a change in color not observed with normal tissues, anomalous staining with the cationic dyes toluidine blue O and Alcian blue resulting from excessive amounts of the polyanionic glycosaminoglycans.	细胞异染	异染（也称为异染色）是颜色发生的一种特异性改变，发生在某些苯胺染料与特定的物质结合或在液体中浓缩时。例如，当碱性染料甲苯胺蓝与软骨基质结合时，颜色变成明显的粉红色。在这里特指，异染是指在正常组织中无法观察到颜色的变化，却非常规的用阳离子染料甲苯胺蓝O和阿尔新蓝染色，由于阴离子糖胺多糖糖胺过量所致的颜色改变。

HP:0003707	肌肉组织异常,肢体异常	Calf muscle pseudohypertrophy	Enlargement of the muscles of the calf due to their replacement by connective tissue or fat.	小腿假性肌肉肥大	由于结缔组织和脂肪填充导致的小腿肥大。
HP:0003710	肌肉组织异常	Exercise-induced muscle cramps	Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles brought on by physical exertion.	运动引起的肌肉痉挛	一个或多个肌肉突然不自主的收缩导致体力消耗。
HP:0003712	肌肉组织异常	Muscle hypertrophy	Hypertrophy (increase in size) of muscle cells (as opposed to hyperplasia, which refers to an increase in the number of muscle cells).	肌肥大	肌细胞肥大即肌细胞体积增大，不同于增生（即肌细胞数目增多）。
HP:0003713	肌肉组织异常	Muscle fiber necrosis	Abnormal cell death involving muscle fibers usually associated with break in, or absence of, muscle surface fiber membrane and resulting in irreversible damage to muscle fibers.	肌纤维坏死	肌纤维细胞的异常凋亡通常表现为肌纤维细胞溶解或肌肉组织表面纤维膜的缺失，最终导致肌纤维不可逆性损害。
HP:0003715	肌肉组织异常	Myofibrillar myopathy	Myofibrillar structural changes characterized by abnormal intracellular accumulation of the intermediate filament desmin and other proteins.	肌原纤维肌病	表现为肌原纤维结构的改变，以中间纤维结蛋白和其他蛋白细胞内异常聚集为特征。

HP:0003722	肌肉组织异常,头部和颈部的异常	Neck flexor weakness	Weakness of the muscles involved in neck flexion (sternocleidomastoid, longus capitus, longus colli, and scalenus anterior).	颈屈肌无力	颈屈肌无力（包括胸锁乳突肌，头长肌，颈长肌，和前斜角肌的肌肉）。
HP:0003724	肌肉组织异常,肢体异常	Shoulder girdle muscle atrophy	Amyotrophy affecting the muscles of the shoulder girdle.	肩胛带肌肉萎缩	肌肉萎缩累及肩胛带的肌肉。

HP:0003731	肌肉组织异常,肢体异常	Quadriceps muscle weakness	Weakness of the quadriceps muscle (that is, of the muscle fasciculus of quadriceps femoris).	股四头肌无力	股四头肌的无力（即股四头肌的肌肉纤维束）。
HP:0003733	肌肉组织异常,肢体异常	Thigh hypertrophy	Muscle hypertrophy affecting the thighs.	大腿肥大	大腿的肌肉肥大。
HP:0003736	肌肉组织异常	Autophagic vacuoles	The lysosomal-vacuolar pathway has a role in the controlled intracellular digestion of macromolecules such as protein complexes and organelles. This feature refers to the presence of an abnormally increased number of autophagic vacuoles in muscle tissue.	自噬空泡	溶酶体液泡通道具有控制细胞内消化大分子的作用，例如蛋白质复合物和细胞器。特征是肌肉组织中自噬小体数量增加。
HP:0003737	肌肉组织异常	Mitochondrial myopathy	A type of myopathy associated with mitochondrial disease and characterized by findings on biopsy such as ragged red muscle fibers.	线粒体肌病	一类与线粒体疾病有关的肌病，肌活检可见粗糙的红色肌纤维。
HP:0003738	肌肉组织异常	Exercise-induced myalgia	The occurrence of an unusually high amount of muscle pain following exercise.	运动诱发的肌肉痛	运动后发生的剧烈肌肉疼痛。
HP:0003739	神经系统异常	Myoclonic spasms	Marked by a sudden contraction of a muscle or muscle mass, resulting in sudden, rapid twitching of the face, trunk, or limbs.	肌阵挛性抽搐	表现为某个肌肉或肌群的突然收缩，引起面、躯干或肢体突然快速的抽动。
HP:0003740	肌肉组织异常	Myotonia with warm-up phenomenon	Myotonia that occurs after a period of rest and decreases with continuing exercise.	伴热身现象的肌强直	经过一段时间休息和持续运动停止后出现的肌强直。

HP:0003743	遗传模式	Genetic anticipation	A mode of inheritance in which the severity of a disorder increases or the age of onset decreases as the disorder is passed from one generation to the next.	遗传早现	#####
HP:0003744	遗传模式	Genetic anticipation with paternal anticipation bias	A type of genetic anticipation observed predominantly upon transmission from affected males.	偏向父系传递的遗传早现	#####
HP:0003745	遗传模式	Sporadic	Cases of the disease in question occur without a previous family history, i.e., as isolated cases without being transmitted from a parent and without other siblings being affected.	散发的	#####
HP:0003749	肌肉组织异常,肢体异常	Pelvic girdle muscle weakness	Weakness of the muscles of the pelvic girdle (also known as the hip girdle), that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the pelvis.	骨盆带肌无力	骨盆带（也称为臀肢带）肌肉无力，即骨盆周围肌肉肌张力低。
HP:0003750	肌肉组织异常	Increased muscle fatiguability	An abnormal, increased fatiguability of the musculature.	增多的肌肉易疲劳	肌肉组织的异常，增加疲惫状况。
HP:0003752	肌肉组织异常	Episodic flaccid weakness	Recurrent episodes of muscle flaccidity, a type of paralysis in which a muscle becomes soft and yields to passive stretching.	发作性弛缓无力	反复发作的肌无力，一种肌肉变软并产生被动拉伸的瘫痪。
HP:0003755	肌肉组织异常	Type 1 fibers relatively smaller than type 2 fibers	The presence of abnormal muscle fiber size such that type 1 fibers are smaller than type 2 fibers.	1型纤维相对于2型纤维小	1型纤维比2型的纤维更小的肌纤维大小异常。

HP:0003762	泌尿生殖系统异常	Uterus didelphys	A malformation of the `uterus` (FMA:17558) in which the uterus is present as a paired organ as a result of the failure of fusion of the mullerian ducts during embryogenesis.	双子宫	一种子宫畸形，因胚胎发育过程中苗勒管融合失败形成成对的子宫。
HP:0003763	神经系统异常	Bruxism	Bruxism is characterized by the grinding of the teeth including the clenching of the jaw and typically occur during sleep.	磨牙症	磨牙症的特点是磨牙齿包括紧咬下颌，通常在睡眠过程中出现。
HP:0003764	体壁的异常	Nevus	A nevus is a type of hamartoma that is a circumscribed stable malformation of the skin.	色素痣	色素痣是一种错构瘤，一般局限于皮肤且较为稳定。
HP:0003765	体壁的异常,免疫系统异常	Psoriasis	A skin abnormality characterized by redness and irritation, with thick, red skin that displays flaky, silver-white patches (scales).	银屑病	一种以片状红斑、表皮增厚且表面覆有易脱落的银白色鳞屑为特征的皮肤疾病。
HP:0003768	神经系统异常	Periodic paralysis	Episodes of muscle weakness.	周期性麻痹	肌无力发作。
HP:0003771	头部和颈部的异常	Pulp stones	Multiple punctate calcifications in the `dental pulp` (FMA:55631).	牙髓钙化	牙髓内多个点状钙化。
HP:0003774	泌尿生殖系统异常	Stage 5 chronic kidney disease	A degree of kidney failure severe enough to require dialysis or kidney transplantation for survival characterized by a severe reduction in glomerular filtration rate (less than 15 ml/min/1.73 m2) and other manifestations including increased serum creatinine.	慢性肾病5期	肾功能严重衰竭，需要透析或肾移植才能生存，其特征是肾小球滤过率严重降低（小于15毫升/分钟/ 1.73m平方米），还有其他临床表现，包括血清肌酐增加。
HP:0003777	体壁的异常	Pili torti	Pili (from Latin pilus, hair) torti (from Latin tortus, twisted) refers to short and brittle hairs that appear flattened and twisted when viewed through a microscope.	卷发	Pili（来自拉丁语pilus，毛发）torti（来自拉丁语tortus，卷曲）是指显微镜下可看到的短的、脆的、卷曲的毛发。

HP:0003797	肌肉组织异常,肢体异常	Limb-girdle muscle atrophy	Muscular atrophy affecting the muscles of the limb girdle.	肢带肌萎缩	肌萎缩累及肢带的肌肉。
HP:0003798	肌肉组织异常	Nemaline bodies	Nemaline rods are abnormal bodies that can occur in skeletal muscle fibers. The rods can be observed on histological analysis of muscle biopsy tissue or upon electron microscopy, where they appear either as extensions of sarcomeric Z-lines, in random array without obvious attachment to Z-lines (often in areas devoid of sarcomeres) or in large clusters localized at the sarcolemma or intermyofibrillar spaces.	杆状体	杆棒状线样体是一种异常小体，常发生于骨骼肌纤维。这种杆棒状结构可通过肌组织活检后病理光镜下或电镜下观察，表现为肌原纤维“Z”形或无规则形（常为肌小节缺乏区域），或发生于肌纤维膜或肌纤维内的大片成簇结构。

HP:0003803	肌肉组织异常	Type 1 muscle fiber predominance	An abnormal predominance of type I muscle fibers (in general, this feature can only be observed on muscle biopsy).	1型肌纤维优势	I型肌肉纤维的异常优势（在一般情况下，该功能只能在肌肉活组织检查观察到的）。
HP:0003805	肌肉组织异常	Rimmed vacuoles	Presence of abnormal vacuoles (membrane-bound organelles) in the sarcolemma. On histological staining with hematoxylin and eosin, rimmed vacuoles are popcorn-like clear vacuoles with a densely blue rim. The vacuoles are often associated with cytoplasmic and occasionally intranuclear eosinophilic inclusions.	镶边空泡	肌纤维膜存在异常细胞液泡（膜旁细胞器）。在组织染色与HE染色，镶边空泡是爆米花样有密集蓝色边缘的清亮空泡。液泡形成与细胞质和核内偶尔出现的嗜酸性夹杂物有关。
HP:0003808	肌肉组织异常	Abnormal muscle tone	The abnormal state of balanced tension in the tissues of the body, especially the muscles.	肌张力异常	人体组织尤其是肌肉平衡张力的异常状态。

HP:0004012	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Premature fusion of the radial epiphyseal plates	A premature fusion of the epiphyseal plates of the radius. Epiphyseal plates are located at the distal and proximal ends of the long bones, in this case of the radius and premature fusion will have an effect on the growth of the radial bone, inhibiting or at least disturbing the normal growth and development of the bone.	桡骨骺板过早融合	桡骨骨骺板过早融合。骺板位于长骨的远端和近端，过早融合将会影响桡骨的生长，抑制或至少扰乱骨骼的正常生长和发育。

HP:0004051	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Advanced ossification of the hand bones	Ossification of hand bones at an earlier age than normal.	手部骨骼骨化过早	手部骨骼早于正常年龄发生骨化。
HP:0004052	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Delayed ossification of the hand bones	Ossification of hand bones is less advanced than would be expected according to age-adjusted norms.	手骨骨化延迟	手部骨骼晚于相应年龄阶段发生骨化。
HP:0004053	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Dysharmonic maturation of the hand bones	Pattern of hand-wrist development does not fit the normal sequence of ossification of the individual bones of the hand.	手部骨骼成熟不平衡	手-手腕的发育方式不符合手各个骨骼骨化的正常顺序。
HP:0004054	骨骼系统异常	Sclerosis of hand bone	Osteosclerosis affecting one or more bones of the hand.	手骨硬化症	骨硬化累及一或多块手骨的骨硬化。
HP:0004057	肢体异常	Mitten deformity	Fusion of the hands and feet by a thin membrane of skin (scarring) seen in forms of dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa and leading to a &quot;mitten&quot; hand deformity.	连指手套状并指	手和脚通过一层薄的皮肤膜（疤痕）融合，在营养不良性大疱性表皮松解症中可见，并导致形成 “手套”样的手畸形。

HP:0004060	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Trident hand	A hand in which the fingers are of nearly equal length and deflected at the first interphalangeal joint, so as to give a forklike shape consisting of separation of the first and second as well as the third and fourth digits.	三叉手	手的手指几乎等长，在第一指关节发生偏折，呈现叉子形状，第一和第二指与第三和第四指分离。
HP:0004095	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Curved fingers	#####	手指弯曲	#####
HP:0004097	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Deviation of finger	Deviated fingers is a term that should be used if one or more fingers of the hand are deviated from their normal position, either to the radial or ulnar side. A deviation of a finger can be caused by an abnormal form of one or more of the phalanges of the affected finger, or by a deviation or displacement of one or more phalanges.	手指偏离	手指偏离指手的一个或多个手指从其正常位置偏离，偏向桡侧或尺侧。手指的偏离可能由一个或多个病变手指的指骨形态异常导致，或由一个或多个指骨的偏差或位移导致。
HP:0004099	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Macrodactyly	Significant increase in the length and girth of most or all of a digit compared to its contralateral digit (if unaffected) or compared to what would be expected for age/body build. The increased girth is accompanied by an increase in the dorso-ventral dimension AND the lateral dimension of the digit.	巨指	相对于对侧手指（未累及的），或者相对于预期的年龄/体型，手指的大部分或全部的长度和周长显著增加。周长的增加伴随着背腹尺寸的增加和横向尺寸的增加。
HP:0004100	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Abnormality of the 2nd finger	This term means any abnormal structure or form of the phalangeal bone of the 2nd finger. also known as the index finger.	食指的异常	第二手指（也称食指）的结构或形态异常。
HP:0004112	头部和颈部的异常	Midline nasal groove	An abnormal groove on the midline of the nose that may extend to the nasal tip.	中线鼻沟	鼻子上的可延展至鼻尖的异常中线沟槽。
HP:0004122	头部和颈部的异常	Midline defect of the nose	This term groups together three conditions that presumably represent different degrees of severity of a midline defect of the nose or nasal tip.	鼻中线缺陷	该术语组合了表现鼻子或者鼻尖的中线不同严重程度的三种缺陷情况。

HP:0004222	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger	A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the little finger of the hand, producing a &#39;ball-in-a-socket&#39; appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity &#39;angel-shaped&#39; epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.	小手指的末节指骨锥形骨骺	手的小指末节指骨具有锥形样骨骺，表现为“球-窝&#39;样外观。骨骺位于指骨的近端，正常情况下表现为扁平状。与此相关的&#39;天使形“骨骺是指骨远端明显的锥形骨骺合并假骨骺。

HP:0004234	肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	Bone-in-a-bone appearance of carpal bones	The bone-in-bone sign is a radiographic finding produced by increased sclerosis (abnormally dense bone) occurring intermittently with zones of relatively normal bone density. HP:0004302	肌肉组织异常	Functional motor problems.	#####	运动功能障碍	#####
HP:0004303	肌肉组织异常	Abnormality of muscle fibers	Any abnormality of the `skeletal muscle cell` (FMA:9727). Muscle fibers are subdivided into two types. Type I fibers are fatigue-resistant and rich in oxidative enzymes (they stain light with the myosin ATPase reaction), and type II fibers are fast-contracting, fatigue-prone, and rich in glycolytic enzymes (these fibers stain darkly). Normal muscle tissue has a random distribution of type I and type II fibers.	肌纤维异常	“骨骼肌细胞”异常（FMA:9727）。肌纤维被细分为两种类型:I型纤维抗疲劳并富含氧化酶（与肌球蛋白ATP酶反应染色浅），II型纤维收缩快速，易疲劳，并富含糖解酶（染色深）。正常肌肉组织随机分布I型和II型纤维。
HP:0004305	神经系统异常	Involuntary movements	Involuntary contractions of muscle leading to involuntary movements of extremities, neck, trunk, or face.	不自主运动	肌肉的不自主地收缩，导致四肢，颈部，躯干，或面部不自主运动。
HP:0004306	心血管系统异常	Abnormality of the endocardium	An abnormality of the `endocardium` (FMA:7280).	心内膜异常	心内膜的异常（FMA:7280）。
HP:0004307	心血管系统异常	Abnormal anatomic location of the heart	Normally,the heart is located in the thoracic cavity medial to the lungs and posterior to the sternum. Abnormal anatomic location of the heart is not located where it should be.	心脏解剖位置异常	正常情况下，心脏位于胸腔内两肺之间、胸骨后面。如果心脏位置不在此处，则为心脏解剖位置异常。
HP:0004308	心血管系统异常	Ventricular arrhythmia	Ventricular arrhythmias is a common arrhythmia occur in ventricle, including Ventricular extrasystoles, ventricular tachycardia, ventricular fibrillation, etc.	室性心律失常	室性心律失常指起源于心室的心律紊乱，是常见的心律失常，包括室性早搏(室早)、室性心动过速(室速)、心室颤动(室颤)等。
HP:0004309	心血管系统异常	Ventricular preexcitation	An abnormality in which the cardiac ventricles depolarize too early as a result of an abnormality of cardiac conduction pathways such as an accessory pathway.	心室预激	心室过早去极化造成心脏传导通路诸如附加通路的异常。

HP:0004321	泌尿生殖系统异常	Bladder fistula	The presence of a `fistula` (MPATH:70) connecting the `urinary bladder` (FMA:15900) to another organ or the skin. The fistula can involve the bowel, the vagina, or rarely, the skin.	膀胱瘘管	膀胱与其它器官或皮肤之间形成瘘管。瘘管可累及肠道、阴道，与（腹壁）皮肤的少见。
HP:0004322	生长异常	Short stature	A height below that which is expected according to age and gender norms. Although there is no universally accepted definition of short stature, many refer to &quot;short stature&quot; as height more than 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender (or below the 3rd percentile for age and gender dependent norms).	身材矮小	身高低于该年龄性别预期身高的正常范围。虽然没有普遍接受的身材矮小的定义，许多 “身材矮小”的定义指身高低于该年龄同性别平均值超过2个标准差（或位于该年龄同性别身高第3百分位以下）。

HP:0004362	神经系统异常,消化系统异常	Abnormality of the enteric ganglia	An abnormality of the enteric nervous system, which comprises two types of ganglia, the myenteric (Auerbach&#39;s) and submucosal (Meissner&#39;s) plexuses. The enteric nervous system functions to control gut movement, fluid exchange between the gut and its lumen, and local blood flow.	肠神经节异常	肠神经系统的异常；肠神经系统包括两种类型的神经节，肌间（Auerbach's）神经丛和粘膜下（Meissner's）神经丛。肠神经系统的功能是控制肠道运动、肠道与其内腔之间的液体交换与局部血流。

HP:0004374	神经系统异常	Hemiplegia/hemiparesis	Loss of strength in the arm, leg, and sometimes face on one side of the body. Hemiplegia refers to a severe or complete loss of strength, whereas hemiparesis refers to a relatively mild loss of strength.	偏瘫/轻偏瘫	一侧上下肢的力量丧失，有时累及面部。偏瘫指严重或完全的力量丧失，而轻偏瘫指相对轻度的力量丧失。

HP:0004428	头部和颈部的异常	Elfin facies	This is a description previously used to describe a facial form characterized by a short, upturned nose, wide mouth, widely spaced eyes, and full cheeks. Because of the imprecision in this definition it is preferable to describe these features precisely. This term is retained because it was often used in the past, but it should not be used for new annotations.	小精灵脸	本词条此前用于描述如下的特殊脸形: 短而上翘的鼻子，宽嘴，间隔远的双眼，以及饱满的脸颊。因为这个定义并不精确，所以最好精确地描述这些特征。保留本词条是因为它在过去较常用，但在新注释中应避免使用。
HP:0004429	免疫系统异常	Recurrent viral infections	Increased susceptibility to viral infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of viral infection.	反复病毒感染	病毒感染的易感性增加，表现为反复发作的病毒感染。
HP:0004430	免疫系统异常	Severe combined immunodeficiency	Severe combine immunodeficiency (SCID) is a primary immune deficiency that is characterized by a severe defect in both the T- and B-lymphocyte systems.	重症联合免疫缺陷	重症联合免疫缺陷（SCID）是一种原发性免疫缺陷，其特征是T和B淋巴细胞系统的严重缺陷。

HP:0004433	代谢紊乱/稳态失衡,血液和造血组织异常,免疫系统异常	Secretory IgA deficiency	Deficiency of secretory IgA (polymers of 2-4 IgA monomers are linked by two additional chains) and is the  primary antibody response at the mucosal level, where it forms immune complexes with pathogens and allergens.	分泌型IgA缺乏症	分泌型IgA缺乏（2-4 个IgA单体的聚合物，由两个附加的链连接）。分泌型IgA是在粘膜水平应答的主要抗原，其在粘膜形成并参与病原体和过敏原的初级应答。

HP:0004448	消化系统异常	Fulminant hepatic failure	Hepatic failure refers to the inability of the liver to perform its normal synthetic and metabolic functions, which can result in coagulopathy and alteration in the mental status of a previously healthy individual. Hepatic failure is defined as fulminant if there is onset of encephalopathy within 4 weeks of the onset of symptoms in a patient with a previously healthy liver.	暴发性肝衰竭	肝衰竭是指肝脏无法行使其正常的合成和代谢功能，这将导致既往健康个体的凝血异常及精神状态改变。若既往肝脏正常的病人在起病4周内出现脑病发作，则将肝衰竭定义为爆发性。

HP:0004482	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Relative macrocephaly	A relatively mild degree of macrocephaly in which the head circumference is not above two standard deviations from the mean, but appears dysproportionately large when other factors such as body stature are taken into account.	相对大头畸形	头的体积相对增大，没有达到平均值+2倍标准差，但是考虑到体型等因素，头的体积不成比例地大。

HP:0004487	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Acrobrachycephaly	An abnormality of head shape characterized by the presence of a short, wide head as well as a pointy or conical form of the top of the head owing to premature closure of the coronal and lambdoid sutures.	尖扁头畸形	一种头部形状的异常，特征是存在短而宽及尖锥形的头部形状，是由于冠状和人字缝过早融合所致。

HP:0004712	泌尿生殖系统异常	Renal malrotation	An abnormality of the normal developmental rotation of the kidney leading to an abnormal orientation of the kidney.	肾旋转不良	肾脏发育时正常情况下要发生旋转，这个过程发生异常后导致肾脏方位异常。
HP:0004713	泌尿生殖系统异常	Reversible renal failure	Acute renal failure with resolution of manifestations.	可逆性肾功能衰竭	临床表现可以消除的急性肾功能衰竭。
HP:0004717	泌尿生殖系统异常	Axial malrotation of the kidney	An abnormality of the normal developmental rotation of the kidney leading to an abnormal axial orientation of the kidney.	肾轴向旋转异常	肾脏发育过程正常中轴向旋转发生异常，导致肾脏轴向异常。
HP:0004719	泌尿生殖系统异常	Hyperechogenic kidneys	An increase in amplitude of waves returned in ultrasonography of the kidney, which is generally displayed as increased brightness of the signal.	肾脏回声增强	肾脏超声时可见波形振幅增大，通常显示为信号亮度的增加。
HP:0004722	泌尿生殖系统异常	Thickening of the glomerular basement membrane	Increase in thickness of the basal lamina of the glomerulus of the kidney.	肾小球基底膜增厚	肾脏肾小球基底膜的厚度增加。
HP:0004724	泌尿生殖系统异常	Calcium nephrolithiasis	The presence of calcium-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.	钙性肾结石	肾脏内有含钙的结石。
HP:0004727	泌尿生殖系统异常	Impaired renal concentrating ability	A defect in the ability to concentrate the urine.	肾浓缩功能障碍	浓缩尿液能力的缺陷。
HP:0004729	泌尿生殖系统异常	Acute tubulointerstitial nephritis	Acute inflammation of the kidney affecting the interstitium of the kidneys surrounding the tubules.	急性肾小管间质性肾炎	肾脏的急性炎症，影响肾小管周围间质。
HP:0004732	泌尿生殖系统异常	Impaired renal uric acid clearance	A reduction in the ability of the kidneys to remove uric acid from the serum.	肾尿酸廓清障碍	肾脏从血清中清除尿酸的能力降低。
HP:0004734	泌尿生殖系统异常	Renal cortical microcysts	Cysts of microscopic size confined to the `cortex of the kidney` (FMA:15581).	肾皮质微小囊肿	局限于肾皮层的微小囊肿。
HP:0004736	泌尿生殖系统异常	Crossed fused renal ectopia	A developmental anomaly in which the kidneys are fused and localized on the same side of the midline. This anomaly is thought to result from disruption of the normal embryologic migration of the kidneys.	融合肾移向一侧	一种肾脏发育异常，肾脏融合到一起，位于中线一侧。这种异常被认为是胚胎期肾脏迁移异常造成的。
HP:0004737	泌尿生殖系统异常	Global glomerulosclerosis	Complete and diffuse scarring of glomerulus.	完全性肾小球硬化症	肾小球完全弥漫性疤痕。

HP:0004746	泌尿生殖系统异常,免疫系统异常	Dense deposit disease	A type of membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis characterized by electron dense deposits at the glomerular basement membrane.	致密物沉积病	一种肾基地膜增生性肾小球肾炎，特征是肾小球基底膜电子致密物沉积。
HP:0004749	心血管系统异常	Atrial flutter	A type of atrial arrhythmia characterized by atrial rates of between 240 and 400 beats per minute and some degree of atrioventricular node conduction block. Typically, the ventricular rate is half the atrial rate. In the EKG; atrial flutter waves are observed as sawtooth-like atrial activity. Pathophysiologically, atrial flutter is a form of atrial reentry in which there is a premature electrical impulse creates a self-propagating circuit.	心房扑动	一种240~400次/min 心跳的房性心律失常，一定程度的房室结传导阻滞。心室率通常是心房率的一半。心电图显示，心房扑动波呈现锯齿状的心房活动。病理生理学上，心房扑动是心房折返的一种。
HP:0004751	心血管系统异常	Paroxysmal ventricular tachycardia	Not persistently ventricular tachycardia	阵发性室性心动过速	非持续性的室性心动过速，偶尔发作，可自行终止。
HP:0004752	心血管系统异常	Congenital atrioventricular dissociation	A form of atrioventricular (AV) dissociation (i.e., the atria and the ventricles are under the control of two separate pacemakers) with congenital onset.	先天性房室分离	先天性发病的房室分离（即心房和心室受两个独立的起搏点控制）。
HP:0004754	心血管系统异常	Permanent atrial fibrillation	AF that cannot be successfully terminated by cardioversion, and longstanding (more than 1 year) AF, where cardioversion is not indicated or has not been attempted, is termed permanent.	永久性房颤	不能由复律成功终止，持续性发生（超过1年），其中复律无效或未实行复律，被称为永久性房颤。
HP:0004755	心血管系统异常	Supraventricular tachycardia	Supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) is an abnormally increased heart rate (over 100 beats per minute at rest) with origin above the level of the ventricles.	室上性心动过速	室上性心动过速（SVT）是一种与原正常心室率相比异常增加的心率（静息状态每分钟超过100次）。
HP:0004756	心血管系统异常	Ventricular tachycardia	A type of regular and fast heart rate that arises from improper electrical activity in the ventricles of the heart.	室性心动过速	起源于心室的一种快速、规律性异常的心电活动。
HP:0004757	心血管系统异常	Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation	Episodes of atrial fibrillation that typically last for several hours up to one day and terminate spontaneously.	阵发性房颤	房颤发作通常持续几个小时到一天，并自发地终止。
HP:0004758	心血管系统异常	Effort-induced polymorphic ventricular tachycardias	Effort-induced polymorphic ventricular tachycardias，which is defined as a ventricular rhythm at a rate greater than 100 beats per minute with a continuously varying QRS complex morphology in any recorded electrocardiographic (ECG) lead.	劳力诱导型多形性室性心动过速	多形性室性心动过速是指在任何心电图记录导联上均显示室性心动过速伴连续变化的QRS波群,节律不规则,频率 100~250次/min。劳力诱导后产生的多形性室性心动过速即劳力诱导型多形性室性心动过速。

HP:0004904	内分泌系统异常,代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	Maturity-onset diabetes of the young	The term Maturity-onset diabetes of the young (MODY) was initially used for patients diagnosed with fasting hyperglycemia that could be treated without insulin for more than two years, where the initial diagnosis was made at a young age (under 25 years). Thus, MODY combines characteristics of type 1 diabetes (young age at diagnosis) and type 2 diabetes (less insulin dependence than type 1 diabetes). The term MODY is now most often used to refer to a group of monogenic diseases with these characteristics. Here, the term is used to describe hyperglycemia diagnosed at a young age with no or minor insulin dependency, no evidence of insulin resistence, and lack of evidence of autoimmune destruction of the beta cells.	成年发病性青少年糖尿病	青少年的成年发病性糖尿病（MODY）最初是用于描述有空腹高血糖症，而且可以不用胰岛素治疗两年以上的病人，而对这些病人的最初诊断是在（低于25岁）较年轻的时候作出的。因此，MODY结合了1型糖尿病（诊断时年龄较年轻）和2型糖尿病（比1型糖尿病胰岛素依赖较少）的特点。术语MODY现在经常用来指一组具有如下特点的单基因疾病，即在年轻时确诊的高血糖症，没有胰岛素依赖或有轻微胰岛素依赖，没有胰岛素抵抗，并且缺乏β细胞自身免疫损伤的证据。

HP:0005136	心血管系统异常,骨骼系统异常	Premature calcification of mitral annulus	Early occurance of mitral annular calcification (MAC), which is a common degenerative process involving the fibrous annulus of the mitral valve, and is generally an incidental finding associated with aging.	二尖瓣环过早钙化	二尖瓣环钙化（MAC）是涉及二尖瓣纤维环的一个常见退行性变，通常在老龄人群中被偶然发现。如果过早出现，则为二尖瓣环过早钙化。
HP:0005141	心血管系统异常	Episodes of ventricular tachycardia	Episodes of ventricular tachycardia, which is an abnormally rapid ventricular rhythm with wide QRS complexes,usually in excess of 150 per minute. It is generated within the ventricle,below the BUNDLE OF HIS.	阵发性室性心动过速	室性心动过速是指起源于希氏束分叉处以下的频率在150/分以上的心动过速，伴有宽大畸形QRS波组成。不持续的、自发终止的室性心动过速即阵发性室性心动过速。

HP:0005155	心血管系统异常	Ventricular escape rhythms	When the impulse from sinoatrial node or intra-atrial can not transmitted on time, the lower level of pacemaker atrioventricular transition area, should make atrioventricular transition zone from cardiac to control the ventricular.  If atrioventricular transition zone is also affected by the same reason and do not escape beat, the ventricular pacemaker impulse to control the ventricular, means ventricular escape. Three or more consecutive ventricular escape is ventricular escape arrhythm.	室性逸搏心律	当窦房结或心房内的激动由于某些原因不能按时下传，则下一级的起搏点房室交接区，应发出房室交接区逸搏来控制心室。如果房室交接区也受到与窦房结等相同原因的影响，不能发出逸搏时，则心室起搏点即发出激动来控制心室，形成室性逸搏。连续3个或3个以上的室性逸搏，即构成室性逸搏心律。

HP:0005160	心血管系统异常,呼吸系统异常	Total anomalous pulmonary venous return	Total anomalous pulmonary venous return refers to a congenital malformation in which all four pulmonary veins do not connect normally to the left atrium, but instead drain abnormally to the right atrium.	全肺静脉回流异常	全肺静脉回流异常是一种先天性畸形，全部四个肺静脉没有连接到左心房，而是将所有血液流入到了右心房。

HP:0005165	心血管系统异常	Shortened PR interval	Reduced time for the  PR interval (beginning of the P wave to the beginning of the QRS complex). In adults, normal values are 120 to 200 ms long.	PR间期缩短	为PR间期时间减少（从P波起始处到QRS波群的开头）。在成人中，正常值为120〜200毫秒。
HP:0005168	心血管系统异常	Elevated right atrial pressure	Abnormal increase in right atrial pressure, which is the pressure of blood in the right atrium （RAP）of the heart. RAP reflects the amount of blood returning to the heart and the ability of the heart to pump the blood into the arterial system.	右心房压力升高	心脏右心房血液压力异常升高。右心房压力反映的是心脏回流血液量以及心脏泵血进入动脉系统的能力。
HP:0005170	心血管系统异常	Complete heart block with broad RS complexes	All impulse can not conduct from atrial to ventricle with broad RS complexes.	完全性心传导阻滞伴宽RS波群	全部心房冲动均不能传导至心室，伴随RS波群增宽。

HP:0005174	心血管系统异常	Membranous subvalvular aortic stenosis	Subvalvular stenosis is caused by a diaphragm-like membrane. The stenosis is clinically manifested like any other form of aortic stenosis but is often associated with some aortic insufficiency.	膜性主动脉瓣下狭窄	瓣下狭窄是由一个隔板状膜引起的。患者临床表现与其它形式的主动脉狭窄相似，但往往与主动脉瓣关闭不全有关。

HP:0005212	消化系统异常	Anal mucosal leukoplakia	Leukoplakia is a precancerous dermatosis of mucous membranes analogous Leukoplakia is basically a chronic inflammatory hypertrophy in which anaplasia and malignant dyskeratosis may develop and subsequently advance to an invasive squamous cell cancer. The clinical diagnosis of primary anal leukoplakia is indicated by single or multiple slightly raised,irregular, marginated, grayish-white keratinized&#39; patches in the anal canal. Tissue biopsy is necessary for confirmation.	肛门粘膜白斑	白斑是粘膜类似物的一种癌前皮肤病变。白斑本质上是一种慢性炎症性肥大，可能会发展为间变及恶性异常角化，随后进展至侵袭性鳞状细胞癌。位于肛管的单个或多个微微隆起、不规则、有边缘的、灰白色角化的白斑，可提示原发性肛门白斑的临床诊断。确认须进行组织活检。

HP:0005442	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Widely patent coronal suture	The presence of a coronal suture (the cranial suture that separates the frontal and parietal bones) that is not ossified but rather wide open at an age when it is normally closed.	冠状缝未闭	冠状缝（额骨与顶骨之间的缝隙）到达一定年龄后应闭合而尚未闭合的状态。
HP:0005445	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Widened posterior fossa	An abnormally wide configuration of the posterior cranial fossa.	后颅窝增宽畸形	后颅窝异常增宽的一种畸形。
HP:0005446	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Obtuse angle of mandible	Abnormally flat (obtuse) angle of the mandible. The angle of the mandibular, located at the junction between the body and the ramus of the mandible, is normally close to being a right angle. This terms describes an abnormal increase of this angle such that the mandible appears flatter than normal.	下颌钝角	下颌角异常平坦（钝角）。下颌角，位于下颌体和下颌支之间形成的角度，通常接近为一个直角。这个术语描述了下颌角异常增大，使得下颌表现得比正常更平坦。
HP:0005449	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Bridged sella turcica	#####	桥形蝶鞍	#####
HP:0005450	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Calvarial osteosclerosis	An increase in bone density affecting the calvaria (roof of the skull).	颅骨硬化	颅盖（颅骨顶）的骨密度增加。
HP:0005451	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Decreased cranial base ossification	#####	颅底骨化减少	#####
HP:0005452		Obliteration of frontal sinuses	#####	额窦闭塞	#####

HP:0005456	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Absent ethmoidal sinuses	Lack (aplasia) of the `ethmoidal sinus` (FMA:84115).	筛窦缺如	#####
HP:0005458	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Premature closure of fontanelles	Normally, the posterior and lateral fontanelles are obliterated by about six months after birth, the anterior fontanelle closes by about the middle of the second year. This term refers to the situation in which the fontanelles close at an inappropriately early time point.	囟门过早闭合	通常情况下，后侧和外侧囟门在出生后约六个月闭合，前囟门大约第二年中间闭合。这个术语是指囟门不适当的过早闭合的情况。

HP:0005466	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Frontal bone hypoplasia	Underdevelopment of the `frontal bone` (FMA:52734).	额骨发育不全	额骨发育不全。

HP:0005474	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Decreased calvarial ossification	Abnormal reduction in ossification of the calvaria (roof of the skull consisting of the frontal bone, parietal bones, temporal bones, and occipital bone).	颅骨骨化减少	颅顶骨（头顶骨包括额骨，顶骨，颞骨，和枕骨）骨化异常减少
HP:0005476	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Widely patent sagittal suture	The presence of a sagittal suture (the cranial suture that separates the left and right parietal bones) that is not ossified but rather wide open at an age when it is normally closed.	矢状缝未闭	矢状缝（左右两顶骨之间的缝隙）到达一定年龄后应闭合而尚未闭合的状态。
HP:0005477	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Progressive sclerosis of skull base	Progressively increasing bone density of the skull base without significant changes in bony contour.	颅底渐进性硬化症	#####

HP:0005484	神经系统异常,骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Postnatal microcephaly	Microcephaly (HP:0000252) with onset in the postnatal period, that is, the head circumference is in the normal range at birth but falls behind normal values later in development.	出生后小头畸形	出生后小头畸形，即出生时头围在正常范围内，但后来发育中落后于正常值。
HP:0005486	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Small fontanelle	A fontanelle that is small for age.	小囟门	囟门较同龄人相对偏小。

HP:0005490	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Postnatal macrocephaly	The postnatal development of an abnormally large skull (macrocephaly).	出生后巨头畸形	出生后长成异常大的头骨（大头畸形）。

HP:0005495	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Metopic suture patent to nasal root	The frontal suture divides the two halves of the frontal bone in infants and usually fuses by the age of six years. The suture runs from the bregma (the point on the skull at which the coronal suture is intersected perpendicularly by the sagittal suture) to the nasion or nasal root. This term applies if the suture is widely patent from bregma to nasal root.	额缝开放至鼻根	前额缝合在婴儿期分割成前额骨两半，通常到六岁时融合。缝线从前囟（在头盖骨上位于冠状缝和矢状缝垂直相交的点）到鼻根。本术语适用于从前囟到鼻根的颅缝开大。
HP:0005498	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Midline skin dimples over anterior/posterior fontanelles	#####	前/后囟门中线皮肤凹陷	#####
HP:0005502	血液和造血组织异常	Increased red cell osmotic fragility	#####	红细胞渗透脆性增加	#####
HP:0005505	血液和造血组织异常	Refractory anemia	#####	难治性贫血	#####
HP:0005506	肿瘤,血液和造血组织异常,免疫系统异常	Chronic myelogenous leukemia	A myeloproliferative disorder characterized by increased proliferation of the granulocytic cell line without the loss of their capacity to differentiate.	慢性骨髓细胞白血病	骨髓增生性疾病，其特点的粒细胞系增殖增加但仍有分化能力。
HP:0005507	血液和造血组织异常	Hemoglobin Barts	Normal adult hemoglobin is composed of two chains each of alpha and beta globin. Hb Barts (Hemoglobin Barts) is a tetramer with four gamma globin chains, and is essentially pathognomonic for one or another form of alpha thalassemia. Hb Barts has an extremely high affinity for oxygen, resulting in almost no oxygen delivery to the tissues.	Barts 血红蛋白	正常成人血红蛋白由两个α球蛋白链和两个β球蛋白链构成。Barts血红蛋白是由四个γ球蛋白链形成的四聚体，是地中海贫血的另一种病理形式。Barts血红蛋白对氧具有非常高的亲和力，导致几乎没有氧气输送到组织。
HP:0005508	肿瘤,代谢紊乱/稳态失衡,血液和造血组织异常,免疫系统异常	Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia	A malignant monoclonal gammopathy characterized by a high level of an IgM monoclonal protein.	华氏巨球蛋白血症	一种恶性单克隆丙种球蛋白病，特征为高水平的IgM 蛋白单克隆异常增高。
HP:0005510	血液和造血组织异常	Transient erythroblastopenia	A transient reduction in the number of `erythroblasts` (CL:0000765) in the circulation.	短暂性幼红细胞减少症	血循环中幼红细胞的数量暂时性减少。
HP:0005511	血液和造血组织异常	Heinz body anemia	Anemia characterized by abnormal intracellular inclusions, composed of denatured hemoglobin, found on the membrane of red blood cells.	包涵体贫血	一种以细胞内由变性血红蛋白沉积形成的包涵体为特征的贫血。

HP:0005513	血液和造血组织异常	Increased megakaryocyte count	Increased `megakaryocyte` (CL:0000556) number, i.e., of platelet precursor cells, present in the bone marrow.	巨核细胞计数增加	巨核细胞（CL:0000556）的数目增加。巨核细胞是血小板的前体细胞，存在于骨髓中。
HP:0005517	肿瘤,血液和造血组织异常	T-cell lymphoma/leukemia	A type of T-cell lymphoma in which cancerous T-cells may present in the blood (leukemia), lymph nodes (lymphoma), skin or in multiple areas.	T细胞淋巴瘤/白血病	一型T细胞淋巴瘤，其中恶性T细胞可以存在于血液中（白血病），淋巴结（淋巴瘤），皮肤或多个区域。
HP:0005518	血液和造血组织异常	Erythrocyte macrocytosis	Larger than normal size of erythrocytes.	巨红细胞症	比红细胞的正常体积大。
HP:0005520	血液和造血组织异常	Chronic disseminated intravascular coagulation	A chronic form of `disseminated intravascular coagulation` (HP:0005521) in which a persistent weak or intermittent activating stimulus is present and destruction and production of coagulation factors and platelets are balanced.	慢性弥漫性血管内凝血	慢性发生的弥漫性血管内凝血（HP:0005521），存在持久但较弱或间歇激活的刺激因素，凝血因子和血小板的破坏和生产是平衡的。
HP:0005521	血液和造血组织异常	Disseminated intravascular coagulation	Disseminated intravascular coagulation is characterized by the widespread activation of coagulation, which results in the intravascular formation of fibrin and ultimately thrombotic occlusion of small and midsize vessels.	弥漫性血管内凝血	弥漫性血管内凝血以凝血普遍激活为特点，这导致在血管内形成血纤维蛋白和在中小型血管内最终血栓闭塞。
HP:0005522	血液和造血组织异常	Pyridoxine-responsive sideroblastic anemia	A type of `sideroblastic anemia` (HP:0001924) that is alleviated by pyridoxine (vitamin B-6) treatment.	吡哆醇应答型铁粒幼细胞性贫血	一种用吡哆醇（维生素B-6）治疗可缓解的铁粒幼细胞贫血（HP:0001924）。

HP:0005531	肿瘤,血液和造血组织异常,免疫系统异常	Biphenotypic acute leukaemia	A type of actue leukemia with features characteristic of both the myeloid and lymphoid lineages. These leukemias are for this reason are designated mixed-lineage, hybrid or biphenotypic acute leukemias.	双表型急性白血病	一种急性白血病，以同时影响髓系和淋巴细胞系为特征。这些白血病细胞为混合细胞，又称混合型或双表型急性白血病。

HP:0005541	血液和造血组织异常,免疫系统异常	Congenital agranulocytosis	Congenital onset of a marked decrease in the number of `granulocytes` (CL:0000094).	先天性粒细胞缺乏症	先天性发病的粒细胞（CL:0000094）的数量显著减少。
HP:0005542	血液和造血组织异常	Prolonged whole-blood clotting time	An abnormal prolongation (delay) in the time required by whole blood to produce a visible clot.	全血凝血时间延长	由全血到凝固为凝块所需要的时间异常延长（延迟）。
HP:0005543	血液和造血组织异常	Reduced protein C activity	An `abnormality of coagulation` (HP:0001928) related to a `decreased concentration` (PATO:0001163) of `vitamin K-dependent protein C` (PR:000013261). Protein C is activated to protein Ca by thrombin bound to thrombomodulin. Activated protein C degrades factors VIIIa and Va.	蛋白C活性降低	与`维生素K依赖的蛋白C`（PR:000013261）的浓度（PATO:0001163）下降相关的凝血异常（HP:0001928）。凝血酶结合于血栓调节素后激活蛋白C形成活化的蛋白Ca。活化的蛋白C可以降解Ⅷa因子和Va因子。

HP:0005548	血液和造血组织异常	Megakaryocytopenia	A `reduced count` (PATO:0002001) of `megakaryocytes` (CL:0000556).	巨核细胞减少症	巨核细胞（CL:0000556）计数减少（0002001 PATO）。
HP:0005549	血液和造血组织异常,免疫系统异常	Congenital neutropenia	A form of `neutropenia` (HP:0001875) with congenital onset.	先天性中性粒细胞减少症	先天性发病的中性粒细胞减少的一种形式（HP:0001875）。
HP:0005550	肿瘤,血液和造血组织异常,免疫系统异常	Chronic lymphatic leukemia	A chronic lymphocytic/lymphatic/lymphoblastic leukemia (CLL) is a neoplastic disease characterized by proliferation and accumulation (blood, marrow and lymphoid organs) of morphologically mature but immunologically dysfunctional lymphocytes. A CLL is always a B-cell lymphocytic leukemia as there are no reports of cases of T-cell lymphocytic leukemias.	慢性淋巴性白血病	慢性淋巴细胞/淋巴性/成淋巴母细胞性白血病（CLL），是一种血液肿瘤性疾病。该疾病的特征是在血液中发现形态成熟但免疫功能失调的淋巴细胞，在骨髓和淋巴器官的增殖和积累。因为没有T细胞淋巴细胞白血病的病例报告，慢性淋巴性白血病是一个B细胞淋巴细胞性白血病。
HP:0005556	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Abnormality of the metopic suture	The frontal suture divides the two halves of the frontal bone of the skull in infants and children and generally undergoes fusion by the age of six. A persistent frontal suture is referred to as a &quot;metopic suture&quot;.	额缝异常	前额缝把婴儿和儿童头骨的额骨平分为两部分。这两半一般到六岁完全融合。持久性前额缝隙被称为“额骨缝”。
HP:0005557	骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	Abnormality of the zygomatic arch	An abnormality of the `zygomatic arch` (FMA:53120), also known as the cheek bone.	颧弓异常	颧弓的异常。颧弓也被称为颊骨。
HP:0005558	肿瘤,血液和造血组织异常,免疫系统异常	Chronic leukemia	#####	慢性白血病	#####
HP:0005559	代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	Abnormality of the kinin-kallikrein system	#####	激肽 - 激肽释放酶系统的异常	#####
HP:0005560	血液和造血组织异常	Imbalanced hemoglobin synthesis	Normal hemoglobin synthesis is characterized by production of equal amounts of alpha and beta globins. This term refers to a deviation from this pattern and is the main characteristic of the various forms of thalassemia.	血红蛋白合成失衡	正常血红蛋白合成的特点是产生等量的α和β球蛋白。这一术语指α和β球蛋白比例的失衡，是各种形式地中海贫血的主要特征。
HP:0005561	血液和造血组织异常	Abnormality of bone marrow cell morphology	An anomaly of the form or number of cells in the `bone marrow` (FMA:9608).	骨髓细胞形态异常	骨髓细胞的形态或数量异常（FMA:9608）。
HP:0005562	泌尿生殖系统异常	Multiple renal cysts	The presence of many cysts in the kidney.	多发性肾囊肿	肾多个囊肿形成。
